author: {'steamid': '76561198882626882', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1880, 'playtime_at_review': 1604, 'last_played': 1712470458}
review:
This game is flawed, but I don't think that stops it from being good. Just being a BERSERK game carries it a long way, because the story and characters are amazing even if the presentation is a shell of what we get in the manga. Read the manga before you play this game, or at least watch one of the anime, either the old one or the movie trilogy (that actually is used for in-game cutscenes).

The biggest problems with this game are the repetitiveness that naturally comes with the Warriors sub-genre of hack and slash games, and poor optimization for PC.

I have had several crashes in the middle of an event or cutscene or at the end of one. When this happens after beating a mission, it forces you to replay that mission because for some reason the game doesn't save until after all the cutscenes and events are over. So a few times I spent 10-20 minutes taking my time with a mission, then the game crashes after I beat it, so now I have to do it again and it's not as fun this time. Another annoying thing is this prompt to "activate Windows 7 compatibility mode" every time the game starts; I turned it on, but it doesn't seem to have changed anything, it didn't fix the crashing. To prevent crashing, I just try skipping the cutscene (which sometimes crashes the game) until it works.

All that being said, I didn't have any other glitches or bugs that messed with my experience. One time an enemy caught me in a corner and I couldn't move, but I realized that was because the lock-on mechanic breaks the camera, so I just had to turn it off. The game otherwise runs smoothly, no performance issues.

Now, the biggest thing you should look at before deciding to buy the game is the gameplay itself. It's just combat and basically nothing else. The combat is simple, different combinations of light and heavy attacks give you different animation sets that will damage enemies in various ways. There are sub-weapons that can be used to stun stronger enemies but are useless for causing damage. All characters have completely different fighting styles and movement speed, so they all feel unique. Each character has their own ultimate attack that can be activated by killing enough enemies to fill up a bar. Most of the time, you'll be fighting huge swarms of enemies and chopping them all down into blood and guts. There are many stronger characters of more importance, basically mini bosses, scattered across each level. The actual boss fights against named characters are quite fun in my opinion, but I never had too much trouble beating them (I played on Normal difficulty, there are 2 levels of difficulty that are higher). Levels consist of various objectives but always have lots of fighting, swinging your sword is 99% of what you'll be doing, the other 1% being moving to the next objective marker.

Of course the story is the same as the manga (with MANY details removed for the sake of brevity and focus on gameplay) so the story in this game is great despite being a rather poor adaptation in most aspects, with the amazing artwork and vibes of the manga being replaced with standard Japanese-game-style dialogue events. Cutscenes are taken directly from the anime movie trilogy, but they've been heavily censored.

Whether or not I'd recommend this to a particular person is hard to say, because I think the repetitive nature of the levels may make it too boring for a lot of people. It's certainly not worth the full $60 that it's always at; you should do what I did and wait months until it eventually goes on sale for $24, and maybe grab the DLC levels too.

I like this game, but to know if you will, just take a look at a clip of the game, figure out whether or not you'd find that gameplay loop satisfying, and decide how much you'd enjoy playing a BERSERK game simply because it's a BERSERK game. If it's not compelling enough, that makes sense; I was never interested in Warriors games until I found this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176197141', 'num_games_owned': 2549, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1703484527}
review:
[h2]Dentro de Berserk y La Banda del Halc√≥n[/h2]

BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk es un t√≠tulo de acci√≥n y aventuras desarrollado por Omega Force y publicado por Koei Tecmo, que se basa en el popular manga y anime ‚ÄúBerserk‚Äù creado por Kentaro Miura. La adaptaci√≥n al mundo de los videojuegos intenta ofrecer a los jugadores una experiencia inmersiva en el oscuro y brutal universo de la serie.

Historia y Ambientaci√≥n:
La trama del juego sigue principalmente el arco narrativo del manga, centr√°ndose en el protagonista Guts, un guerrero mercenario en busca de venganza contra los demonios que lo atormentan. La historia se presenta a trav√©s de cinem√°ticas y escenas del juego que capturan fielmente la esencia sombr√≠a y visceral de la obra original. El juego comienza en lo que se conoce como la saga de la Edad Dorada. La historia prosigue con su posterior encuentro con Griffith, su incorporaci√≥n a la Banda del Halc√≥n y la escalada de popularidad de la misma hasta los acontecimientos del Eclipse. Lamentablemente, la estructura de las misiones es extremadamente lineal.

Jugabilidad:
Si hab√©is jugado alguna vez a alg√∫n musou ya sep√°is lo que os vais a encontrar aqu√≠. El juego combina elementos de hack and slash con mec√°nicas de juego de rol. Podemos controlar a varios personajes ic√≥nicos de la serie, cada uno con su propio estilo de combate √∫nico y habilidades especiales. La acci√≥n es intensa y sangrienta, con batallas contra hordas de enemigos y jefes poderosos que ofrecen un desaf√≠o significativo. El sistema de progresi√≥n permite mejorar las habilidades de los personajes, desbloquear nuevas t√©cnicas y adquirir equipo m√°s poderoso a medida que avanzan en la historia. Los controles son muy b√°sicos, con un ataque flojo y otro fuerte y que en estos casos, acaba siendo un machaca botones. La mec√°nica es realmente simple y no se le puede pedir mucho m√°s.

Gr√°ficos y Sonido:
Visualmente, el juego intenta capturar el estilo art√≠stico del anime m√°s moderno. Ojal√° uno con la est√©tica de la serie de animaci√≥n de 1997. Mantiene un poco de esa esencia visceral, pero viene con censura en sus secuencias. El problema con estos t√≠tulos es la falta de cari√±o en sus decorados y en el entorno, quedando t√©cnicamente y visualmente algo vac√≠os y desfasados. Se le echa en falta un poco m√°s de mimo y de elaboraci√≥n. La banda sonora acompa√±a correctamente.

Una franquicia que se merec√≠a algo mejor. C√≥mpralo si te interesa en una buena oferta, ya que en general tiene bastantes carencias. Especialmente recomendado a jugadores de musou. Los fans imagino que buscaran algo m√°s parecido a Sword of Berserk: Guts‚Äô Rage, cosa que aqu√≠ no vas a encontrar y quedes decepcionado. Simple y lineal, termina siendo bastante mon√≥tono qued√°ndose a medio camino. No est√° localizado al castellano. Por desgracia lo poco que tenemos en Steam para disfrutar de un juego de Berserk. Descansa en paz, Kentaro Miura. Gracias por el legado que nos dejas con tu obra.    

[h2]Mentor/Curator:[/h2]

author: {'steamid': '76561198123238864', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 92, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1712465119}
review:
I will start by saying, this is probably the WORST console port I have ever seen. The controls of this game are easily the worst part. If you don't play with a controller (which I don't), you will either need to map the controls manually (which do not allow you to use some buttons, like the mouse) or use external software to replicate it. Also, for some weird reasons, the input I changed would sometimes change back if I go to the control tab again later. And it is really weird that I sometimes have to press Enter and sometimes Space to confirm. Couldn't it be only one? Oh, and you cannot change your control settings in-game as far as I found and tutorials/hints are only in Xbox controls. ONLY. This game really feels like an emulated console game. Also, there are really not a lot of resolutions available. Be sure to launch the property launcher before launching the game first time, because 1080p was not visible otherwise.
For that reason, this game is not worth the full price absolutely not.

-------

That being said, once you manage to see past that and get a good input mapping, the game is fun. I don't know Berserk at all, but I really love the game and story so far. I just wish there would br more blood, maybe even blood sticking to the ground for a few seconds.üòà



Overall, it is a fun game, but just really sad that this is so badly ported. I suppose if you play with a controller, you will have no problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047568240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1710710123}
review:
It has it's flaws with some of the bigger bosses. Camera angle problems that occur  - the bosses spamming because they have only 1-3 attacks for the A.I. to choose from so it repeats the most effective move that is the most annoying for the player to deal with. The A.I. has no real rhyme or reason between its choices so it has its faults. 

However, even with its limited character pool - the remaining overall gameplay loop is enjoyable. Very enjoyable. Most "Kindom" or "Mosou" games leave you wandering between zones or pieces of a map with no activity while you wander. You are either waiting for Mosou Gauge to build or looking for a box with healing items before you engage with the final room's boss. This game does not do that. It's combo system working to increase the speed of which you build up Frenzy and Deathblow gauges means it wants you to keep the combo as high as possible throughout the map. If you can get 2,000 - 4,000 combo built up; you will find yourself spamming Frenzy and Deathblows left and right and little to no slowdown as you cleave large groups of mops away. Sometimes faster than you can clear them. And it lasts long enough that you can reasonably run from group of enemies to group of enemies - even if it is just to get that one swing in to keep the combo going - engaging. You always feel in the middle of the action. Your items for boosting Attack - Speed - Defense - and Luck all being in your control so that you can route maps collecting potentially 2-3X the end mission gold. It is satisfying, and can easily help you ignore how bad some of the big boss fights are -since they are not the primary loop of combat. They are still annoying and running into them is VERY annoying. No arguments. But with the rest of the loop being so satisfying - you can get lost in hours of play just chopping and mopping up enemies in one of Anime/Manga's most brutal and gruesome members of history. 

in my opinion, it is worth the playthrough. Even if you do not wish to master the game or earn every trophy - pick it up and play. More Mosou/Warrior games should take from what this game did as a concept and build upon it further. Our Hack-and-Slash should be kept engaging and rewarding you for taking the time to slow down and clear big groups of enemies as they should.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095425411', 'num_games_owned': 1536, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 3790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3790, 'last_played': 1708124660}
review:
BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk is a musou game in which you face off against hundreds and thousands of enemies at once. Just one glance at screenshots should give you the impression that it‚Äôs a low-quality game, but it‚Äôs actually not since it has several playable characters from the manga you know and hate, including Wyald. Yes, he was absent from every single Berserk adaptation up until this game came out, but it seems KOEI TECMO has a strange obsession with him due to him taking the spotlight quite often in this game. The gameplay is quite simple. You play as Guts almost all the time with the exception of filler stages that allow you to play as the Band of the Hawk members or characters from Guts‚Äô party if you want. They all have unique movesets, sub-weapons, obliteration moves, and Apostle forms (Berserker Armor in Guts‚Äô case) depending on who you‚Äôre playing. You unlock new moves and sub-weapons as you level up, but once you reach the maximum level, you can spend around 3 million gold to max any character‚Äôs level to eliminate the painful grinding process. However, you will still need to grind gold, but it‚Äôs not as painful. You also get random accessories and material drops after each stage that you can use to power up the character of your choice. You can improve your accessories even further in the shop either by using materials or by amalgamating with each other. You can buy new accessories and materials too, or sell unnecessary ones for extra gold!

The difficulty is quite balanced even on the highest one if you‚Äôre at the maximum level, but the Endless Eclipse which takes the majority of the game is not that balanced. Especially the layers between 81 and 100; nevertheless, they are quite easy if you know what you‚Äôre doing with accessories and such stuff. Keep in mind that you need to clear the Endless Eclipse up to 100 layers if you want a 100% completion rate with all 8 playable characters and they are: Guts, Casca, Griffith, Judeau, Zodd, Wyald, Schierke, and Serpico. Yes, I also wonder why they excluded Skull Knight, Isidro, and Grunbeld. I mean, come on. Even Wyald, a kinda minor character that appeared in a few chapters is playable! Not to mention that he‚Äôs also one of the most disturbing characters in Berserk‚Ä¶ 

This adaptation of Berserk also covers the majority of the story unlike other adaptations, but leaves out lots of important stuff, including the Lost Children Act once again thus, it‚Äôs obviously not the best way to experience the story if it‚Äôs your first time. I hate to be that guy, but you should definitely read the manga, and then play this game since there will be lots of stuff that you won‚Äôt even understand how they reach a certain point. 

So, how does it compare to other Berserk games? I could easily say that this one got the most variety despite being a musou game, but it fails to deliver a lore-accurate Berserk gameplay in many ways. The first thing you will notice is probably how fast Guts swings the Dragonslayer. I mean, it‚Äôs clearly depicted in the manga that it‚Äôs an extremely heavy sword that even Guts has trouble swinging at times. The gameplay obviously cannot compare to Sword of the Berserk: Guts' Rage on Dreamcast, but unlike that one, Berserk Millennium Falcon Arc: Chapter of the Holy Demon War (Berserk: Millennium Falcon Hen Seima Senki no Sh≈ç) captures the feeling of Dragonslayer‚Äôs weight perfectly. Sure, it‚Äôs a lot more repetitive than this one, but the gameplay definitely had more depth and the cutscenes were handled better, whereas we got certain scenes from the the Golden Arc Trilogy movies for the first act, and the actual cutscenes for the rest of the game in this title. Do I even need to mention that the animation quality is very, very bad? Especially during in-game conversations that act as cutscenes. At least the soundtrack was okay, but nowhere as good as Guts‚Äô Rage or Chapter of the Holy Demon War because this one didn‚Äôt get any Susumu Hirasawa treatment. They could‚Äôve at least included one track for the credits from the legend himself, but no. They‚Äôre still quite good, though. It also gets a thumbs up from me for being the only one that gives Berserker Armor unique mechanics, unlike the PS2 game. 

If I had to rank all Berserk games, my ranking would vary depending on different aspects:

[h1]The Gameplay[/h1] 
[b]1. Berserk Millennium Falcon Arc: Chapter of the Holy Demon War (Berserk: Millennium Falcon Hen Seima Senki no Sh≈ç)
2. BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk
3. Sword of the Berserk: Guts' Rage[/b]

[h1]The Story[/h1]
[b]1. Sword of the Berserk: Guts' Rage
2. Berserk Millennium Falcon Arc: Chapter of the Holy Demon War (Berserk: Millennium Falcon Hen Seima Senki no Sh≈ç)
3. BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk[/b]

[h1]Variety & Flexibility[/h1]
[b]1. BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk
2. Berserk Millennium Falcon Arc: Chapter of the Holy Demon War (Berserk: Millennium Falcon Hen Seima Senki no Sh≈ç)
3. Sword of the Berserk: Guts' Rage[/b]

[h1]The Soundtrack[/h1]
[b]1. Sword of the Berserk: Guts' Rage
2. Berserk Millennium Falcon Arc: Chapter of the Holy Demon War (Berserk: Millennium Falcon Hen Seima Senki no Sh≈ç)
3. BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk[/b]

To sum up, all Berserk games are worth checking out since they are all good in their own ways, but if your aim is to experience Berserk to its fullest, read the manga. Anime adaptations are also quite good, but nowhere near as good as the manga itself. 

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
A good musou adaptation of Berserk with decent gameplay and lots of characters to play as. The soundtrack is also decent, but the storytelling is nowhere near as good as the manga or the anime adaptations. Do you want to play a decent Berserk game with your favorite characters? Go ahead and buy this game. However, if your aim is to experience Berserk for the first time, read the manga, then come back to this and the other games.

author: {'steamid': '76561199507977893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1691688397}
review:
Firstly, the PC Port is extremely underwhelming since the Devs did not even warn the player that this game is exclusively supposed to be played using a controller. The tutorial does not indicate what controls you are supposed to be using on the keyboard and mouse, and instead indicate that you are supposed to do a certain action based on the buttons from the controller such as A B X or Y. Dark souls had a similar issue, but even when they had this problem you still were able to change the controls without any issue. Why is the attack button supposed to be J instead of left mouse button, and why do I have to turn my camera using the keys of T G F H? I can't even change these keys to the left mouse button for the attack, or fix the camera with my mouse being moved and I can't believe that no one is dealing with this issue with an update or earlier before it was released. Modders have to come fix this game. Please at least give us a warning that it is recommended that players should use a gamepad or a controller to play this game, otherwise why would we have these keys to begin with? They did not even help to play the game, and it only made it worse since I feel like playing an old doom game (1994) with bad pc controls. The devs did not bother to program the controls for it to work for Mouse and Keyboard like how the 7th remake of FInal Fantasy was done.

Secondly, the missions are really repetitive and I think it's very similar to the Dynasty Warriors games, since it's just retelling the stories of Berserk in this case of the game.

Besides the gameplay, the story is basically the same as the manga from the Golden Age all the way to the Millennium Falcon Arc, which is why a lot of the reviews are positive since they enjoyed playing the game while experiencing it through the perspective of Guts himself by playing him. You also get to play other characters as well, and experience their view. So if you are a fan of Berserk, this may be a good game for you, but don't play it if you do not like horrible PC controls because this game is designed to be a console port instead of both. If you do not have a controller, then you would not find this enjoyable if you do play it.

To conclude, do not buy this at full price and if you are considering it, you should get it if you have a controller if you decided to play it on Steam even when it is on sale, or get it on the Disc for a console port such as the PS4 or Xbox. They haven't fixed the controls for PC and you would have to find mods to help play this game, similar to the old Fallout games related to PC performance.

review:
It's a shame to think that somewhere around this time, Omega Force was developing Hyrule Legends.
This one is bland, has very limited customisation even compared with older Dynasty games.
It's a mediocre musou with a Berserk skin. If you're kind of a collector you'll want it under your belt, if you are just looking for an anime Musou, Attack on Titan is more fun and more original (or any other Musou game that's not a recent Dynasty)

author: {'steamid': '76561197984830216', 'num_games_owned': 1334, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1705374107}
review:
Unfortunately, KOEI Tecmo didn't make a good PC port; the game has a constant problem with FPS drops in combat, this happens in any configuration or graphic quality, and there is also no support for controller (rumble), this applies to any official controller or not, in a Hack and Slash game the rumble function really makes a difference.

KOEI TECMO used the Dynasty Warriors formula and gameplay, which in my opinion did not match with Berserk, this formula wears out quickly and from the middle of the long single-player campaign the gameplay starts to get very tiring, tedious and repetitive, with each mission I completed I hoped the game would end quickly.
The graphics could be better, the scenarios mainly have a poor and simple visuals, there was a lack of polish and extra care, the aesthetics of the anime are very rich and stylish, there is that feeling that something could have been done much better.

A positive point is the addition of several high definition excerpts from the original anime, even those who have never watched Berserk will understand the story.

In the end, unfortunately, BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk is an poor adaptation.

Rating: 5.0/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198039984325', 'num_games_owned': 2880, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 2029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2029, 'last_played': 1630562024}
review:
Very hesitant recommendation, because it's extremely obvious this particular musou was rushed.

It's not the strongest one in the series, but a lot of the characters in the game feel nice to play. There's a RIDICULOUS amount of cut characters from this game, with only a dozen-ish playable characters. Not even the entire Band of the Hawk is playable, Pippin and Rickert aren't playable, and from later arcs, neither Isidro or Skull Knight. None of the major demons other than Nosferatu Zodd and Wyald are playable. No, not even The Lotus Knight.

Throughout the vast majority of the story, only Guts is a playable character, in contrast to even Hyrule Warriors, where there's always at least one non-Link option in every story mission. The game is like 30 missions long, you WILL be playing as Guts nearly the entire time.

The story is on the shorter side, but it does actually accurately cover the majority of Berserk as was written at the time of this game's release. The Lost Children arc isn't included, I think you can imagine why the ESRB would've thrown a fit over it considering the whole, "more dead kids than Drakengard" thing. Up until the end of the Millennium Falcon arc is covered.

All of the anime scenes are sourced from the Golden Age movies, which this game's release coincided with. It's very likely this is why the game was rushed.

The Berserk system functions as a ramp mechanic, that slowly strengthens your musou attacks as you play a stage for longer. This game is built for long battles, but surprisingly, many of the story missions aren't very long. However, the Eclipse Mode, functionally similar to a Tower Mode but with breaks every 10 stages, gives you long battles that let you appreciate the Berserk system.

The gear system is simplistic but gives you something to grind for during the post-game. Basically, there's a simplified list of gear affixes, and four gear slots with four affix slots. Some items will always have specific affixes, and these can be farmed and combined up to Level 99, which is much higher than the usual affix limit of +9 in most other Musou games.

The existing characters are all mashups of existing Warriors characters, nothing groundbreaking, but R1 actions from the Warriors Orochi games are back and this time, they're character specific attack items.

Everything in this game is FINE, but it could've been so much more than this. To contrast, the One Piece Pirate Warriors games all have dozens of characters and while the story stage count is about the same, they're all LONG stages, and have multiple objectives and complex scripting. This game has stages as short as "kill a few hundred ghosts", most of them near the start or middle of the game. The finale stages are fucking awesome though.

As a Berserk fan and Musou fan, I enjoyed this, and I'd recommend it to fans, but it shouldn't be full price, especially when there are better classic-style (which is to say anything with the typical gameplay loop) Musou options within the series on Steam like One Piece Pirate Warriors 3 and 4, or Warriors Orochi 3 Ultimate and 4 Ultimate, Samurai Warriors 4-II and 5, or Dynasty Warriors 7 and 8. And if you emulate Hyrule Warriors Definitive, you can experience the gold standard of licensed Warriors spinoffs.

If you don't mind playing different kinds of musou games, DW8 Empires, Spirit of Sanada, Dragon Quest Heroes 1 and 2, Persona 5 Strikers, and Fate Samurai Remnant, are all also great options with more of an RPG-like style to them. Also, there's the Attack on Titan games that feel like a fucked up cross of Zone of the Enders and Dynasty Warriors. I'd recommend 2 Final Battle out of the AoT games, it has the full series story in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059352593', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1704669780}
review:
Un dinasty warrior con skin de Berserk
Berserk and the Band of the Hawk es un musou que adapta la historia del manga berserk, el juego en si no es un mal juego, pero se me hizo largo y mira que adoro Berserk, b√°sicamente adapta varios arcos de Berserk desde la edad dorada hasta la pelea con Ganishka, para mi la adapta bastante regular salt√°ndose muchas partes como la pelea con Zondark o la pelea con Rosine la mariposa y no dan demasiado importancia a ciertas peleas como la del conde y el bar√≥n serpiente, demasiada censura vale que berserk es bastante brutal pero si quieres adaptar la historia de Berserk a un videojuego adaptarla mas o menos bien y tambi√©n ni muestran personajes como la reina de Midland, Luca, Nina, Roderick o Azan que ni los mencionan, con lo cual la adaptaci√≥n es muy regulera a mi parecer cumple pero no es buena, el combate no esta mal no es nada del otro mundo es un musou apretar botones y matar hordas de enemigos pero aun asi esta divertido y tienes varios personajes para jugar lo cual le da un plus, pero lo alargan demasiado con peleas innecesarias contra bandidos.
La musica es algo meh no muy destacable y los mapas pues sin mas no son horrible pero sin mas.
En general y sin extenderme mas el juego es pasable se puede jugar y te divertiras pero se hace algo pesado por los combates la historia aun adaptandola mal es tremenda por que es Berserk y es un 10 en historia el manga pero aqui pierde algo, lo recomiendo solo si eres muy fan de berserk o te gustan mucho los musou, pero si no quizas no te mole demasiado.
Nota 6,5/10

review:
It's fun if you like the Warriors formula, and as Berserk content it is okay. The game covers almost everything from Black Swordsman to the MIllenium Falcon arc, skipping over only the Lost Children arc.

I recommend it just because the story of Berserk is truly one of those rare stories that gets told maybe once in a generation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277069847', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3532, 'last_played': 1704286115}
review:
It's what you expect: A Musou game featuring Berserk characters. It uses a lot of scenes from the CGI anime to tell the story where applicable, so even if you're unfamiliar with Berserk you can understand what's happening. 
Gameplay-wise it's pretty simple, mash light/heavy attack and watch the bodies fly. There's more depth to each character, but this mainly boils down to which combo of light and heavy is best against either mobs or bosses. Despite this simplicity, it is fun and satisfying to mow through the hordes with each character, while bosses break up the monotony by making you have to actually think for a bit. 
Speaking of characters, there are 8 characters total, though 1 is only unlocked through playing the Endless Eclipse, a post-story mode that you will spend a majority of your time in if you go for 100% (like I foolishly did). Each character has their differences and have gameplay that's different enough to feel unique, though Casca and Judeau are visibly underpowered compared to the others. 
To complete the Main Story I took about 10-15 hours? I didn't keep track, but that includes watching everything as I did not know the story of Berserk.
Overall, it's a simple game that lets you blow off some steam, or just play a simple unga bunga musou when you don't feel like playing anything too taxing.

That's the main review, now to rant about the endgame 100% grind.
Completing 100% of achievements brought my playtime to just under 60 hours, and it was miserable. 
Mainly because of this:
You have to go through the Endless Eclipse on each of the 8 characters, which is extremely tedious. Endless Eclipse has you pick an encounter from a list of 4 every 5 layers (eg. Layer 1-5 is 1 encounter. After clearing Layer 5, the screen appears and you pick a new one from a new set and that will be your encounter for Layers 6 - 10). My runs took about 3-4 hours per character to reach Layer 100. Once you've cleared the first 2-3 characters, this becomes extremely dull as all but 1 encounter are ones you've cleared before: 1 character specific encounter at layer 76-80. This means you spend 3-4 hours doing the same set of missions with minimum variance, across 5 characters (assuming the first 3 cleared all the common ones). This sapped my enjoyment greatly, and unless you really want that 100% achievement, I do not recommend doing this grind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152331156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1689, 'last_played': 1704097734}
review:
One of the most beautiful and gruesome games I've yet to play.

The price is a bit steep retail, and I got it on half off, so I feel like I did get my money's worth. Even if I only got 28 hours out of it.

The Anime cut scenes really stand out in this, I enjoyed the story they tried to weave.

The gore in this game, is pretty impressive. They did a great job of making something silly into something moderately terrifying.

The story is in-effing-sane.. I was apprehensive at first, but man... wow. Highly impressed they were able to wrap this up in a game. Once again, the impressive Anime cut scenes were where this game really shined. It might be an older game, but once you max out the graphics and size, it's still holds up. It just got better and better in a weird and horrible way. The scenes in hell/astral realm were definitely some of the most interesting moments in the game.

I can't say there's a ton of replay value, even though it is there. They let you play through the game as some of the other characters in the series, and while I haven't played that, I'm sure it makes for an interesting twist on the gameplay. 

I'd even suggest it to fans who don't know of the story/series... It's a good hack n slasher, with some good anime mixed in.

review: Desde que empec√© a leer Berserk y supe de la existencia de este juego, me hac√≠a mucha ilusi√≥n poder jugarlo. Y ahora puedo decir que no cumpli√≥ mis expectativas, sino que las super√≥. Como fan de la obra, lo estoy disfrutando mucho y se siente como un mimo al cora; me encanta la cantidad de cosas del manga que incluye y los niveles son muy entretenidos. La jugabilidad es muy deductiva y es sencillo tomarle la mano. Tambi√©n est√°n muy lindos los dise√±os de los personajes, sumado que cada t√©cnica de pelea est√° bien adaptada a cada uno, se nota que pusieron mucha dedicaci√≥n. Adem√°s de que me gust√≥ el concepto del Endless Eclipse, es muy entretenido y un buen desaf√≠o a pesar de que ya hasta llor√© de estr√©s jug√°ndolo JASHDAJSJAKS Mis √∫nicas "quejas" ser√≠an que con algunos ap√≥stoles el juego se buguea al no esquivar los ataques y termina jug√°ndote muy en contra, y que la historia como tal se pierde bastante si no le√≠ste el manga/viste el anime, en ese sentido es evidente que es un juego m√°s para los fans que para p√∫blico nuevo. En fin, adoro este juego, es una joyita y me hizo muy feliz poder tener esta experiencia. Mil gracias a mi querid√≠simo MadToby por regal√°rmelo, te quiero much√≠simo aaaaa <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198025169463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 50, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1711598131}
review:
I've played Dynasty Warriors since 4 on the PS2/XBOX. In recent years, I've come to enjoy that formula with crazier characters (Fate, Zelda, One Piece), but this is the one that I've been waiting for. the Dragonslayer hits as hard and as wide as you would expect, even Guts' Raider sword is fantastic. That said, Griffith is the character I've always wanted to play in one of these games.

A caveat: Buy this on sale if you can unless you love Warriors games and love Berserk. If you fit those two, jump on immediately. 

Graphics are lovely, the sound design is some of the best I've ever heard. The item system seems good, but I'm still figuring it out. In short, if you want to slaughter armies for a few minues, this is the, the, The game to get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029609678', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1703294695}
review:
If you like Berserk, it's mostly based on the Golden Age Movies (at least what I've gotten through so far), so it is missing story portions.
It's a Musou game, if have played Dynasty Warriors (and related games), then you can make a pretty easy judgement on if you enjoy this.  While a bit more tactical with flourish cancels and even general attack dash-cancels, it is a bit more complex, but it really is "just use the same 2 or 3 combos until you have ultimate and then use that for anything that takes more than 3 combo cycles."
But, of all the names I can think of that are perfect to single handedly decimated 1000+ enemies in a single mission, Guts is top billing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974454079', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1698504618}
review:
Overall, 'Berserk and the Band of the Hawk' is a mixed experience. The gameplay had its moments, but it quickly became repetitive, which detracted from the overall enjoyment. However, what truly stood out was the captivating story, set in a dark and mature fantasy world.

The game's dark and mature fantasy setting, inspired by the 'Berserk' series, is a real highlight. It immerses players in a world filled with intrigue and a sense of foreboding, making the storytelling an engaging aspect of the game.

One downside to the game is its optimization. It's clear that some work is needed in this department. Personally, I encountered performance issues, but I was able to mitigate them by turning off V-Sync.

In the end, 'Berserk and the Band of the Hawk' offers an enticing story within a fascinating fantasy setting, but the repetitive gameplay and optimization issues may hinder the overall experience for some players.

review: If you enjoy the golden arc and side anime. You probably would like this. I waited for it to be on sale. Yes shes a little old and not terribly polished. When the movie cut scenes pop there still pretty nice. Its a game to just go in swing your sword and feeling like your in the action... ya its a little dynasty warriors with the challenges an fights. Though, when its on sale its a nice lil thing to play as an anime/manga fan. Only issue I have had is, if you walk away for about 5 to 10 minutes. Game will crash off your screensaver or locked screen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198799215691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 5198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5198, 'last_played': 1697930516}
review: It's a fun musou game and has a really great soundtrack and that's really all you need in a game like this. The story compared to the manga though, isn't really up to snuff, but musou games aren't really known for their great story modes, so no loss there. The only issues i had with the game was bosses being long waiting games before you can hit them and most characters movesets being really bad. Most characters only have one good combo or one good sub-weapon that you spam every single time because it's the only effective one, then you pop frenzy mode, rinse and repeat. Look, if you love Berserk AND musou this is a no-brainer purchase. Otherwise, it's better if you skip it. Musou isn't for everyone after all.

review:
While many can pursue their dreams in solitude,
other dreams are like great storms blowing hundreds,
even thousands of dreams apart in their wake.
Dreams breathe life into men and can cage them in suffering,
Men live and die by their dreams.
But long after they have been abandoned they still smolder deep in men's hearts.
Some see nothing more than life and death.
They are dead, for they have no dreams.

author: {'steamid': '76561199196912563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2164, 'last_played': 1697282440}
review:
A relatively faithful interpretation of the Berserk Story told through an invigorating and fitting medium. 

The story is well translated to the platform, using clips from the Anime in the early section, then scenes using the game models in the later half that actually look decent. Although a lot of the details of the story are lost in the combat, it's told at just the level where you can appreciate the narrative.

The combat can be summarized into two sections, divided by the story. Solo and Faction War. In the early game, you'll focus on fighting alongside allies in true Dynasty Warrior fashion, capturing territories and objectives, which can get a bit stale after a while, but just like the actual story, the gameplay only really kicks in after the Golden Age. With combat being Solo moving forward, you'll cut through thousands of enemies as you go objective to objective leaving destruction in your wake, allowing you to get the True Berserk Experience. 

Although the Character Roster is small, it doesn't really affect the gameplay that much. Most of the time you'll be playing guts anyway, but if you want a quick change up in your playstyle, the other characters hold a generally diverse control scheme that can really shake up the experience. 80% of the time though, it's all big sword and cannon arms.

The most irritating part of the game, as well as the most enjoyable, is the boss fights. Although there are only 4-5 REAL boss fights, you'll mostly encounter Enemy Units that hold similar styles of combat to characters, or a specific mechanic that mixes up each battle. These guys will show up near the end of the mission and are usually easy to dispatch, however the real challenge are the Demon Boss Battles. Big hulking enemies that shock you with lightning, chuck boulders from a distance, smash through the environment, and overall make a conflict both pressing and invigorating. You'll find yourself analyzing their attacks from the distance, desperately dodging attacks that leave you within an inch of your life, but it's not all good.

One Word. Immunity Frames. A small window of time in which an enemy unit is completely immune to damage. You heard me. Not knock back. Not stagger. DAMAGE. It cancels out all opportunities to punish bosses, causing seemingly certain and cinematic attacks to fall flatter than the counter attack they'll throw back at you. This is not limited to special attacks, nor is it limited to just Demon Boss Battles, but to ALL Boss battles. Even Normal Units have these kinds of attacks. These will make any attack you throw at them deal 0 damage, making timing attacks not only uncertain but down right frustrating. Not only that, but even the range of your attacks are uncertain, requiring that they make contact directly with the enemy, and sometimes even being performed RIGHT IN FRONT OF THEM to hit. This leads me into my second biggest complaint. Hit Boxes.

The Hit Boxes in this game are irritating, not just for enemies, but also for attacks, yours and theirs. Demon Bosses will often have Square-like hitboxes that encompass the majority of their body, but fail to reach more obvious points like the tail. Furthermore, they'll keep you back from the hitbox to an unrealistic extent, and encapsulate attacks like a charge, making a narrow evasion turn into a brisk scrape with death. Furthermore, just majority of your attacks, despite an increasing range from artifacts, will often fall just out of reach, despite the weapon or attack itself appearing to hit. After maxing out the Range of Attacks, I saw generally no difference in reach.

Besides Hit Boxes and Immunity Frames, it was a generally well put together game that I enjoyed greatly. The story was an awesome and refreshing ride, the combat was invigorating and fitting, the boss battles were the highlight with some incredibly close shaves, and the Endless Eclipse was a fantastic place to test my skills in the end game. I highly recommend it, 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961930960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1696640905}
review:
It's a teed rated musou style game so there's some limitations expected.

Most appealing aspect of this is to play as guts through the main story arch for a decent chunk of the available books. 

Being a musou game the gameplay isn't anything special but it's enough to feel like you're Guts swinging a massive sword on the battlefield. 

For the actual Berserk narrative, you're better off reading the Manga or at least watching the anime.
Overall good fun that's worth a buy on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039354447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1700364515}
review: This is a great game, however, it is poorly optimized for pc and for that matter steam deck.  It runs well enough FPS and graphically, however, the movies, the most integral part of the story, well, for the most part they are unplayable, at least on a Steam Deck.  This is interesting as even though it says it is incompatible, everything works flawlessly except that.  Moreover, I have been playing this on a Playstation Vita and the movies are on there even though graphical fidelity is not even remotely similar.  I don't know, it's a wash...I would say the compatibility with a Steam Deck or even PC makes this game a questionable purchase, especially at sixty dollars.  Further, that price point, for a musou game that is almost seven years old?  Come on now Tecmo...plus it has serious performance issues on the pc side of things...let alone if you are exclusive to Steam Deck.  I hate to say this, but I would play it on a PS Vita or a PS4...if you have no other way to play it and you are Berserk fan...?  Maybe buy it on sale.  But you might want to just watch the anime...I am torn...but you know?  Just purchase with some trepidation along with remember the aforementioned caveats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163514989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1697406876}

author: {'steamid': '76561198989245499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1707785052}
review:
This game is just a hack and slash with the animated movie on top of it. I do not recommend getting this game unless you are aware you are going to be pressing the same button for 20 hrs straight with no challenge whatsoever.

The idea of the game is great however the execution and quality is quite lacking. For example, many scenes in the manga are shown however they are altered and changed drastically which can change its impact to the viewer and this actually annoyed me.

Sometimes, the story outright skips parts and doesn't explain why things happen which is problematic for people who haven't read the manga.

The combat is too simple, however it is important to note that it is a Warriors game. You can complete most of the content just by spamming X.

Overall, I don't recommend this game and I suggest that you watch the movies instead even though they are not the best and they have their flaws.

If you are looking to properly getting started in Berserk, the only proper and intended way is by reading the manga.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307613387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1090, 'last_played': 1709355625}
review:
This game is great. Super fun and honestly more worthwhile watching the cut-scene animations then going and watching the anime (we all know which one I'm talking about). I can tell they put a lot of effort trying to stay as close to the story as they could. Some stuff is censored and not covered but not in a way that effects the story. The combat is fun but sometimes it's hard to pull off a combo. The Berserker transformation is super cool, in the story mode I think it only happened two or three times but I'm assuming you get to play more like that in the other modes. 

If you're a berserk fan for sure play this, you won't be disappointed.

review: Honestly, I say go for it. It can be fun and stress relieving, so you can take your anger out on hordes of enemies. I say necessary because you feel like a GOD when you obtain the berserker armor: destroying armies worth of enemies is the most satisfying s**t‚Ä¶ in short: If you love those dynasty warriors games, then you will have a lot a fun with this But honestly‚Ä¶ this s**t ain‚Äôt worth 60 bucks so I‚Äôd wait till it‚Äôs on sale, or get it on G2A. author: {'steamid': '76561198438534232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1691306106}
review:
This game is not even worth $60 on Steam. 

After buying the game, it turns out that the gameplay of this game is really shit. 

Firstly, the PC Port is extremely underwhelming since the Devs did not even warn the player that this game is exclusively supposed to be played using a controller. The tutorial does not indicate what controls you are supposed to be using on the keyboard and mouse, and instead indicate that you are supposed to do a certain action based on the buttons from the controller such as A B X or Y. Dark souls had a similar issue, but even when they had this problem you still were able to change the controls without any issue. Why is the attack button supposed to be J instead of left mouse button, and why do I have to turn my camera using the keys of T G F H? I can't even change these keys to the left mouse button for the attack, or fix the camera with my mouse being moved and I can't believe that no one is dealing with this issue with an update or earlier before it was released. Modders have to come fix this game. Please at least give us a warning that it is recommended that players should use a gamepad or a controller to play this game, otherwise why would we have these keys to begin with? They did not even help to play the game, and it only made it worse since I feel like playing an old doom game (1994) with bad pc controls. The devs did not bother to program the controls for it to work for Mouse and Keyboard like how the 7th remake of FInal Fantasy was done. 

Secondly, the missions are really repetitive and I think it's very similar to the Dynasty Warriors games, since it's just retelling the stories of Berserk in this case of the game. 

Besides the gameplay, the story is basically the same as the manga from the Golden Age all the way to the Millennium Falcon Arc, which is why a lot of the reviews are positive since they enjoyed playing the game while experiencing it through the perspective of Guts himself by playing him. You also get to play other characters as well, and experience their view. So if you are a fan of Berserk, this may be a good game for you, but don't play it if you do not like horrible PC controls because this game is designed to be a console port instead of both. If you do not have a controller, then you would not find this enjoyable if you do play it. 

To conclude, do not buy this at full price and if you are considering it, you should get it if you have a controller if you decided to play it on Steam even when it is on sale, or get it on the Disc for a console port such as the PS4 or Xbox. They haven't fixed the controls for PC and you would have to find mods to help play this game, similar to the old Fallout games related to PC performance.

review: Berserk and the Band of the hawk is a general retelling of the berserk series up to volume 32. It misses out on some details and characters here and there but is a good overview. The game play is that of the dynasty warrior games so large amounts of enemies that you can hack and swing your way through while building up you "special". Its a fairly good match for the berserk series but as most anime games go it feels a bit cheap and phoned in. However if your a fan of berserk or DW id give it a try. There is plenty of content here and such as the story mode, hunting for the behelits, leveling and unlocking characters, and the endless abyss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152610269', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1689846566}
review:
Can Japanese companies stop selling games on steam that have 0 mouse and keyboard support, I'm not playing a game where I have to control the camera with buttons such as "TFGH" instead of just using a mouse to do it. 
Why do Japanese gaming companies always insist on making their PC ports the highest amount of utter dog shit imaginable?
I can see that Japan as a society views PC's as more of a workstation but then why go through the effort of making a PC port if not only to make it for some extra money for the unfortunate few that buy it, this becomes even more apparent when you realise the ridiculous price of the game.
How hard is it to implement actual controls instead of doing completely insane shit such as this?
I understand I can plug a controller in to play this but when you sell a game on a PC platform I at least except there to be some semblance of a control scheme.
What an absolute disappointment of a game that I was actually looking forward to playing completely shut down by a dog shit Japanese company.
Japanese game companies amaze me with their utter lack of brain functioning capacity every time.
After writing this I decided to try and plug in a controller to see if it is fine with that but it doesn't even work with that either for some unknown reason, tried plugging in a PS4 controller and it still fails to work.

TLDR: Japanese game companies are terrible at making PC ports, game still doesn't even work with a controller, huge price tag for a non-functioning piece of shit game. Also amazed at how it is possible for this to have such high reviews considering it doesn't even function as a PC game.
Easiest refund of my life.

review:
I know its not that good but for a Berserk fan this is soo epic!!! .Yes its just Dynasty Warriors Hack/Slash but that what guts do slash all the way . Its so nostalgic that the graphics is like Ps2 even tho its been made at 2017 but that gives the oldish kinda vibes I guess.The game-play is repetitive but its actually cool if you really want to play as Guts.One thing I don't like in this game they didn't give a chance to create rosine arc and plus the story is been cut by small piece's.This game has soooooo much potential just like s2 of berserk but it is what it is. If your huge Berk fan go clang! clang! clang! this game

Overall 8.5 Absolute banger if your berk fan while playing background music "Ash Crow" or "My Brother"

review: As a berserk fan i loved the game and really enjoyed it, the only problem i had is the boss fights, they repeat the same attack move until they corner you and its really annoying. author: {'steamid': '76561199173427676', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 82240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82173, 'last_played': 1689160709}
review:
This is a game for Berserk fans, if you're after a more filled out hack and slash game there are better options out there. I enjoyed myself playing this title but I'm an old Berserk fan. Like similar games in the genre it can get boring once you beat the story and try out the other modes just slashing apart humans & monsters repeatedly, the different play styles of characters and the various objectives do make it more interesting, and it is a great title like others in the genre to play while watching or listening to something on the side.

Pros: Currently has the most accurate respresentation of the manga in animated form, shows many characters not yet seen or fleshed out in the anime/movies and the story is mostly well done. Combat is smooth and objectives don't have you running around aimlessly. Movesets across playable characters are accurate in my opinion but can be frustrating to play as certain characters sometimes (but they can't all be beasts in battle lIke Guts & Zodd).

Cons: Objectives can be odd sometimes, base commanders on levels where it doesn't seem necessary to have them for example. Bosses can be annoying to fight due to their cheap moves and large size, they can trap you in a corner or block the camera, spam attacks you can't escape from causing your death.

Few characters playable, I would have liked to play as other characters from the series and I was confused why some characters were even made playable in the first place. Also key story moments were altered due to censorship issues that non fans of the series will be greatly confused by, again censorship also had key story moments entirely omitted from this release due to how graphic they are (while I do understand it would be nice to have had them in as some kind of option or dlc).

Summary: Truthfully this game may not be as interesting to people who are fans of other hack and slash games but aren't fans of the Berserk manga & even fans may get annoyed at the censorship, story omissions or lack of their favourite characters being playable. I do think the harsh reviews for the game aren't needed, it still holds it's own and it is great fun hacking away hordes of monsters with the dragonslayer. I do feel the game could have done with more content and not covering so many arcs in one game title as at times it did feel rushed as you go through the story. All in all I do recommend people to watch gameplay or give the game a try but not to buy the game at full price unless you are like me and are a sucker for the fact it is part of the Berserk universe.

review:
Berserk and the Band of the Hawk √© um jogo de a√ß√£o que busca trazer a ess√™ncia sombria e intensa do mang√° Berserk criado por Kentaro Miura para os videogames.
Os gr√°ficos do jogo s√£o detalhados e capturam bem o estilo g√≥tico e violento do universo de Berserk, proporcionando uma experi√™ncia visual envolvente.
A jogabilidade √© fren√©tica, com combates cheios de a√ß√£o e movimentos especiais impressionantes. Controlar Guts e desferir golpes brutais com sua espada Dragonslayer √© emocionante, proporcionando uma sensa√ß√£o de poder.
O jogo segue a narrativa original do mang√°, permitindo aos jogadores reviver momentos ic√¥nicos. Al√©m da campanha principal, h√° modos adicionais, como o "Free Mode" que permite jogar com diversos personagens al√©m do Guts e "Endless Eclipse Mode", que oferece desafios mais complexos.
O jogo possui uma boa dura√ß√£o, com uma campanha principal e modos extras para prolongar a experi√™ncia. No entanto, a repetitividade dos combates pode se tornar um aspecto negativo, pois pode diminuir a variedade da jogabilidade ao longo do tempo.
A principal cr√≠tica que tenho a fazer √© sobre a repetitividade dos combates, o que pode tornar a jogabilidade mon√≥tona. Al√©m disso, algumas mec√¢nicas podem parecer simplificadas, podendo deixar alguns jogadores em busca de maior complexidade.
Recomendo para os f√£s de Berserk que desejam mergulhar na a√ß√£o visceral do mang√° nos videogames. Com gr√°ficos impressionantes, jogabilidade intensa e conte√∫do satisfat√≥rio, o jogo oferece uma experi√™ncia imersiva. No entanto, √© importante estar ciente da repetitividade dos combates como um poss√≠vel ponto negativo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366209296', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1689417355}
review:
Like most people playing this game, HUGE BERSERK fan and rip to Kentaro Muira-san, a complete legend. While I've never personally played a MUSOU-Dynasty Warriors themed game, it does fit BERSERK actually oddly well. It's nice to incorporate some movie cutscenes and later in the game be rewarded with custom cutscenes that look infinitely better than the 2016/2017 animation we got. 

Definitely enjoyed this game and if you are into profiling achievements, the achievements for this game look very nice. Had a complete blast and can't wait to play it more. The DLC is great and the *surprise* 5th horse in the DLC had me chuckling pretty good!! Awesome stuff.
&
Griffith did nothing wrong
Femto though, is scum.

review:
Game is not worth full price at all... I heavily recommend you purchase Berserk on sale only. Game revolves around button spamming and repetitive scenarios. Beware this game is heavily over hyped for it being better than the 2016 anime.

Band of the Hawk can be boring at times, Femto boss is terribly designed for the Eclipse.
I'm only recommending this game if you like Mouso games or if you like Berserk!

Also i'm allowing comments for any "Soy Boy" to cry about this review!

author: {'steamid': '76561199194212048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 86, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1712196283}
review:
You like Kentaro Miura's Berserk?

His early work was a little too edgy for my taste. But when Berserk came out in '89, I think He really came into his own, commercially and artistically. The whole manga has a clear, crisp message, and a sheen of grounded reality that really gives the chapters a big boost. He's been compared to Go Nagai, but I think Miura has a far more bitter, cynical sense of humor.

In '96, Miura released this; Volume 12., his most iconic volume. I think their undisputed masterpiece is "Eclipse". A chapter so intense, most people probably don't follow the foreshadowing. But they should, because it's not just about the ideology of Griffith and the importance of equal friendship. It's also a personal statement about Guts and Griffiths dualism itself. Hey Reader!

Try making an Idolm@ster joke now, you ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•' stupid bast@rd

author: {'steamid': '76561198109181634', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4644, 'last_played': 1684136416}
review:
Berserk difficulty and the last chunk of Endless Eclipse is the hardest game I've ever played. The bosses have 99% unavoidable attacks that last forever, span the entire arena, have lingering hitboxes and juggle you easily. Was going to platinum/perfect it, but the run back to Femto is retarded. 20 floors, 3 of the most annoying bosses in the game, and defensive play is non existent, really. You can block, but they just break it, and if they don't, you get no frame advantage or tankiness. Dodging feels like an excessive gamble and every floor turns into a game of hit-and-run until you get frenzy. 

In Short; If you want to just play the game through the story and just fuck around, it's fun. But as a sort of completionist, it's obnoxious, infuriating, and exhausting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170856333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1696063404}
review:
First off, you may note, at the time of review, I have only played 2 hours. I may update if I change my opinion o this game, but I don't think that is going to happen for reasons I will go into in a sec.

I've played a lot of musou games, I'm a pretty big fan. After a while though, you kind of know what to expect. Each new iteration of the games doesn't change much, and when they tried to make big changes (I'm looking at you DW9!) it has not been well recieved. The formula just works, sure adding a new mechanic here and there to keep things fresh, new characters, or in this case, a new setting is always appreciated.

The reason I'm saying all this, is I see a lot reviews saying this game is carried by the the Berserk setting, and that you need to be a berserk fan in order to enjoy it. I completely disagree, I think it's way more important to be a Musou fan to enjoy this game.

I'm not gonna sugar coat it, Musou games aren't for everyone. First off they tend to be very easy. If your goal is just to beat this game once and be done, you won't find that very rewarding. you're MUCH better off reading the manga to get the story, and that's not what makes musou games fun. The appeal for most musou fans is completion. Maxing out characters, unlocking weapons and gear, and getting the best rank on each level (which can be quiet challenging).

One thing I will say about the berserk setting though, is that it works really good with this genre. Musou games traditionally don't have great stories. They tell the same story over and over again, and it wasn't very good or well told the first time. Berserk, although again, I suggest you read the manga to experience this story, is much better than any story previously told in this genre. Also the dark setting with all it's violence and gore works really good for a beat 'em up game.

the tl;dr of this review is if your a musou fan this game is a really good iteration of old familiar formula. It keeps things fresh enough to be interesting gameplay wise, and berserk setting is very appealing for this genre. If your not a fan, of these games, I recommend picking up this or another musou game on sale just to try it. As I said, it's not for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012633479', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1683455762}
review:
Mediocre Musou game with a Berserk skin. Story-wise the game is actually rather gripping, co-opting a healthy amount of footage from the animated movie to serve as its cutscenes, which do a decent job at engrossing you with the gorgeous art and some fascinatingly grotesque monster designs, certainly enough to pique the interest of a non-Berserk fan like me into wanting to check out the source material. But sadly the game can't really earn any points for this, since it's basically cheating by copying someone else's homework. And to be honest with the cutscenes becoming longer and longer as the game goes on, the experience will start to feel rather disjointed when the game keeps asking you to go back into a stage to mindlessly slaughter a few hundred more peons before it'll show you the next segment of the story, and you may as well just turn off the game to go watch the movie uninterrupted.

The game also completely phones it in on the gameplay front, and only does the bare minimum to be playable. The protagonist's moveset feels fittingly weighty and is totally serviceable to its hack-n-slash gameplay, but the combat itself is extremely shallow even by Musou standards. The peons are all doing the modern Musou enemy thing of being little more than free killcounts and rarely fight back, while bosses are universally annoying to fight with their near-constant hyper-armour and irritating knockback attacks. The combat is carried solely by the standard Musou power fantasy of mowing down hundreds at once, which will quickly wear off its welcome given the lack of depth. 

All in all, this is a lazily produced cashgrab of a title that you will only get something out of by being both a Berserk and a Musou fan, and anyone who isn't will struggle to find the fun in it. Buy it at a steep discount if you're curious about its subject matter, just beware that it will probably stop to satisfy very quickly if you fail to be grabbed by its narrative elements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164628471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1031, 'last_played': 1681627774}
review: Berserk and the Band of the Hawk is a mediocre game to the regular person, but to a Berserk fan, it's okay.  I have just caught up with the manga and wanted to try this game out.  I finally beaten it and it has a lot of problems.  It does not do the manga justice in terms of story.  Characters are cut, some of the villains have no development, and they even cut a whole arc out of this game.  They also mixed in the Berserk movies (which are 2D) during the first couple of hours and then switch to regular 3D FMV which clash with the rest of games cut scenes.  I have played other Warrior games and some mechanics are missing, for example,  being able to control multiple people on the battlefield and give them orders.  Their are many characters to play as but some are introduced when you are at least 75% through the game so I just stuck with Guts since they lock the other characters out on many missions (I think there are at least 10 missions where you can pick someone other than Guts.)  I still enjoyed this game as a Berserk fan but do not make this your first experience with this series, the manga is fantastic and I recommend you read that first and then play this game but only when it is on sale.  I hope one day when can get a Berserk game that can do Kentaro Miura's vision justice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126791191', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1663817350}
review:
Bear in mind, I only played this for a little more than an hour, but I cannot recommend it personally. I love Berserk, and wanted to play through this as it gets a decent amount through the story, but I couldn't do it. I'm not a fan of the dynasty warriors games, as I find the gameplay way too boring and repetitive with not much challenge too much of the time, and then spiking the difficulty at random moments for boss fights and the like. I thought that because it's Berserk I could handle the combat more, but it didn't take long before I got super bored. 

Also I'm not sure why this happened, but the first time I installed the game, the sound in game wouldn't work. Everything sound wise on my PC was fine, but the game's audio just didn't work. After reinstalling I eventually got it to work, but that was a strange bug.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116828059', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 11540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10415, 'last_played': 1679267579}
review:
I love Berserk. I love everything about it. So, when I catched up with the latest chapter of the manga, I immediately looked for other Berserk content. I remembered this game which I bought when I caught it in a sale but was waiting to play it until I was finished with the manga.

To begin, I must say that this is my first "musou" game. I did not know that this was a genre before actually. When I looked up about musou, I thought that this formula would work for a Berserk game and I think that it pretty much did.

I don't really want to talk about the story aspects of it. It's pretty mediocre. Usage of the movie trilogy scenes made the story telling really inconsistent in my opinion. It always jumps between the movie scenes, game cutscenes and text based dialogue scenes. I would prefer full in-game cutscenes personally. They look good actually because the animations and graphics are pretty neat throughout the whole game to be honest. The text based dialogue scenes are good too because they all have recorded voice lines. Most of the important and iconic scenes between Golden Age Arc and Millennium Falcon Arc are in this game one way or another, some of them are good, some of them are... not so good. I love how rich the beginning is (minus the movie cutscenes), but later on as the story progresses the game becomes less and less detailed. Many of the important parts are cut and because we just focus on Guts and only what happens around him, we loose a lot of important story aspects.

The gameplay is really fun actually. I played the whole game in the "Berserk" difficulty, which is the hardest available option (I really wanted to feel like THE struggler himself). The first level kicked my ass. I spent HOURS. I'm not joking. It IS really difficult. But as I progressed it became easier and easier. Playing as Guts is pretty fun. Lots of the costumes actually change the move-set a little and change all of your sub-weapons instead of being just cosmetics. There are 8 playable characters in total: Guts, Griffith, Casca, Judeau, Serpico, Schierke, Zod and Wyald. They all have different costumes and even though they are not all as fun as Guts, some of them are. At least they all feel different. Earning and using the Berserker Armor is great. I just think that there should be a downside to using it. Maybe like a chunk of our HP decreasing because of the armors effects? I don't know, something like that. Transforming to apostle forms as Zod and Wyald feels powerful as it should be. Femto is REALLY powerful. Maybe the most powerful character in the game to be able to play. I think Schierke is really fun. She has a really small move set but she is very powerful as she should be. I maxed out all of the characters. It seems hard at first but with the help of the "Endless Eclipse" mode, which I'm going to talk about soon, it becomes much easier.

You can prepare before you begin a mission. There is a whole system about items, accessories and warhorses. All of them give you different adventages. There are really cool references in the most powerful accessories (red ones) which are mostly exclusive to their respective characters. I didn't understand why they did "that spesific horse" the most powerful one but.. Okay...

Maps are huge but a lot of them repeat themselves pretty quickly so when some place is familiar to you, because you played that exact map, that's why.

It's good that they included the stuff that they cut in the "Events" section in the "Story Mode" menu. It really ads a lot and it made me happy that some scenes are (kinda) animated besides that horrible 2016 and 2017 anime adaptation.

Endless Eclipse mode is... Frustrating. It's good to farm XP and gold but it's so difficult and you have to beat it with all of the 8 characters and it takes soooooooo looooooong. I was going to do everything in the game eventually but this part was the part which made me get a little bit bored with the game. It's so time consuming. Why WHY WHY would they make checkpoints in every 20 layers. Playing the same places over and over and over and over and over again is so fucking boring.

I liked the challanges to optain the behelits. The gallery is fun the explore. Collecting everything was difficult, expecially the accessories. Doing everything was really time consuming...

Oh, and you can't play this with a keyboard. I mean, you can but, it's nearly impossible. It's not optimized to be played on a keyboard. It's not optimized well enough to be a PC game actually...

Did you know that you can attack to the "Now Loading..." in the loading menu with Puck? I sure didn't. And I played this game a LOT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098177704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 10465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10453, 'last_played': 1701004123}
review:
The Warriors/Musou franchise is one I've been playing since I was a kid. In terms of the "mainline" franchise, I think my favorite one is Warriors Orochi 3, which I dumped hundreds of hours into on the Wii U back in the day. However, play enough games in this franchise and it becomes pretty obvious that Omega Force puts in tons more of effort into the licensed properties. 

The Gundam Musou series, One Piece Pirate Warriors, and even something like Arslan just has way more care and love put into them. Berserk is definitely on that list, and honestly this is probably my favorite of all Musou. 

This isn't the best Berserk game. I think that title goes to the Dreamcast game, which is all new lore for the story and has one of the most heartbreaking scenes ever. This game though I find to be better than the PS2 one. So its Dreamcast > Musou > PS2. 

For starters, this covers the entirety of the story from the Golden Age right up to the infamous Boat Arc. It ends right as the gang gets on the boat, which is actually kind of a nice end for things. The only thing I can think of that was left out is the Lost Children chapter, but we finally get Wyald adapted (the movie left the Demon Dogs stuff out) so I think its a decent trade. For the Golden Age Arc, it uses the movies for its cutscenes, with a few moments done in pre-rendered videos done in the game's engine. 

The rest of the game, Black Swordsman Arc and onwards, is done all in the game's graphics style which is pretty cool. The gameplay is your typical Musou affair, pretty easy hack-and-slash action to get into for newcomers. The only detriment this game has is the lack of more playable characters. Skull Knight would have been fun to play as. You do get four different versions of Guts though, each with different move-sets and special attacks which keeps things fresh. 

Aside from the main story, the post-game Abyss mode goes on for so long, getting harder and harder but the item drops are of higher quality and better stats. The DLC missions are bonus ones, but those are usually meant for post-game as they expect you to have decently leveled up characters.

If you're looking for a fun, simple hack-and-slash action game this is a good choice. The spectacle of swinging Thousandlimbs or the Dragon Slayer around is a ton of fun, and the models/artstyle is very faithful to the source material. A pretty good way of experiencing the story of Berserk too, though I highly recommend checking out the manga if you haven't already. ‚ô•

review: The dream game for Berserk fans. Just like the rest of musou games from Koei Tecmo but with Guts and the rest of the characters from the manga. Each character feels unique and the combos are nice. It covers quite a lot of ground and seems to follow the story faithfully.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026845945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1676303876}
review:
Ah, Berserk. A dark and brooding tale of a man consumed by his own inner demons, with a style that's both stylish and visceral, like a mashup of Bergman and Tarantino.

The story follows Guts, a man who's known nothing but violence and bloodshed his whole life, as he battles his way through a medieval world filled with horrors both real and imagined. The visuals are stunning, with a moody, atmospheric style that's both haunting and beautiful, and the action is some of the most brutal and intense I've ever seen in a game.

But what really sets Berserk apart is its exploration of themes like morality, redemption, and the nature of violence. Guts is a deeply flawed and complex character, and the game doesn't shy away from showing the consequences of his actions. It's a story that's both thought-provoking and emotionally resonant, and one that lingers in the mind long after the credits have rolled.

All in all, Berserk is a triumph of storytelling and game design, a game that's as challenging as it is rewarding, and as thought-provoking as it is thrilling. It's a game that Woody Allen himself might appreciate, with its blend of dark humor, stark visuals, and exploration of the human condition. So if you're looking for a game that'll push your boundaries and leave you pondering the mysteries of life, look no further than Berserk.

review: Lo recomiendo para las personas que les guste mucho la franquicia. Es un juego del genero musou, en donde uno tiene que matar una horda de enemigos 24/7, a excepci√≥n de los jefes que esos los combates solo. Con un total de 8 personajes en donde cada uno tiene habilidades diferentes y puntos fuertes. Me sorprendi√≥ que a√±adieran a wyald, esta muy bueno su theme. La historia termina en donde zarpan en busca de la isla √©lfica, a si que variedad la hay. Una vez que acabas con la historia principal puedes irte a un modo de juego especial en donde tendr√°s que pasar por diferentes pisos o hordas hasta llegar a las 100 y enfrentarnos con un jefe final, el cual es el mismo para los 8 personajes. Si est√°n seguros de ir a por todos los logros solo les puedo decir que llevar√° tiempo y paciencia, sobre todo eso √∫ltimo. Utilicen el caballo especial que te da 60 de vida y otra cosa, que no recuerdo, pero una vez arriba del caballo y atacando podemos eliminar a sub jefes f√°cilmente, y m√°s si los aturdimos. Un juego llamativo y hecho para los fan√°ticos.
