review:
Uma grande adapta√ß√£o do material original e um Musou EXCELENTE!
O sistema de itens e progress√£o me pareceu tosco no primeiro contato, mas conforme voc√™ avan√ßa e desbloqueia fun√ß√µes ele melhora muito. Fiquei bem surpreso positivamente com o quanto que um pouco de aten√ß√£o nos equipamentos melhorou minha gameplay.
A responsividade dos comandos ficou √≥tima, eu realmente gostei da forma que colocaram a gameplay do Guts. Os combos ficaram pesados e impactantes mas sem perder a boa e velha leveza da gameplay de Musou.
O Storytelling juntamente com as cutscenes de anime ficaram muito bem encaixados e o enredo correu de forma muito natural.
Sendo f√£ da obra Berserk ou n√£o, eu recomendo BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk incondicionalmente.
√â um jogo excelente como Musou, como jogo de anime e como adapta√ß√£o de Berserk.
RECOMENDO DEMAIS!

author: {'steamid': '76561198273982991', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1674542809}
review:
If you like Dynasty Warriors type Arcade style beat em ups and you like Berserk then this game is definitely for you. 

If you don't know what either of those things are you should probably do a little research because both are definitely an acquired taste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198870149654', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1701649728}
review:
I initially thought this game would be boring at first but got it anyways because its Berserk. This genre of game fits the Berserk universe really well as you maul everything in sight as Guts. You can really feel the weight of each swing when playing and i didnt find the gameplay to get stale even after beating the story mode. I personally love any game with a rage  or transformation meter, and it definitely gets its fair use in this game. I feel the game does really well to tell the story of Berserk though the many movie clips, dialogue scenes, and gameplay. The game is also well worth the price, as the story took me about 20 hours without skipping cutscenes and you still have free mode and endless abyss mode to play.

There is not much to dislike about the game, but it does have a few issues that are worth noting. out of the 20 or so hours i have so far, I have experienced one crash, but this did not corrupt my save data in any way thankfully. Theres also an issue when trying to use the berserk transformation on controller. the input is right trigger on controller but this does not work. I then pressed P on my keyboard, which activated the transformation. In terms of gameplay, the only thing i felt was lacking were the boss fights. most of them are super boring, and the last one is just annoying. they are not hard or anything, i just dont find them suited for this genre of game.

If you are a Berserk fan, i would definitely pick this one up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069501787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1443, 'last_played': 1677430550}
review:
The original Berserk story has been gobbled up, chewed down, and shit out - seriously don't play this game if you want to experience the amazing storytelling of late Kentarou Miura - buy the manga.  The story is just so cut up here, missing lots of characters, fights, and events.  

It's a struggle to be a Berserk fan....

I'm still gonna recommend it, the Endless Eclipse mode is fun and offers a good challenge. =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198098004083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1674581203}
review:
Is the actual game fun to play? no its actually horrible and boring.
What makes it good? its Berserk, can't give it a bad review since the story is super good.
Have to say that it was very nice to see animated scenes from the manga, that was a big + for me.

A big - is that the game skips to much of the good stuff in the story.
Just go and watch the 90's anime or the golden arc trilogy if you have not done that yet... otherwise you are missing out on the best fantasy story ever created.

author: {'steamid': '76561199084811095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1191, 'last_played': 1674180717}
review:
-Primero y principal el juego esta solo en ingles (audio japones). He buscado tutoriales para ponerlo en espa√±ol pero al parecer no hay nada.
-Si eres fan de berserk (te has visto el anime y le√≠do del manga) te va a gustar porque te har√° recordar las escenas mas √©picas de la historia. (si no estar√°s un poco perdido porque no tiene el mismo impacto.)
Y si viste a Guts moviendo su espad√≥n a diestra y siniestra cortando a todos como papel.. en este juego haces exactamente eso, sientes la fuerza de Guts en tus manos, tiene casi todas sus armas y cuando avanza la historia va cambiando de skins. (la historia es hasta la "saga del halc√≥n milenario".)
-El juego tiene cinem√°ticas en anime en toda la "saga de la edad dorada". A partir de eso las cinem√°ticas ya son con el motor del juego. Las escenas subidas de tono est√°n censuradas as√≠ que no es para sorprenderse.
-El juego omite la "saga de los ni√±os perdidos" (no se porque.)
-Las peleas con los bosses por lo general es en una sola pelea y los derrotas, no es como en el manga/anime que tienen sus fases y tramas.
-Ahora en jugabilidad es un hack and slash, hay varios personajes para usar y puedes ir mejorando sus stats y quedan rotisimos, la cantidad de enemigos es pr√°cticamente ilimitada y puedes estar hs pegando en el mismo lugar, debes completar las misiones para terminar con el mapa. No tiene una gran dificultad, yo mor√≠ solo una vez con femto porque me bugeo, aun as√≠ puedes subirle la dificultad si quieres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010970704', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1674033398}
review:
If you really love Musou games go for it, but it's generally a poor use of the Berserk IP in my opinion.

Fighting some of the bosses can be cool, but otherwise it gets really repetitive and makes Guts' '100 man slayer' title feel absolutely laughable.

Some of the character designs look 'off'. Like they just decided, "eh close enough."

But the bigger issue is how rigid the animations are when characters are talking. Most of the the time it feels low-budget and contrasts poorly to the movie cutscenes, which even those I'm not particularly fond of compared to the source material.

The equipment system is bland. In the early missions you can find or buy some better equipment...but then it  just stagnates for a very long time. Also a lot of the equipment skills don't tell you their significance. Range +5...relative to what?

Your reward for completing a goal in a level is a tiny section of a single CG image. Terrible.

When your source material has so many battles, why in the world would you add filler missions? Why???

As I said if you really love Musou games then I suppose this is fine, but if you're simply a Berserk fan that wants a quality game, this isn't it.

review:
Berserk fa√ßon Muso...sur la papier, l'id√©e est cool, mais manette en mains c'est plus la m√™me histoire.

Soupe Muso : toutes les missions se ressemblent, ya 0 originalit√© ou variation.

Muso, c'est comme Mulhouse : on s'ennuie ferme au bout de 2 heures.

Muso Gr√©vin : on a l'impression de jouer a un jeu PS2. Pas bugg√© mais il a juste 20 ans de retard.

Muso de porc : mais que c'est moche !! Bonus : ya 5 decors avec 3 assets qui composent le jeu, et maxi 15 mod√®les d'ennemis diff√©rents ("Star wars Ep 2 : L'attaque des clowns" si vous pr√©f√©rez)

Bilan : Muso Muso le petomane. √áa fait rigoler 5 minutes, mais √ßa devient tr√®s vite ennuyeux.

Seul point positif : le jeu emprunte des passages √©normes des OAV de 2012 et 2013....qui sont dispos en streaming ! Regardez les, plut√¥t, √ßa vous epargnera 15 heures de purge.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997567660', 'num_games_owned': 827, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1282, 'last_played': 1690638698}
review:
A pretty good hack 'n' slash! One of the better flawed adaptation of a legend that seems to only show its full greatness in the original manga and not much else. 

It feels like a mid budget game from a past era, but in a good way. There's clear efforts to do as much as possible under constraints. The game is simple but focused, it's not pretending to be more than it is. It's a mindless button masher with a Berserk coat of paint. Nothing more, but nothing less!

If you are in the mood for something simple and visceral, and are already a Berserk enjoyer, then I recommend it. It's a good and simple game that is worth the fair price of 25‚Ç¨ when it often goes on sale. I would recommend reading the manga first if you are interested in Berserk though, as playing this might spoil a journey that is absolutely worth a read.

review: Abandonware port that barely works. The game is good but only because it rides on the back of the Berserk franchise. It's still somewhat fun considering it is a mindless button masher. I wouldn't play it if it wasn't Berserk though. The main reason it gets a thumbs down though is that this game is 50 pounds for a game that doesn't work or launch. The developers abandoned it but charge full price still. I couldn't even get it to launch in windows and tried everything. I had to resort to running it in SteamOS with protonGE ebnabled. Even then it only runs with windowed mode enabled and the cutscenes have no audio. You're a crap company Koei Tecmo and should be ashamed in yourselves.

review:
[h1]Do not buy this game for $60.
Do not buy this game if you don't know what Berserk is.
Do not buy this game if you haven't bought the Omnibus manga yet.
Then when you're convinced it's worth $60 when it isn't on sale, buy it.[/h1]

Power fantasy mob hack and slash with the Berserk movies spliced in to show plot.
I'd recommend playing on Easy the first time through.
It's difficult on PC to control so I'd suggest reading this [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/502280/discussions/0/133259227521100081/]guide[/url] since you cannot remap your keys.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981216230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3672, 'last_played': 1671271431}
review:
What can I say. There aren't that many Berserk games out there for me to enjoy. I used to play the PS2 version back when I had it, never finished it. This game fills in the gap for me. I've enjoyed Dynasty Warrior titles before, so mixing it with Berserk seemed fun.

And it is, especially after you unlock alternate costumes. You do have to play through quite a bit to get there, but once you unlock the permanent Berserk Armor, or Zodd's Apostle form, you'll be able to cleave through the battlefield with quite some ease. Just make it through 100 levels of the Endless Eclipse, and beat Femto at the last stage.

The Story mode is enjoyable, it doesn't end the Berserk story or add much you wouldn't see in other formats. But you do get to play out multiple scenes in a musou style game, so hack-and-slash your way through classic foes and friends with a whichever character it puts you in.

Beyond story mode you have Scenarios mode which is just as it sounds. You have a number of different missions to play and you have free choice of character to play.

Endless Eclipse, is the part to keep coming back too. See how far you can go, after 100, the levels can keep going, just having tougher mobs to fight though. But better rewards.

The game is an easy 8/10. Its fun, but I wish there was more to do with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049813652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1555, 'last_played': 1667433149}
review:
I have never before played this type of hack and slash game. I think people compare it to dynasty warrior. It is a hord slashing, mindless button mashing with occasional planning involved game. If I wouldn't be such a huge fan of Berserk then I wouldn't have the drive to finish it. There is no sense of slaying hordes only to follow up scenarios and as you go you slay 1k enemies. Then your rage meter fills and you slay the gathered horde in moment. Boss fights can be challenging. I played it on hard and still was able to enjoy myself. Its meaningfully hard. 
If you want to experience Berserk story you need to watch or read it. I did both. Best manga ever. Too bad Kentauro Miura died before finishing it up. Story is done in good way. You have main story line, description of characters, their motivation, some of the mechanics between them. Some details that you can uncover if you read all that game gives you. I had only problem with Conviction arc, it was done poorly, didn't capture the story well. But that is perhaps the most sensitive of them all for general public, so I guess, that is the reason why. There were times when I was enjoying myself after a long day and had that classic berserk grin behind my monitor. I was wondering how they will do the berserk armor and I must say I am ok with it. The transformation is done good, the moments when you use it you feel relieved that you have it. And again that grin. And then it ends. No pirates, no sea voyaging. but hell, we should be thankful for what we have. Game ends with Millennium falcon arc. Its kind of fitting, also they didn't had more movies to use in game, so...
Well it was a good Berserk experience, I was enjoying myself, too bad I didn't got to chop Adan to pieces, tear his tongue out and such. You could feel the despair during festival. But still it is aimed for broaden audience, so no festival of macabre and guts as it would be fitting for Guts. (yeah I had to do it) 
Good game for people who like Berserk and hack and slash.¬†

author: {'steamid': '76561198348121227', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 1854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1854, 'last_played': 1676766974}
review:
[h1][b]GRIFITH DID NOTHING WRONG![/b][/h1]
If only Guts didn't leave to chase his delusional dream, it would have been a [b]happy ending![/b]

All right, so here's the review:
It's basically Dynasty Warriors + Berserk. They even named the Japanese version "Berserk Musou."
You run toward hundreds or even thousands of enemies, slashing them with Guts' heap of raw iron. That's it, that's the game all about. The default difficulty (which weirdly set to easy) isn't that interesting. I suggest to switch it to higher difficulty right away. The highest difficulty is quite a challenge, where you have to exert every item in your arsenal to survive just as the real strugler.

The story?
YES, it is faithful to the source material. But it lacks quite a lot of details which makes it hard to understand if you are new to the series and haven't read the manga or at least watch the animation series.

So, should you play this?
-Yes, if you are a Berserk and Dynasty Warriors fan.
-Yes, if you have read the manga or watch the animation series, and you want to experience Guts rage firsthand or just want to refresh the story in your mind.
-Yes, if you agree with this review header.
-No, if you are not sure you can enjoy musou-kind of game (that's another name for Dynasty Warriors games)
-No, if you are new to the series and have not read/watch the series yet.

review: Eu sou um pai de 45 anos, provavelmente uma das pessoas mais velhas a jogar este jogo. Sou pai solteiro criando meu filho, que agora tem 14 anos. Meu filho ganhou este jogo no Natal de 2021 de seu tio, ent√£o o instalamos em seu computador e ele come√ßou a jogar. At√© o final da semana ele tinha 24 horas neste jogo. Isso foi horr√≠vel para mim, pois j√° era dif√≠cil encontrar maneiras de passar o tempo com meu filho, pois ele est√° sempre com os amigos ou apenas assistindo ao YouTube. Ent√£o eu decidi fazer uma conta no Steam e pegar esse jogo para ver se eu poderia jogar ao lado dele. Eu comprei o jogo, escolhi minha skin e mundo e comecei a jogar, mas eu estava preso no que voc√™ deveria fazer. Pedi ajuda ao meu filho e ele organizou um jogo para eu participar. Adorei, pois foi o melhor momento que passei com meu filho desde que minha esposa morreu. Desde ent√£o, esse jogo aproximou eu e meu filho novamente e agora passamos um tempo juntos fora de casa tamb√©m. Este jogo me lembrou que h√° divers√£o em tudo, e trouxe muitas lembran√ßas felizes para mim e meu filho.

review:
Un interesante musou que combina bien la historia del manga con las animaciones de la pel√≠cula.
En cuanto a la jugabilidad es muy intuitiva, as√≠ como a los combos y sus posibles combinaciones. La m√∫sica aunque no es original, atrapa en la atm√≥sfera de berserk.

Me dio muchas horas de diversi√≥n, imperdible para los fans de Miura.

review:
Da amante di musou e berserk, speravo di trovare il santo graal in questo gioco, ma cos√¨ non √® stato.
Sarebbe poco dire che questo √® il peggior musou che io abbia mai giocato.
Vado veloce con punti di forza e punti deboli del gioco.
+Le cutscene cgi sono belle, pi√π dell'anime uscito qualche annetto fa
+Prende(va) tutta la trama uscita fino ad allora (2017)
+Ci sono gli stessi doppiatori dell'anime
-Missioni NOIOSISSIME (ci saranno 30 missioni su 40 dove l'obiettivo √® UCCIDI 500 DEMONI)
-Graficamente antiquato, visto che le piattaforme di riferimento erano ps3 e psvita
-Una sola modalit√† secondaria, che consiste in una serie di battaglie senza fine, una modalit√† "sopravvivenza" diciamo
-Pochissimi personaggi giocabili (forse sono una decina)
-Per tutta l'epoca d'oro, le cutscene sono letteralmente le scene animate prese dai film. Sono pure censurate (s√¨, la censura su berserk va bene).
Non compratelo. Se volete giocare musou belli, giocate i pirate warriors, warriors all stars, dynasty warriors 8/9 e samurai warriors 5. Scegliete quello che vi ispira di pi√π bella

author: {'steamid': '76561199091058317', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1139, 'last_played': 1676052219}
review:
This game is good, but the warriors formula isn't for everyone. Some people may not enjoy it as much as others. I can recommend it wholly to anyone who wants non-stop action with minor tactical elements. These "tactics" mostly involve defending or attacking key points, but there is next to nothing that stops the flow of action. There is a surprisingly high skill ceiling too, which I did not expect from a warriors title. On higher difficulties, you actually need to make use of all your tools and inputs. Even blocking. To my knowledge, this is the only warriors game where blocking is encouraged this much. Especially considering that dodging doesn't make you invincible for the whole of its active frames. Despite its apparent simplicity, this game is surprisingly complex.

Also, most of the negative criticism I've seen is that it doesn't perfectly align with Berserk cannon in terms of how the story plays out. That and its choice of using the warriors formula as a base for game-play. With over inflated expectations, you WILL be disappointed. You are not going to live through the entirety of Berserk from start to finish in this game.

The Band of The Hawk is designed with people already familiar with the story in mind, so that it doesn't have to hold your hand. If you want the nitty-gritty of the story, the source material is what you'll need to go to. This game is designed solely for those people who are familiar the source material and don't need to be guided through a second time. If you are familiar with the series or not, this game is fun regardless. 

However, if you want a game that plays like how I personally imagine a faithful Berserk game would play, I can only recommend the Souls series. The games are inspired heavily by Miura's work, and can be quite obviously seen in certain areas. Not to mention, *struggle* is the key, defining word for a souls-like game. Just like it is for the Berserk series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198351671595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1692905979}
review:
Put your glasses on, nothing will be wrong!

If you're a fan of the series and looking for a bit of mindless slaughtering of NPC's this is your game.

The cut scenes tell the story pretty well, and you play through most of the critical battles.

There is a good amount of replay value for the game, even if you get bored of just cutting down enemies by the 1000's.

Recommend buying it on sale

author: {'steamid': '76561197984750515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 3169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3060, 'last_played': 1668363563}
review:
i know there's not many of them, but literally the best berserk game out there. some of the cinematic bits look a little weird or cheap, but when you're in levels slicing through thousands of enemies, hearing the *KLANG KLANG KLANG* and watching the blood spray, you really get this visceral feel thats almost a zone, or a flow; like playing tetris. every once in a while there are cool boss fights that change it up, but a couple of them are really picky about beating them in specific ways, while others you can just spam launch combo loops. 
i played the hell out of this game, and i think anyone interested in a good hacknslash, or anyone interested in berserk but dont want to watch the shows/movies, or read the manga, this isnt a bad intro. a little restrained from the original content, but i dont think any fan of the series would think it was tasteless sensorship for a video game adaptation

review:
I really liked the game , it didn't crash and ran good. I really liked the cut scenes. Im new to these games and i enjoyed it. I only really plays guts and tried grithith and another guy out. I guess the other mode is to rank them up ? I couldn't find a way without under leveling guts to level another in the campaign. I may have missed something. I liked the combat im not sure how many combos there is i saw like a few but felt like i was doing the same few ones over and over , i still enjoyed it though. I didn't think the last boss was too challenging , I liked the other ones though they were all right to fight.

I recommend the game i think its pretty good i like the story a lot. If you're not sure on the price then pick it up on sale. If you record gameplays the cutscenes in the first half of the game get flagged by USA /Canada AND Austria/Germany.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092043493', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 332, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1666404593}
review:
Um jogo muito bom, contando a hist√≥ria de um dos melhores animes que j√° assisti na vida. Tamb√©m li os mang√°s online ( porque n√£o sou rico pra comprar tudo o que posso), e afirmo com todas as palavras que este jogo retrata, de firma mais fiel o poss√≠vel, o que voc√™ v√™ nos mang√°s e animes. 

A hist√≥ria √© √≥tima, contando a trajet√≥ria de Guts, que √© basicamente um cara que sofreu muito na vida e vive para batalhas. E ele a partir de um momento conhece o bando do falc√£o onde nos √© apresentado Griffith, um dos antagonistas mais carism√°ticos que vai te arrancar um √≥dio imenso dele ( no bom sentido, claro). O que come√ßa com um duelo entre estes dois acaba se transformando em amizade, e depois em n√™mesis total e por fim s√≥ saberemos quando os amigos do criador terminarem a obra, tendo em vista que Kentaro Myura faleceu. Mesmo estando em outro plano, nosso querido japa deixou muitos materiais ( incluindo os finais), com seus amigos, para terminarem sua obra. Voltando ao jogo, ele n√£o cont√©m toda a trajet√≥ria de guts, por√©m uma boa parte dela, o que j√° rende boas horas de gameplay. 

A trilha sonora √© muito boa, chegando em muitos momentos ao √©pico e combinando totalmente com o clima apresentado. Muitas das trilhas tamb√©m aparecem no anime, ent√£o √© s√≥ apreciar com carinho. 

Graficamente √© lindo, e mesmo n√£o sendo nada super high tech ultra master, ainda sim √© bonito e muito bem feitinho, tendo como estilo de jogou mousou, este n√£o √© o pior nem o melhor, mas est√° na medida do agrad√°vel para quem √© f√£. Efeitos de poderes s√£o bonitos, por√©m algumas coisas ainda deixam a desejar, como as barreiras impostas pelos esp√≠ritos  que chegam nas fases noturnas, que claramente percebe-se um imenso jpeg esticado.... por√©m isso √© raro de se ver, ent√£o para resumo de conversa: o gr√°fico √© bonitinho sim.

A gameplay √© mousou, ent√£o √© voc√™ de guts ( ou outros personagens, dependendo da fase) contra um zilh√£o de inimigos na sua frente. O objetivo? descer a lenha em tudo que se mexe com o personagem que preferir, de forma simples, agrad√°vel e sem complica√ß√µes. 

Em resumo: para quem gosta do estilo mousou de gameplay, vai gostar bastante de berserk. Para quem ama berserk, vai ter uma experi√™ncia agrad√°vel e de qualidade, eu s√≥ recomendo comprar em uma promo√ß√£o, porque a pre√ßo cheio n√£o vale a pena.

nota: 9/10

review: Se ti piace l'opera di Miura questo gioco pu√≤ sicuramente soddisfare le tue aspettative, graficamente piacevole e dal gameplay leggero √® un gioco che vale la pena di giocare. Volendo solo completare la campagna principale √® abbastanza semplice, mentre se si vogliono raccogliere tutti i Beherit bisogna prepararsi a rigiocare pi√π volte alcune missioni, non sempre avendo ben chiaro come poterli ottenere. Il gioco √® generalmente divertente e ricalca bene l'essenza di Guts permettendo facilmente di falciare centinaia di nemici ogni missione senza troppo impegno, per√≤ risulta un po' ripetitivo in ambientazioni e pattern di nemici che spesso anche se boss possono essere affronatati frontalmente e spammando attacchi senza schivare o parare. In caso non si fosse letta l'opera √® comunque giocabile grazie ai numerosi filmati (presi dall'anime) che spiegano trama e situazioni, perfettamente integrati dagli eventi di gioco che compariranno di tanto in tanto tra le missioni.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011413162', 'num_games_owned': 781, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 4329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2734, 'last_played': 1666206190}
review:
if you know of the series and want a fairly violent dynasty warriors type game with some good combo systems you have found your game. the story has a solid 40 minutes of cutscenes from the movie remakes and afterwards handles the rest of the unfinished parts with in-game cutscenes (series creator died leaving the story in limbo for now) Story mode is fleshed out spanning 6 Arcs and is quite faithful to the original, even though the game engine can't quite detail all the varied locations from the manga/anime a few key conversations will happen in random forrests and feel out of place while that is quite jarring for fans. the story is still very good and very insane for fans and newcomers. even though i've watched the anime's a few times and played this game to completion on PS4 i still had a blast playing it on PC again.

japanese VO only, story is quite dark and twisted after a bit of a slow build up. features religious and demonic themes and has some adult themes like sexual abuse and R*** so please consider this before purchasing if you are not aware of the series already.

review: I really enjoy how much content from the various anime adaptations and the manga is represented in this game. I found the game really starts to pick up in the 2nd half when boss fights get more complicated. I'd recommend this game to anyone who is a fan of Berserk. If you are new to Berserk, go watch the animes/movies or read the manga before playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119649294', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1681060694}
review:
It's a fun game and I like Warriors gameplay but I would still recommend getting this game on sale

It definitely doesn't feel made for modern hardware, there's a Windows 7 compatibility popup when you launch the game which I clicked no to, the game itself I get no problems with but I have had a crash happen when trying to open the gallery

Also, don't get why there's keyboard tooltips in the menus but when the game is telling you how to play it shows controller tooltips. I would recommend your first course of action is to screenshot the game's controls so you can Shift + Tab view them if you ever need to know what key to press.

TL;DR: Fun game, not worth 60 dollars, wait for sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561199058655270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1137, 'last_played': 1670143462}
review:
Berserk is my favorite manga and one of my favorite pieces of fiction but to see how much this game fails to adapt the manga just hurts me.

The story kind of follows the manga but so much is cut out, majority of Black Swordsmen was missing and we didn't even get the Lost Children arc in it at all. 
The cutscenes rarely appear so you will just get these PNGs slightly moving with horrible audio syncing.

The gameplay is also very dull and boring. Sure you can easily complete the game but it just feels like a time waster. Going around slicing everything in half. 
When you get the Berserker armor, it feels like nothing much has changed except you go faster I guess.
I am very disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048614658', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1664239321}
review: The game has very good sound track and a solid play system with upgrades and rank up. Soundtrack is spot on and the cut scenes are what you'd expect. Story goes in a linear fashion and only few crashes. Up to the mission Brands plaa plaa plaa the game was pretty enjoyable. How ever, once the game has places Apostoles can corner you, you are pretty much screwed. By sheer luck I managed to get out of a sure to die situation and for a hack and slash game that is a big no no. Movement and timing should always be optional unless knocked down or sent flying. Once there is too much anger built up in a player the game loses its appeal. And for a Berserk fan that is a big loss. Hopefully thay can eliminate these block spots from the game, but for now the game has lost its magic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121472344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1688071559}
review:
Finished the first level, my initial thoughts are that the game is pretty bad and plays off of fan's love for the series. Wish they would just port the PS2 game.

- Combat feels clunky and floaty. Granted I don't have the "sub-weapons", but even with the golden age sword and basic combos it feels like a terrible power fantasy. I hit everything and racked up 1,000 kills from the 1st mission. This completely goes against the manga and makes the "hundred-man slayer" title from the manga a joke.

- Literally nothing tried to attack me at all. It asked me if I wanted Easy mode and I said no, and the enemies were literally just staring at me while I killed them.

- The amount of enemies thrown at you is just plain ridiculous. You two shot enemies with a ridiculous hitbox, and it still feels like it takes too long to kill things purely because you are always swarmed.

- Music is trash somehow, just mute it and put on Blood and Guts or Black Swordsman or something.

- That first boss was...wow. Dude had like 3 moves, and I even dodged *into* the attacks with terrible timing for iframes and still didn't take any damage. At one point I just stood still and let him hit me like 3 times and despite being sent flying I took like 1/8th of my HP in damage...

- Combo chains feel really boring and bad. This game apparently released in 2016-2017. DMC3 released in 2005 and completely blows this game out of the water, despite being the same genre. I don't know how they looked at this and genuinely thought it was anything but a cash grab...

- If every map is as massive as the first map then this game is going to be a huge waste of time. I get they want it to seem large, but it just felt unnecessarily open and a pain in the ass to move through.

All in all I enjoy Berserk so I will probably keep it purely due to that (and getting it for $20 due to the sale), but anyone who isn't buying it purely due to it being a Berserk game should stay away.

tl;dr
- Combat is a power fantasy where you fight insane hordes who you two-shot with insane range and literally just stare at you instead of attacking. Combos are boring and you just end up spamming the same one because it's better than the others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039642906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1677282812}
review: Only recommend if you enjoy dynasty warriors games, as a berserk fan I am fairly disappointed with this game. The character choices are somewhat questionable, like why can I play as Wylad but not Skull Knight? Having parts of the story be shown through the 3-part movie trilogy is a nice touch, but this is not a good way to experience the story of berserk. It is interesting to see some arcs after the golden age be playable but those arcs have never been animated. The Eclipse end game/tower mode is also nice for a bit of replay-ability, but berserk deserves a better game than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072894294', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1799, 'last_played': 1658007439}
review: If you are a fan of the manga, it's a must. Playing as Berserker Armor Guts was one of the most fun things I ever did in a game as a die hard fan. The musou is fine, not a lot of content. If you are a fan of musou, wait for a discount. If you are a fan of the game I think it's worth it 100%, really faithful and beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990357600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 2468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2055, 'last_played': 1661897652}
review:
So, this game was my introduction to Berserk. The style of game is familiar with the Dynasty Warrior franchise so my impression was already somewhat on a plus because I loved being able to wack out 10s of 100s of enemies with powerful sword swings and sword jumps. I only used the character named Guts during my play through and I only played the story so I could get an idea of the Manga.  
I have to say the first 10 levels were very boring and I started to lose my interest in the game.  It was monotonous hitting the same 3 buttons over and over again.  That was until I started fighting a vampire enemy (I think his name was GORO).  He totally wiped guts into the dirt.  That was when I went back into my controls to find out what was wrong and why I was getting decimated so easily.  Come to find out, I had been playing the game without using a lot of the mechanics because the explanation of how to fight were esoteric pictures without any clue how they were instantiated.  I barely got through that fight. 
Eventually it started clicking as I stared at the instructions, trying to piece together what it was trying to convey to me. hit one button, then hit the next button which was in a different graph to instantiate a certain maneuver.  After that, the game was smooth sailing and a lot more interesting.  
Of course, you have a long roster which is pretty much is repetitive but I wasn't sticking around for that. I was there for the story which was amazing.  It got me very interested in Berserk.  
If you're looking for story, this game is there for you, but beware as the gameplay is quite repetitive and you'll find yourself trying to rush through so you can get the next story chain. 
I recommend,

author: {'steamid': '76561198316816008', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2349, 'last_played': 1661550083}
review: I would like to start off this review by saying if you are not into any games of the Musou genre then this is not the best starting point. Now that's out of the way, I would like to say that the use of clips from the movies as cut-scenes was a really nice addition. Another great addition are the arcs that weren't included in the 97' anime or movies, it was really well done compared to the 2016-2017 Berserk anime. The only problem that I truly have with this game is the repetitiveness, other than that I recommend this game to any fan of Berserk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123554473', 'num_games_owned': 516, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1171, 'last_played': 1635024896}
review: R.I.P Kentaro Miura

author: {'steamid': '76561198004323696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1683421141}
review: Berserk is honestly just a perfect fit for Musou. While not having a huge roster of characters they made everyone feel pretty unique and some characters have multiple forms as well, tons of enemies on screen, huge special attacks that devastate hundreds or thousands of them at once, a big cast of freaks large and small and a wide range of settings to throw them into, enemies turning into gore all over the place. At least for me the game runs smooth as butter, even on an older machine but of course that'll vary person to person. The price is really the toughest hurdle to recommending it, it's actually started to go on sale more often recently, but for a long time it felt like you either bought it at full price or you didn't buy it, so if you do catch it on a decent sale and love Berserk as well as musou games, it's kind of a no-brainer. Also you probably want a controller to play it with, just my opinion because the KBM controls are archaic at best and nonsensical at worst, no mouse look without setting up an autohotkey script level nonsense. I still love it though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260072079', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1147, 'last_played': 1708270904}
review: The Game is actually good for the most part. Ofcourse it was made for the Berserk Community but even for newcomers it has a lot to offer. The gameplay is based on games like Dynasti Warriors, a huge amount of enemys are trying to get the player down. For the most part the game makes a whole lotta fun, except for things like Behelit mission that require you to get tasks done, wich are often very stressful for the whole experience. Like for example behelit missions that require you to get certain things done in a very short time cap. These missions have the problem that you the Player dont know when it end, because you have no actual ingame timer. I must say that my whole expirience with the Game itself is still good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083519080', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1490, 'last_played': 1660022324}
review:
[h1] BERSERK y la Banda del Halc√≥n Repetitivo [/h1] 

Para este juego necesitas un par de requisitos que deben seguirse si o si al pie de la letra si queres disfrutarlo:
[b]-Ser fan de Berserk (Obligatorio)[/b] 
[b]-Ser demasiado fan del Hack/Slash y Musou (Obligatorio)[/b] 
[b]-Tener extremidades (Opcional)[/b] 
[b]-Tener cerebro (Opcional)[/b] 

Es un juego tan smoothbrain que no necesitas el m√≠nimo uso de actividad cerebral, juro por mi vida que nunca us√© tan poco mi capacidad para algo, tenes que tocar dos botones locos para pelear con los combos menos creativos posibles, en m√°s de 40 escenarios repetidos con m√°s de 1000 enemigos en situaciones repetidas.

Supongo que a pesar de todo, recomiendo el juego si cumplis los objetivos, me gust√≥ ver que abarca todo el manga hasta el final del arco del Halc√≥n Milenario, antes de subirse al infame barco que tard√≥ c√≥mo 8 a√±os en llegar a la isla. Podes revivir varios momentos ic√≥nicos y debes en cuando usar otros personajes en la historia, pero son contadas veces, me hubiera gustado un juego un poco m√°s lineal y menos enfocado en matar enemigos gen√©ricos infinitos que mueren de dos golpes, algo como el juego de PS2. Aunque su beneficio de ser un musou le viene como anillo al dedo en los niveles de guerra, en los de relleno se convierte una tarea aburrida solo para avanzar a un nivel que tenga algo de lore u objetivos para conseguir behelits. 

Eso si, el modo eclipse tiene un pico de dificultad horrible al final, literal te patean en la cara todos los jefes con un stunlock excesivo y no s√© como lo logr√© (obvio que si pa, spameando la berserker armor), son 100 capas de escenarios solo para subir de nivel y desbloquear cosas, ahora imagina hacerlo 8 veces con cada personaje porque queres terminar todos los logros, mi recomendaci√≥n: metete en un psiquiatrico si pensas completar esto al 100%

[b]Nota final:[/b] Me v√≠ Hot Fuzz en segundo plano mientras tocaba dos botones y avanc√© 50 capas del eclipse sin darme cuenta de [b]10[/b]. Estuvo muy bueno, ver la pel√≠cula con amigos, claro, el juego safa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050824931', 'num_games_owned': 939, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1137, 'last_played': 1692198624}
review:
I don't know a lot about Berserk, I've only seen the 3 movies(im watching the 1997 anime now)and never read the manga. But I love Warriors games and I always loved the idea of playing as Guts and just killing everything in sight. So if thats your thing, hey! The game runs really well even when there are a lot of enemies on the screen(which sadly isn't always the case in musou games)

However this isn't a perfect game; the bosses are annoying, not in a challenging way but in a "come the fuck OOOOON" way. Getting hit multiple times in a row because my character keeps getting dizzy from the bosses' attacks is fake difficulty. 
The character roster is also embarassingly small. Seriously, how can you not have skull knight as a playable character?!
However if you're a fan of Berserk, interested in it and/or like musou games, i recommend this game. If you always missed the fact that there was no blood or guts(ha)in other Warriors titles, eat your heart out.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198025695352', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1671244629}
review:
Imagine enjoying something so much you decide to write a review once done to praise/thank the developers for others to enjoy, and then imagine playing The Femto mission.

This game is now unplayable, and is now literally unfun.

The game just goes absolute stupid on The Femto. There is no justification for any of it. It's just awful. So awful, it has undone so much love that has clearly gone into it. It's a gaping, hairy hole in an otherwise very enjoyable experience.

0/10, would not recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561199021498600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1657481628}
review:
L'ho comprato perch√© ho amato il manga e gli anime di Berserk ma, purtroppo, a parte questa motivazione non ho trovato altro all'interno del gioco che giustifichi l'acquisto.
Va detto che non sono un grande fan dei giochi musou, anzi, per√≤ so riconoscere un gioco ben fatto. Ad esempio ho apprezzato davvero tanto Hyrule Warriors (molto curato e con un gamplay abbastanza profondo e divertente).
Qui la grossa pecca √® proprio il gameplay: piuttosto piatto e legnoso. I personaggi aumentano di livello dopo le battaglie e puoi acquistare oggetti dallo shop (che puoi anche combinare tra loro) per potenziarli, stop. Le abilit√† vanno di pari passo con il numero di combo che puoi fare e si sbloccano progressivamente col salire di livello, ma rimangono sempre quelle (salvo colpi di scena pi√π avanti...).
In battaglia le animazioni sono un p√≤ povere e il personaggio non si muove per niente in maniera fluida. La telecamera poi non aiuta a dare un senso di fluidit√† dell'azione, molto scomoda da usare.
In questo senso anche le opzioni di gioco sono molto scarse.
Ma tornando al gampelay, la cosa che pi√π mi da i nervi sono le boss fight. I boss si muovono pure peggio del nostro personaggio e quindi si fatica a leggerne i movimenti. Se ti toccano mentre ti fanno una combo puoi solo stare a guardare il tuo personaggio che trema sotto i suoi colpi, nel senso che l'animazione in quei momenti ha due frame (tipo pugno a destra e pugno a sinistra). E siccome continuano a fare combo...diventa difficile portare a segno un attacco.
Al momento sono arrivato subito dopo l'eclissi, fin qui ho comunque apprezzato la fedelt√† alla storia originale e le scene d'intermezzo (anche in battaglia) tratte dalla trilogia dell'Era dell'oro.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010860204', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3456, 'last_played': 1670802721}
review:
I only recommend this game if you're a Berserk fan. The $60 price tag is not worth it so get this game when its on sale. The story is short (like 10-15 hours long) but goes quite deep reaching all the way to the Falcon of the Millennium arc, the combat is basic and fun at first but can get very repetitive later on as you're just mashing the same button every time. It does give you the feeling of being Guts which is nice. Other than that, the camera control is clunky, the map designs are confusing and awful, some of the boss fights are very annoying (e.g Ogre and Kelpie boss fight) and they missed the opportunity to make Skull Knight a playable character. The idea of the endless eclipse mode is cool but it's so damn boring and takes so much time that I struggle to get past even 10 levels without dying of boredom. What's worse is that in order to 100% the gallery, you have to reach level 100 with each character which is very tedious. 

Overall 6/10, better than Berserk '16/'17
Rest in Peace, Kentaro Miura

author: {'steamid': '76561198335645967', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1656808517}
review:
As much as I'd like to recommend this game, I really can't. Beware of plot spoilers.

Koei Tecmo did not do a good job on this project in my eyes.
There is so much context to the story that is cut out from the final product, that it makes it hard to understand what you're doing and why, and I can say this clearly and accurately because I recently read most of the manga when I bought this game. You get ZERO context as to why Serpico so adamantly defends Farnese throughout the duration of the game. Mozgus' executioners are completely removed as well even though they are also fairly important to future fights and plot points. General Azan also got removed, despite the fact he is seen a few times past the Conviction arc. The weird deformed guy who own the Behelit Guts' is supposed to have for the rest of the story is gone too, and I'm pretty sure Guts didn't even take the Behelit in the game because they NEVER mention it again (Granted I'm only in the middle of the Conviction Arc when writing this review, but so many of the cut characters got me irritated to the point of writing this.)

Look, this might be a bit biased, but I deeply appreciate story. I'm a huge sucker for story, and if you're gonna cut story from a game like this, there's really nothing much left.

This game isn't a game. It's a mash the X button until you win simulator. While it can be exhilarating to see the big combo and kill numbers get higher, there is literally no other content to be had (Then again, I haven't seen the Becchi Catch mini-game, so who knows, maybe that somehow saves the content portion of the game.) But this is why I am really upset with the adaptation of the story. If there were more active game mechanics instead of spamming the attack button, I would be more sympathetic. But I really can't be. The models are really well done, but the animation is VERY lack luster and jittery, so you can't even say effort was put in there.

This game costs $60, and while I got it on sale for about $25, I can't even say its worth that if you really like Berserk. The lack of effort put into this $60 game made by a Triple A game studio is appalling, and genuinely makes me wish studios would stop trying to make these game adaptations at this point if they aren't even going to put an ounce of effort into a piece of their games.

While all of this being said, I am still going to beat the game because it is a decent time waster, since you can't really mess up a button masher game when you make all of the enemies die in about 2 hits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339421003', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1656734751}
review:
NO SE DEJEN ENGA√ëAR, ESTE JUEGO NO SE MERECE TENER UNA CALIFICACI√ìN VARIADA!!!

Me explico, le√≠ muchas rese√±as negativas de este juego, y la mayor√≠a dicen siempre lo mismo, que el juego es repetitivo hasta el hartazgo y que suele dar problemas y crasheos. 

Primero, por el lado de que es repetitivo, muchos antes de comprarlo deber√≠an informarse un poco sobre que es y como es el genero "Musou" que son juegos donde tenes varios personajes para elegir y peleas contra oleadas de miles de enemigos en un mapa grande, estos juegos no se caracterizan por ser precisamente "variados" o "innovadores".
Desde principio a fin siempre van a ser "Inicias la misi√≥n, tenes que ir de punto A a punto B o defender unos puntos concretos o atacar un punto o derrotar X jefes, ya esta, no hay nada mas, los mismos que se quejan de esta falta de variedad parece que nunca escucharon de este genero, por que sino sabr√≠an con que se encontrar√≠an.
Yo soy un gran fan de los juegos Musou y se perfectamente esto y aun asi se me hacen bastante disfrutables este tipo de juegos, y me parece super injusto que Berserk este en variadas por un pu√±ado de gente que no sabe lo que compra y no se informa.

Por otro lado, tema crasheos y problemas con el juego, jugu√© este juego teniendo un PC por debajo de los requerimientos m√≠nimos ( Hoy en d√≠a puedo cumplir esos requisitos m√≠nimos ) y no tuve un solo crasheo o problema, eso si en rendimiento tenia bajas de FPS, pero repito, eso era mas que nada por mi PC, no por el propio juego, todo depend√≠a del numero de enemigos que hab√≠a en pantalla o el tipo de escenario en donde fuera la misi√≥n, pero una vez que el juego cargaba todo lo necesario, mis FPS mejoraban un poco mas, o incluso cuando quedaban cada vez menos enemigos, pero eso REPITO, es por mi PC 
Tengo un amigo un un PC much√≠simo mas superior que lo puede jugar a mas de 60FPS al m√°ximo y lo vi yo mismo, no tuvo ni un solo baj√≥n ni problema.

Por favor a los futuros compradores de Berserk, repito, no se dejen enga√±ar por la injusta calificaci√≥n que se le dio a este gran juego, este es un muy buen juego Musou, si al igual que yo, les encanta este genero, no duden en comprarlo, si son nuevos adentr√°ndose en este genero, por favor, investiguen un poco mas, vena gameplays de varios Musou, por que no son juegos para todo el mundo, menos si son del t√≠pico que busca variedad a cada paso que da en un juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017280798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1655869073}
review:
[i]Band of the Hawk[/i] is... mediocre.

To be fair, I hadn't even heard of Musou before this and I'm not into flashy action games. But for the same reason the game probably exists in the first place, I picked it up solely because it's [i]Berserk[/i].

I was going to give this a positive rating at first, albeit a very tentative one and mainly for fans who just want to beat up a certain birdman. But honestly, this isn't worth it... even if you do love the source material, which it does a very poor job of adapting. 

And that's the first problem I have: I wish the devs hadn't bothered.

This would've been a fun action game to just load up and mow down enemies as a range of characters, like the old [i]Battlefront[/i] games. Maybe even local co-op, that kind of thing. 

[i]Band of the Hawk[/i] does kinda have that, but the main focus is on Story Mode which tries to cover each arc. And it's painful to watch.

It skips over large chunks of the manga and while I appreciate the effort, none of these moments ever land as they should. Characters obviously don't have anywhere near as much development either, so the pacing is very rough.

This game is the worst possible way to experience [i]Berserk[/i]. If you've somehow made it this far without knowing why, do yourself a favour and read the manga. Or at least watch the '97 anime.

Visually, the game is okay, even if it does suffer from the [i]Dragon's Dogma[/i] effect of fifty shades of brown. The empty, box-like levels often get repeated for no reason, but the stiff 3D cutscenes really kill any attempt at dramatic moments. A black screen with VO would've been more effective, not to mention cheaper.

More of a subjective take, but I wish that adaptations of Miura's work would stop putting it in colour. Black and white looks cool as hell and imagine a Berserk game/anime with a monochrome art style, the occasional splash of blood. But I digress.

Gameplay, which is apparently the draw of Musou titles, is... not good. Again, I'm not part of the target audience, so take this with a grain of salt, but enemies are super spongy and the stats system is kinda pointless.

You get loot for completing missions that you can equip for minor boosts, but it's so insubstantial and I never felt like the stats actually did anything anyway. There's even an upgrade system and store for it, which is equally pointless. Outside of that, levelling is pretty standard.

The power fantasy aspect is where things really fall flat. Sure, this is a video game and it's meant to be entertaining, but when you can mow down 1000+ people in every mission, it just feels... wrong. It also trivialises Guts' strength when everything is simultaneously too easy and too spongy.

Apostle fights are a bit of a slog, but I suppose that's pretty accurate. It is frustrating, however, to get caught in a stun lock or pushed up against a wall which makes it impossible to see. Same goes for having to wait for an animation every time you tear away a layer of health, temporarily making them invulnerable.

Animations are all over the place in terms of quality, made worse by iffy hit detection at times, and there's very little strategy beyond mashing the same two buttons.

The soundtrack is pretty terrible, which says something since Koei went to the effort of licensing parts of the Golden Age trilogy to use as cutscenes. Susumu Hirasawa's work is absent here and it just doesn't "feel" good. Or engaging.

The Japanese voice cast is okay, but as mentioned above, I wish the voice lines were used sparingly and the focus had just be on gameplay. English is only with subtitles and there's a bunch of translation errors. I wouldn't usually point that out, but the game butchers some iconic lines as a result.

[i]Band of the Hawk[/i] feels like a PS3 game in a lot of ways. Maybe even PS2, like one of those weird fringe titles that got pushed out to meet some quarterly earnings call before being quickly forgotten.

I don't hate it, I don't even think it's particularly bad, the game is just... flat? The Endless Eclipse mode is pretty good, reminiscent of the Chalice Dungeons from [i]Bloodborne[/i], and the Berserker Armour is suitably powerful.

Being able to control Guts, Casca and the like [i]is[/i] fun for a while, but to sum this up, [i]Band of the Hawk[/i] doesn't have any soul.

When there is an attempt to recreate something from the manga, it'll usually be in a completely different (and recycled) location. Combine that with static text boxes as characters just stand around looking at each other, their expressions often bugged, and it's just cheap.

Using profound moments or lines is never earned because it never puts in the effort of actually developing the context behind them. Koei put the bare minimum into this and it definitely shows.

Sure, you could argue that my expectations were too high and the game was never going to match the source material. And that's true, to some extent. Still, if you're going to phone-in something that's based off a genuine masterpiece, expect some criticism in return.

Spend your money on something else, it's ridiculously overpriced and not even worth it on sale. Maybe one day we'll get From to make a proper [i]Berserk[/i] game, but this definitely isn't it.

review: I had my fun with it guess. Its an interesting type of game, definitively some sort of Hack n' Slash. The difficulty ranges from: Kill everything instantly, to Take a few hits, kill everything almost instantly, to Die almost immedeately for no apparent reason other than being close to a group of enemies, to Impossible. The bossfights are terrible absolute garbage stunlock simulators, where i was stunlocked and bounced into a wall at a point, and completely and utterly unable to escape, the mechanics are wonky at best, the fighting itself is buildt up of basic abilities and basic combo attacks, and no more complicated than pressing x a set ammount of times before pressing y, which leads to different attacks, and its very no brainy. The game isnt at all worth 40 bucks, and anyone who bought it for that price should be entitled to getting atleast half back, god damn, skins in fortnite have more value over time than this. This game is probably just worth 2 or 5 bucks, but still, i had some mindless fun with it. A better power fantasy game would be any of the Shadow of Mordor games, nothing except the manga of Berserk is any good, anything but the manga is cursed as shit, so read the manga instead, or do litterally anything else.

review: Got this on sale, having seen the 1997 show along with those movies and the newer TV show, the game is alright for what it is. I personally couldn't finish it since the game just boiled down to just running around and slashing people to death until you get bored or dialogue happens. Despite having a general liking for Berserk(Griffith did nothing wrong lol) I just couldn't bring myself to withstand this repetition, not my cup of tea. I liked the japanese voiceovers, I'm not really a weeb but at least the game felt immersive by not using an English dub, and I appreciate that a lot. The Golden Age arc having the movie cutscenes was nice, but I was more drawn to the in-game cutscenes that they did, I thought those were fun to watch and I wish they did more of those instead of having the movies do the job. The game shouldn't be $60 anymore, that's just ridiculous, hope it has a permanent price drop in the future. So just put your grasses on, and nothing will be wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156162863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3752, 'last_played': 1654550715}
review:
[b]ONLY[/b] buy this game if you are a fan of Berserk. you're not a completionist and if it's on sale. Here's why

[b]Good things[/b] about this game:

Story is good, there are no fillers and goes quite deep.

Move sets of the characters are exactly the same as the one from the manga and you feel powerful and you'll have fun. For a bit.

[b]Bad things[/b]:

Worst game design choices I've ever seen in any game so far: Bosses attacks basically stun locks you, and if you end up in a corner there's no way you can escape, you have to wait for the frenzy mode gauge to be filled and then you can activate it and be invulnerable.

The camera is [u]AWFUL[/u], it doesn't follow your character, if you end up cornered by a boss you don't see anything. Even with a controller is lame.

Some death blows are not AoE, and you would expect that it would attack where the camera is pointing. [b]WRONG[/b] It goes where your CHARACTER is pointing to. Hence you have to manually (pressing L1) line up the camera where your character is looking at.

Locking the camera to a enemy will result sometimes in camera shaking if you run towards them.

The endless eclipse is a good idea, hideously executed. The only viable strategy is to gear up with items that make your frenzy gauge refill faster (items with resurgence effect), in that way you can be invulnerable and withstand the blow of the final boss.
I completed it fine with Gatsu, but OH BOY, completing it with EVERY character made me questioning my life choices. Some of them don't deal enough damage, others (Casca) have atrocious death blows.
To complete the gallery you have to go to layer 100 with every single character. you can save while you're in there [b]BUT[/b] if the game crashes (and it did quite a lot to me) after completing 5 layers your save file is gone. Why? BECAUSE THE AUTOSAVE overwrites YOUR save slot.
So you have to make 2 backup saves, one that will be overwritten and one that is the actual backup.
This is so stupid.
Why is bad? because the game doesn't allow you to start at any arbitrary layer. you can start at layer 1, 21, 41, .... every 20 layer basically. And if the game crashes at the 100th layer, you have to restart from layer 81.
You forget to kill one (out of 3 in some batch of 5 layers) special miniboss that is required to complete the gallery because you're exhausted from a battle with the actual boss and you just want to [b]MOVE ON[/b]? f*** you, restart the potentially 20 layers.

The mini bosses in Endless Eclipse from a certain layer become repetitive: just Ogre and kelpie over and over again.

Some missions or layers requires you to kill a set amount of enemies, but it will actually start to count them ONLY after the game says "begin mission" and if you have killed already a decent amount, you wasted your time.

It doesn't support resolutions higher than 1080p.

Forget about using mouse and keyboard.

Steer away from this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198878608649', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5250, 'last_played': 1655327907}
review:
Worth owning only if you're a Berserk fan. 

Other than that, I think it's the worst Musou game I've played so far. I don't know how the PS version is, but the PC version is atrocious. Keyboard control is awful, camera control is awful. Bosses are atrocious even on Easy and Normal. There's no cool strategy to them, just equip your best frenzy gaining items and run circles around them until you can go invincible and unload whatever moves you have on them. Worst fights are when you have to fight two bosses and a random hidden secret monster if it appears in the room during the fight, and when you have to fight one boss and three minibosses that shove in you in a corner and kick the shit out of you, leaving you no method of escape other than praying for your frenzy gauge to fill up and turn yourself invincible. 

There are no options to restart missions, which is a HUGE minus. 

I am disappointed that the game is so poorly ported on PC, and would be even more disappointed to find out it sucks on PS as well.

P.S. Casca is the worst character I've ever had the displeasure of playing with in ANY game I've ever played. Her Deathblow move is the worst there is. Can hardly be comboed with, and you need to take a bit of time to line it up in order to be efficient, which causes you to lose frenzy gauge while running around to line up the perfect shot. Her damage is meh, and her attacks are slow, for someone who is this agile in the manga.

review:
My brother, come join me
In battle we are stronger
When Tudor will falter
Sacrificed to their altar
One hundred years of wait is over
Now we claim what is rightful to us
My brother, come join me
In battle we are stronger
When Tudor will falter
Sacrificed to their altar.
Oh my brother, with your courage we can conquer,
In your sword I put my trust that you will honor
I will be the higher ground should you concede it
And my body be your shield if you should need it

author: {'steamid': '76561198412103721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1653797605}

author: {'steamid': '76561198085001431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1653355440}
review: All I  wanted was a mildly engaging way to look at some good Berserk 3D models but nooo this game is so so so boring and bad that not even my great love for the source material could make me slog through a mission more, I downloaded a save with everything unlocked and just looked at the models in the gallery, believe me its  better than playing this. Just go emulate the PS2 game which is actually enjoyable and even if a bit easy makes you feel that every swing of the sword is weighty and counts, plus it looks better than this somehow

author: {'steamid': '76561198154321881', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1652075907}
review:
Overall this game is rather fun. If you've ever played a game in the Warrior franchise - such as Dynasty Warriors, Samurai Warriors or Orochi, it's the same gameplay really. 

You play as Guts, members of the Band of the Hawk/Falcon and a few interesting others, like Zodd and for some reason Wyald.

Just decimate hoards of enemies and some boss fights.

The animated scenes are better than the 2016 anime series.


I recommend this game to Berserk fans - when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979615142', 'num_games_owned': 1547, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 4064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4064, 'last_played': 1653728649}
review:
I recommend this disgraceful game because I had fun.  Hack and slash, Berserk universe, appealing sound effects and music, and fun ragdoll effects.

However, this game was the true definition of the world of Berserk -- a terrible PC experience, making the grim world of Berserk realistic... if computers existed.
 
-I have 14-17 hours of crashes and replaying missions (minus story parts I ended up skipping, so luckily they don't force you to re-watch them)
-XBox One controller "Right Trigger" not working for transform ability (which is literally the default button for the ability) yet the RT button still works for target lock or other abilities
-Glitching into parts of the map and forced to reset multiple times

KT, shame on you for never fixing your games.  At least fix the Xbox Controller Right Trigger issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041190789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1653755596}
review: This game has a problem in working. From the beginning it says you need Windows 7 compatibility mod(And this game's release was not that old). After entering the game, it has severe graphics problem. Guts moves like in a slow motion and controls really suck. I made the mistake of buying this bad game because of my love for Berserk series. If I was not blinded by my love for the series, I would have noticed the low quality in the trailers and pictures on its Steam store page. This game has nothing to offer anyone.  I should have checked this game when I bought it, because of the time passed since my purchase I can't even refund this train wreck of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022882750', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1241, 'last_played': 1689247291}
review:
C'est un bon d√©fouloir avec du fun mais √©norm√©ment de d√©fauts et de flemmardises dans sa conception en plus d'un prix beaucoup trop √©lev√©.

D√©j√† le dev qui a con√ßu les combats de boss est une ordure, la cam√©ra fait n'importe quoi et attention aux coins vous risqueriez de rester coincer contre les boss les plus gros. 
Niveau qualit√© des combats de boss c'est tr√®s moyen, le fait que vous ne puissiez pas infliger de d√©g√¢ts lorsque les boss sont √† terre engendre une frustration inimaginable. En plus de cela les paternes sont tr√®s moyens, certains vous font tomb√© en boucle sans que vous ne puissiez vraiment esquiver.

Le level design laisse vraiment √† d√©sirer, c'est du copi√© coll√© de partout m√™me si certains environnement m'ont plus plu que d'autres, et visuellement c'est pas tr√®s beau, √ßa passe mais c'est limite je trouve.

Beaucoup de sc√®nes sont censur√©es comme dans l'anime, et parfois j'ai eu l'impression que l'intrigue allait un peu vite en omettant beaucoup d'autres sc√®nes. Malgr√© √ßa c'√©tait quand m√™me un plaisir de suivre les cin√©matiques. Par contre les dialogues en jeu sont d'une mise en sc√®ne minable c'est vraiment terrible.

J'ai eu pas mal de crash apr√®s certaines missions vous obligeant √† recommencer 10min de mission.

Grosse d√©ception aussi sur les vibrations, il n'y en a aucune ! AUCUNE ! C'est intol√©rable on a le feedback visuel mais pas dans la manette, tr√®s frustrant et incompr√©hensible pour ma part.

Dernier point que j'ai d√©couvert r√©cemment : Vous pouvez d√©bloquer l'armure du berserk √† force de faire l'histoire et donc la transformation qui va avec et qui s'active avec la g√¢chette RT, sauf que si comme moi vous jouez avec une manette de xbox one, le jeu ne reconnait pas la g√¢chette RT, vous √™tes donc oblig√© de passer par l'application joytokey et de bind la touche 12 sur p, c'est une astuce que j'ai trouv√© sur un vieux forum du jeu, merci au gars qui s'appelle "HopeTrash" d'avoir post√© l'astuce.
 
Voil√† √† part √ßa, le jeu reste fun, je n'ai jou√© que Guts et Zodd, j'ai beaucoup aim√© les deux personnages mais je ne peux rien dire sur les autres. Ce jeu conviendra s√ªrement aux adeptes de l'anime et du manga comme moi, essayez de le trouver √† 20‚Ç¨ max.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163179292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1652557257}
review: The game is worth $5 at best. The gameplay consists of incredibly repetitive hack and slash battles where you're fighting the same enemy types with the same objectives. Sure, it's fun watching Guts slice tons of enemies into pieces, but that's basically all there is to the gameplay. There are snippets of the show and some dialogue in between repetitive battles. I'm a Berserk fan and I love Guts, but you're much better off just watching the show and/or movies again. The $20 I paid feels like a cheap attempt to make a buck. Stay away unless the price is <$5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198405451734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 3371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1888, 'last_played': 1691898673}
review:
Nunca vi, le√≠ ni escuch√© nada de Berserk. Gracias a este juego lo descubr√≠ y me quiero matar por haberme perdido durante tanto tiempo lo que quiz√°s sea la mejor historia de fantas√≠a que conoc√≠ jam√°s. Y eso que en el juego est√° contado todo as√≠ nom√°s y salte√°ndose muchas partes y detalles. Me llamaron la atenci√≥n los screenshots y que nunca jugu√© a un musou, as√≠ que punto a favor para el departamento de marketing xd
Dicho eso, paso al juego. JUEGAZO para pasar el tiempo y sentirte completamente OP. ¬øRepetitivo? Es un hack and slash puro... por supuesto que te la vas a pasar HackAndSlasheando todo el tiempo. En ning√∫n momento se nos dice o promete lo contrario, por m√°s que haya interludios para ir explicando la historia. Como dijo alguien por ah√≠: sos Guts repartiendo sopapos a todos, simplemente eso.
Es un juego bastante largo la verdad... yo tard√© 31 horas en pasar el modo historia, porque estoy algo enfermito y me la pas√© matando bichos sin darle importancia a los objetivos (hasta que no cumplas un sub-objetivo no pas√°s al siguiente y as√≠). Los combates son enormes y bastante divertidos.
Todo bien pero, ¬øcu√°l es la gran pega? Que es un port muy malo para PC. Para empezar, la indicaci√≥n de los controles est√° hecha para joystick; la t√≠pica de, presiona LT para mover la c√°mara y etc√©tera. Es frustrante aprenderse los controles con el teclado, pero una vez que lo hac√©s lo jug√°s tranquilamente.
La otra pega es la C√ÅMARA. La c√°mara por Dios que desastre amigo... pero de nuevo, si te acostumbr√°s, pasa. El mayor inconveniente te lo com√©s con los bosses, que son por lo general enormes y ni siquiera entran en el cuadro de la c√°mara, por lo que durante la pelea siempre est√°s mirando y peg√°ndole a las partes √≠ntimas, pero bueno.
Me enganch√© mucho con la historia... no creo leer el manga porque no nunca le√≠ un manga en mi vida, y encima no tengo un mango (badumtssssss). Quiz√°s vea la peli (peli cuyas escenas est√°n puesta en este juego me olvid√© decir) que es a lo que estoy m√°s acostumbrado. Eso y que no soy otaku xd

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197960443464', 'num_games_owned': 1261, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1652508201}
review:
If you've played a Dynasty Warriors game of any flavor you know exactly what to expect. Similar to other anime-flavored Warriors games like Fist of the North Star: Ken's Rage or One Piece: Pirate Warriors. Generally follows the plot of the first couple arcs of Berserk.

Game asks you to run the game in Windows 7 compatibility mode. I'm not sure why but after enabling it, the game runs with no apparent hitches and supports 1440p. Supports Xbox controllers out of the box with no issue. Haven't tried keyboard and mouse. I wouldn't ever play a game like this on them.

If you like Warriors games, you'll enjoy the gameplay. If you like Berserk, you'll appreciate the fan service and really "feeling" how strong Guts is supposed to be. 

As a Warriors game, I'd give it a B, would be better with a bigger roster but overall it's about as solid as, say, Pirate Warriors. For non-Warriors fans? Probably more like a a C or C+. It's mindless hack-and-slash without a ton of depth but some cool anime moments sprinkled in. If you're a diehard Berserk fan, get it on a sale.

review:
really good warriors style game, also makes a lot of sense in the universe of berserk to go with this kinda gameplay. it does a way better job at giving you a decent overview of the story (as far as the game goes, no spoilers dont cha worry) than any of the anime attempts do. 
i really do not understand however why they decided not to have a multiplayer. like at all. thats just stupid makes for so much less replay value, idk what they were thinking. otherwise, if u enjoy warriors titles or just really wanna feel badass with the biggest sword north of the equator, give it a go

7/10

As with any and all musou games it's mindless fun where you can turn your brain off and just have fun for a little bit. After you finish the story you can also play Endless Eclipse which is the completionism content of the game where you get rewards for completing layers. As i've said, the game is endurable if you like Berserk and probably boring at best if you've never heard of the series.
