author: {'steamid': '76561197998873734', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 1858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1418, 'last_played': 1671707201}
review:
[h1]Disclaimer[/h1]
I finished the main campaign on Hard and tried all the playable characters before reviewing.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
It's good for what it is. As a Musou-style game it stands as above average with few characters that have unique mechanics. As a game based on Berserk Manga/Anime it's allright and retells the story well enough.

Unfortunately it suffers from crashes. More in cons section.

If you like Musou games I can recommend it.
If you are a fan of Berserk, but don't like Musou games - I don't recommend it.
If you like Berserk, but never played a Musou game - I don't think this is a good place to start, since you won't really get any added value from re-experiencing the story that you already know and there are better Musou games out there. If you want to get into Muosu games I'd start with something like Warriors Orochi 4 or Fate/Extella LINK, or Hyrule Warriors/Fire Emblem Warriors on Nintendo Switch.

[h1]Description[/h1]
It's a Musou game (similar to Dynasty Warriors series) set in a Berserk world. I won't describe what a Musou game is to save some space and instead I will describe mechanics unique to this title.
- most of the game you will be forced to play main hero (Guts) and there is no ability to switch characters or issue orders during a mission
- there is no jump button - instead you have a dodge/dash, which helps you with positioning as it can cancel some animations
- guarding against enemy at a precise moment they strike you will trigger a parry, making enemies flinch back or even suffer a full stun - it's a mechanic that's pretty much required for some bosses
- most characters have special weapons like throwing knives that work on cooldown or ammunition
- your musou bar, once used, enters you into a power-up state, which makes all your attacks much more devastating
- as you do damage during the power-up state, you fill another bar and after it's filled - you can use it to perform a typical musou area-clear attack
- every time you enter your power-up state - it gets stronger, encouraging active use of this mechanic multiple times per level
- you can customize your character by the means of equipping 3 passive items, which can improve your skills like guard, dodge or damage of your charged attacks, and you can also select 4 active items - those can heal or increase attributes
- there are no weapon drops or skill-tree system
- all stage progression is based on specific objectives - you don't have to kill or capture anything that isn't a part of the objective
- this game has a lot of story bits presented as static, voiced dialogue and cutscenes, both of which can be skipped

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[b]+ Well executed mechanics[/b]
Killing chaff enemies, dodging around, using special weapons and focusing down officers all works well. Sometimes camera is a problem when you are near a wall, but most of the time game does a good job at showing what you need to see. The core of a Musou game is alive and well in this title.

[b]+ Well-designed characters[/b]
Almost every character feels completely different from the rest, which is good since there aren't all that many of them. This is much better in that regard than Fire Emblem Warriors, which has a ton of characters but nearly all of them are repeated several times over.

My favorite character would be the witch-girl. Musou games were flirting with an idea of a caster character for a while now, but this game does it pretty well. Each charged attack in the girl's combo will begin a chanting animation, which has different duration depending on which attack you are performing. After the attack you can chant again for a more powerful version of the attack. For example, C1 will create an earth shockwave, when you chant again - you will also launch a huge boulder at the enemies. All this in addition to her special items, which can create golems.

[b]+ Decentntly told story[/b]
All the important context is laid down well and voice acting is top-notch.

There are issues with the story, but for that go to cons section.

[b]+ Brutal, savage and bloody[/b]
During berserk mode you will smash enemies to bloody pieces of gore. After this game I kinda wish more Musou games would go into that direction. Battle is a dirty business and act of slaughter should be properly depicted as cruel as it is.

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[b]- Crashes[/b]
Before I finished all story the game crashed sometimes during end-mission cutscenes. This will reset all your progress in the mission and force you to start over. Ever since I started playing Endless Eclipse mode - the game became very unstable. I usually get some kind of crash at least once every 30 minutes, which severely diminishes my willingness to continue playing.

Crashes range from CTD's when the game doesn't like me making too much crafting and merging different accessories to max their skills, to full-on system lockups during gameplay and the only solution at that time is a hard reset.

This alone is enough for me to deduct 2 points from the final score. Losing mission progress is one thing, but losing all the tedious crafting you did before the mission is even worse.

Update: Running the game in windowed mode fixes Endless Eclipse crashes (played through 60 layers without a single problem). I will remove the -2 points.

[b]- Low amount of characters[/b]
Despite their uniqueness - the fact that there aren't more of them is to the detriment of this game. 7 characters total really isn't much. They could have easily take more characters from the original material and make them playable.

[b]- Censorship[/b]
The game begins with a depiction of a very famous (or infamous...) scene of forced intercourse, but ingame it's censored to a degree that you may not even understand that it's happening until later in the story where the consequences of this act are shown.

Crude brutality is an important thing in Berserk manga. Sexual abuse isn't just to shock the audience like in some shows where it's used inapropriately (Goblin Slayer or any Sword Art anime). In Berserk, themes of sexual violence are front-and-center and an important part of all character's backstory. Pretty much every single one of the main characters has suffered from some kind of abuse, even the main character was raped as a young boy. All this is in the manga. Then anime decided to neuter some of those scenes, but for the most part they stuck with the most important scenes. Now, the game... look - if you wanted to make a musou game with blood, but without sexual themes, then I'm sure there are many other series you could adapt, but Berserk is made much worse and less impactful by the means of censorship.

[h1]Lowdown[/h1]
A lot of negative reviews simply lament that this is a Musou-style game. While I understand the disappointment, you should probably do at least some basic research before you buy something. If you don't like Musou games - that's fine, but don't blame this game for being a genre that it's in.

As a Musou game it's at least adequate. It strikes all the important notes for how to make a decent Dynasty Warriors clone and it't few faults are only diminishing it's longevity and replayability, not fun from playing it in general.

That is unless you suffer from stability issues, just like me.

I'd give Berserk and the Band of the Hawk a
[h1]7/10[/h1]
I updated the score since my original review, removing the -2 for crashes. If you couldn't fix the problem then crashes are bad enough to warrant a 5/10.

A good game for anyone who likes Musou games, even better if you also like Berserk.
Check out my Fate/Extella LINK review if you want a Musou game with a more robust set of characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995421063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1651485938}
review:
While in the early campaign this is a decent Dynasty Warriors reskin, later in when you have to fight huge monsters it falls apart.  If you want a DW clone of the Golden Age arc with clips from the latest series this is fine.

My gripes:
The system they are using obviously wasn't designed with the larger bosses in mind. To start the camera is set to deal with cavalry at worst, so you'll mostly be locked onto the crotch of whatever you are fighting.
The actual combat design is poorly thought out as well. They have poorly defined hit boxes, massive stun locking attacks and just bully you with their mass and unending combo attacks. Combine that with multiple hp bars and never flinching at you attacks.  
You have a simple combo system but you'll never get to use any of it in these boss fights.  Also if you get pushed into a corner, just quit out.  They won't back off or stop using unblockable and (in the corner) undodgeable attacks.

It is beatable but just frustrating and for me that isn't fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989126720', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 3508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1652042539}
review:
This is a game for Berserk fans, if you're after a more filled out hack and slash game there are better options out there. I enjoyed myself playing this title but I'm an old Berserk fan. Like similar games in the genre it can get boring once you beat the story and try out the other modes just slashing apart humans & monsters repeatedly, the different play styles of characters and the various objectives do make it more interesting, and it is a great title like others in the genre to play while watching or listening to something on the side.

Pros: Currently has the most accurate representation of the manga in animated form, shows many characters not yet seen or fleshed out in the anime/movies and the story is mostly well done. Combat is smooth and objectives don't have you running around aimlessly. Movesets across playable characters are accurate in my opinion but can be frustrating to play as certain characters sometimes (but they can't all be beasts in battle lIke Guts & Zodd).

Cons: Objectives can be odd sometimes, base commanders on levels where it doesn't seem necessary to have them for example. Bosses can be annoying to fight due to their cheap moves and large size, they can trap you in a corner or block the camera, spam attacks you can't escape from causing your death.

Few characters playable, I would have liked to play as other characters from the series and I was confused why some characters were even made playable in the first place. Also key story moments were altered due to censorship issues that non fans of the series will be greatly confused by, again censorship also had key story moments entirely omitted from this release due to how graphic they are (while I do understand it would be nice to have had them in as some kind of option or dlc).

Summary: Truthfully this game may not be as interesting to people who are fans of other hack and slash games but aren't fans of the Berserk manga & even fans may get annoyed at the censorship, story omissions or lack of their favourite characters being playable. I do think the harsh reviews for the game aren't needed, it still holds it's own and it is great fun hacking away hordes of monsters with the dragonslayer. I do feel the game could have done with more content and not covering so many arcs in one game title as at times it did feel rushed as you go through the story. All in all I do recommend people to watch gameplay or give the game a try but not to buy the game at full price unless you are like me and are a sucker for the fact it is part of the Berserk universe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050137341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1651447440}
review:
As someone who swears by the anime.. This is a fantastic way of watching it all over again. Its actual clips from the Golden Age Arc. I wish it had English Audio but tbh the Japanese doesn't bother me here as it would watching the anime. 

The game itself is straight up dynasty warriors.. Which if you've played them.. Can be pretty entertaining. A bit a of grind at first but once you get going its more fun. The main thing here tho is the story. I can't get enough Berserk I wish they would finish the movies.

Overall if you are looking for slaughtering thousands of troops/winning battlefield battles I recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198983748095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1663190200}
review:
Un hombre marcado por seres de otro mundo, una venganza y batallas cruentas en el que el protagonista hace gala de sus habilidades para blandir una espada gigantesca. Humanos, demonios y seres de otro mundo peleando entre ellos para dominar al otro. Esta es la historia de Berserk,ste manga escrito y dibujado por Kentaro Miura cuenta las aventuras y desventuras del guerrero negro Guts en un mundo de estilo fant√°stico-medieval. √âste se encuentra en medio de un viaje lleno de violencia extrema en busca de venganza. Portando una espada de tama√±o inimaginable, batalla tras batalla se gana la vida como mercenario a la vez que va creciendo su leyenda como ‚Äúel guerrero negro‚Äù. Adem√°s del peso de su arma, carga a sus espaldas con otro peso. Nuestro protagonista est√° marcado por los demonios como sacrificio, lo que le har√° vivir de manera solitaria sin querer involucrar a nadie con su maldici√≥n. Pero aun no queri√©ndolo, acabar√° por tener compa√±eros de viaje. El manga narra el camino de venganza de Guts, un viaje hacia la oscuridad pero cuenta con peque√±as antorchas en su vida que ir√°n alumbrando poco a poco su camino. La primera, aunque peque√±a, es un peque√±o elfo llamado Puck, el cual es salvado por Guts en una pelea de taberna. Pese a no querer su compa√±√≠a, Puck le sigue ya que Guts le parece un individuo poco com√∫n lleno de ira. Al poco de salvarle, Guts es apresado y apaleado en unas mazmorras para m√°s adelante descubrir la existencia de demonios en el castillo. Estos demonios hacen que Guts se ponga en marcha ya que pueden ser parte de los ‚Äúcinco de la mano de dios‚Äù, quienes le matar. Guts decide ir al castillo donde no solo le esperaran demonios, sino un ej√©rcito entero que quiere su cabeza.
En esta parte del arco de la historia, teniendo en cuenta que solo hablo del primer tomo, pocos personajes m√°s pueden ser rese√±ables, o poni√©ndolo de otra manera, son personajes que destacan un poco m√°s que los ya rese√±ados siendo meros escalones para que avance la trama.

review:

Neyse sabƒ±r ettim gittim kol aldƒ±m sƒ±rf Berserk'i √ßok sevdiƒüim i√ßin o sa√ßma ilk b√∂l√ºm√º de ge√ßtim.  Senaryoya gayet baƒülƒ± kalmƒ±≈ülar . Sƒ±ra Sƒ±ra ilerleyip b√∂l√ºmleri ge√ßiyorsun, bosslarla kapƒ±≈üƒ±yorsun ve animenin sonuna kadar oyunu oynuyorsun. Oyun i√ßinde b√∂l√ºmlere ba≈ülarken ve b√∂l√ºmleri ge√ßerken bazende b√∂l√ºmlerin i√ßinde animeden sahneler koymu≈ülar benim gayet ho≈üuma gitti zaten dediƒüim gibi senaryoya baƒülƒ± kalarak ilerlƒ±yorsun. Tabi ki animenin her ince noktasƒ±na kadar detaylƒ± deƒüil zaten bundan fazlasƒ± olmaz diye d√º≈ü√ºn√ºyorum. Oyunun i√ßinde de story modunda yaklasƒ±k 43-45 tane b√∂l√ºm var onuda her b√∂l√ºm√º videoya cektiƒüimden biliyorum. Oyunda ilerledikce animeyi izleyenler tabiki bilir birileriyle tanƒ±≈üƒ±yorsun ve ortak sava≈ülƒ± b√∂l√ºmlerde yan karakterlerle de oynayabiliyorsunuz. Ve her karakterin ayrƒ± animasyon hareketleri ve silahlarƒ± var bence bu g√ºzel bir artƒ±. Ayrƒ±ca ana hikaye bittikten sonra farklƒ± bir modu var ve orda da paralƒ± asker gibi istediƒüiniz savasa istediƒüiniz karakterle girebiliyorsunuz. Hatta d√º≈ümanƒ±nƒ±z olan karakterlerle bile girebilirsiniz. Bence buda √ßok g√ºzel bir artƒ± √ß√ºnk√º oyunun kendi b√∂l√ºmleri bitirince ba≈ütan onlarƒ± oynamaktansa orda g√∂revleri yapƒ±p hem karakterlere lv kasarak hemde para kasƒ±p her birinin oynanƒ±≈üƒ±nƒ± tadabilirsiniz. 

Bu arada oyunun oynanƒ±≈ütan bahsetmeyi ihmal ettim biraz. Dediƒüim gibi oyunu oynarken oyun kolu ≈üart yoksa hi√ß denemeyin. Oyunda karakterlerin item ve lv sistemi var ki bence bu da g√ºzel bir artƒ± upgrade falan bile yapabiliyorsunuz itemleri.. ƒ∞lk ba≈üta karakterlerin lv leri d√º≈ü√ºk olduƒüundan √ßok fazla vuru≈ü combosuda yok sonradan combolar a√ßƒ±lƒ±yor. ƒ∞lk ba≈üta oyuna alƒ±≈üƒ±rken normalde √ßok alƒ±≈ükƒ±n olmadƒ±ƒüƒ±mdan bu tarz oyunlara biraz yadƒ±rgamistim ama sonradan oynadƒ±kca o mal moblarƒ± doƒüramak bile inanƒ±lmaz zevk vermeye ba≈üladƒ± .. A√ßƒ±kcasƒ± ben bile ≈üa≈üƒ±rdƒ±m √ß√ºnk√º genelde bu tarz oyunlarƒ± oynamam, aramam. ƒ∞llaki bu oyunu sevmemde Berserk'i cok sevmeminde etkisi olmu≈ütur ama oyun bence oynamaya deƒüer. Bir yandan ger√ßek√ßi olmakta gerekirse..Oyunun grafikleri tabiki olaƒüan √ºst√º deƒüil ama k√∂t√ºde deƒüil. Oynanƒ±≈ü hissiyatƒ± bakƒ±mƒ±ndan bakƒ±nca da illa ki en iyi oyun deƒüil ama k√∂t√º de deƒüil yani. Bu oyunu illa oynayƒ±p sevenlerde √ßƒ±kar sevmeyenlerde √ßƒ±kar. Ama o alƒ±≈üma s√ºrecine alƒ±≈üƒ±p ve kendisini oyunun hikayeli gidi≈üatƒ±na kaptƒ±ranlarƒ±n bitirmeden bƒ±rakacaƒüƒ±nƒ± d√º≈ü√ºnm√ºyorum. Yorumumda √ßok uzun ve ≈üekilsiz oldu ama son noktayƒ± koyuyorum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046531504', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3404, 'last_played': 1640011565}

author: {'steamid': '76561198383913341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1883, 'last_played': 1661652785}
review:
Boring hack-and-slash. If you want to play just to see what the anime/movie cut out, I still wouldn't recommend it. It's a lot of grinding to barely see scenes and characters that were understandably cut from from the motion pictures, and the scenes and character development aren't very well done.

It does go slightly past where the 2017 anime left off (including the battle between Guts/Zodd and Ganishka), and the Black Swordsman Arc is more accurate (the Snake Lord takes the role of The Count in the anime, however The Count's backstory and dark, macabre, tragic demise is not told in the game - also you get to see Puck rescued), however the storytelling and delivery is so bland that you don't care, and you're not gaining more insight into the story.

The only redeeming quality about this game is that it takes place in the Berserk universe, and despite that, I would not recommend it to a Berserk fan, much less someone not familiar with Berserk. Don't even buy if on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561199030345254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1707338752}
review:
I do recommend Berserk and the Band of the Hawk, to those who are Berserk fans and fans of causal easy fighting games. Since this game is very easy and can get repetive at alot of times and the only really challenges our the boss battles and even those are mostly easy. Only time I lost was to ZODD on the second fight with him but beat him after the second attempt. If your looking for something more engading and challenging. Then this game probably won't appeal to you but if you want a fan basic action game, to pass the time then you might get something out of it and if you are a fan of the Berserk Anime/Manga and if you just like swinging big swords around and having lots of blood splatter around. 



It don't get much better than that and the later Berserker Armour in the game is pretty rad. So yeah I personally think it is pretty solid, not as good as the 2004 PS2 Berserk game but still this is fairly decent i'd give it a 7/10 score personally.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304467388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 5325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5325, 'last_played': 1646779994}
review:
I'm a newcomer to the manga. Naturally I wanted any medium that covered the later arcs, so here I am. This game nearly made me go BERSERK on my computer or a nearby innocent bystander. 

Here are my bullet points on why you shouldn't bother with this game:
1) It's boring on casual playtime or teeth grinding frustrating on completion.
2) Graphics are so cheap and bland, it looks like a rushed game made by fan who just discovered Unity Assets.
3) Stories and characters are rushed, cut up, secondary and boring, which is a crime how dare you Koei?
4) Game doesn't give you clear instructions for missions with special conditions (I had to Google half of them myself)
5) Port is garbage and game crashes a lot specifically after completing a level.
6) You cannot save manually. Making it worse since the game crashes a lot.
7) The only satanic entity you should fear and loathe is the camera.
8) There are more grinding than Story 
9) The Endless Eclipse Mode is a torture simulator.
10) Did I mention the game crashes a lot ?

I hate this game as much as I love the manga. The price tag is an insult to any fan of the series. I'd say buy it if it's at least 70% off but even then I wouldn't recommend this joyless cashgrab. 
The only reason I played the game till completion so I can brag about having an achievement with the picture of the demonic horse (Yes THAT HORSE!!!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198395612393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2581, 'last_played': 1675606869}
review:
I can only recommend this moreso if it's on sale, which is a fairly rare occurrence sadly.

The gameplay itself is pretty good and can definitely get difficult, even on a normal difficulty when getting into the later parts of the endless dungeon, the music is alright, the story is (for the most part) the same as the manga. Probably the biggest downfalls this game has is the ingame cutscenes, which are laughably bad at most parts, since the models are all in extremely static poses and just standing. The other thing i could mention is that the roster is extremely limited with only 8 characters maximum. If you think the game is something you'd like, i would still highly recommend just waiting for a sale, but even then, they only lower it to 30$ as far as i've seen, so it's still a steep-ish price.

review:
BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk √©, resumidamente, um Dynasty Warriors no universo de Berserk. Apesar de jogos ao estilo musou estarem longe de serem meus favoritos, eu gostei e acabei me divertindo por ser um grande f√£ da obra no geral. 

A gameplay √© extremamente repetitiva e linear, n√£o recomendo para jogadores exigentes ou que nunca tiveram contato com Berserk. Caso queira consumir a hist√≥ria, que √© o ponto forte, leia o mang√°.

No mais, existe um modo livre onde √© poss√≠vel controlar diversos personagens da saga, inclusive vil√µes, e isso √© bem interessante, pois cada um possui uma abordagem diferente de combate.

Definitivamente o conte√∫do que Berserk proporciona nunca foi adaptado da forma como merece em outra esfera fora das p√°ginas, seja o pr√≥prio anime de 97 e os filmes (gosto bastante de ambos), ou todos os jogos j√° lan√ßados anteriormente. N√£o vou citar o anime de 2016, aquilo foi feito na base da sacanagem, n√£o tem outra explica√ß√£o. 

Com o universo desse calibre, que influenciou e muito diversas outras obras e autores (vide Dark Souls) seria poss√≠vel fazer um joga√ßo de Action RPG com no m√≠nimo umas 30 ou 40 horas de campanha... quem sabe um dia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142876156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1214, 'last_played': 1643670689}

les mauvais c√¥t√©s : un gameplay affreusement r√©p√©titif, les maps se ressemblent aucune n'est optionnelle, les ch√¢teaux sont un d√©dale de couloir large sans superbe tel un vieux jeux loup√© de g√©n√©ration PS1/N64, idem pour quelques d√©mons √† mourir de rire.
Enfin pour finir sur un go√ªt amer, apr√®s l'√©clipse le manga perd de sa superbe : le rythme s'acc√©l√®re, certains personnages cl√©s oubli√©s, et aucun extrait de Berserk (2016). sniff

review: Would I recommend this to a casual player? No it's pretty fucking boring, but if you're a massive Berserk fan like me I guess it's quite enjoyable, at least for the story it is. If you want to consume the story, read the manga or if you'e not into that, watch the 97' anime. This game is even better than the 2016 anime, so never touch that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111630445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7850, 'last_played': 1643323194}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qGauJZLu1r4
[h1]KOEI TECMO And Berserk[/h1]
La obra cumbre de Kentaro Miura, Berserk, regresa a los videojuegos de mano de Omega Force y Koei Tecmo (aut√©nticos padres del g√©nero "musou"). Prepararos para disfrutar de una gran adaptaci√≥n del anime en exclusiva. Y los invitamos a que nos sigas en un viaje salvaje, junto a Guts  y dem√°s personajes del manga,  en este juego de combate tipo "musou". y ¬øqu√© significa eso? Pues que recupera el estilo de combates multitudinarios contra oleadas de enemigo

Berserk Band of the Hawk se centra en la historia de Guts: un tipo duro (y hu√©rfano) que busca venganza desesperadamente... y no voy a desvelar nada m√°s, para no estropear la trama a quienes no conozcan la obra original. Su argumento es terriblemente fiel a la serie y aglutina tanto el arco argumental llamado "La edad dorada" como el denominado "El halc√≥n milenario", con lo que abarca la mayor parte del manga... que a√∫n no ha terminado.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D36sdkpzigo
[h1]Modos de juego[/h1]
El modo de juego principal de Berserk es el Story Mode, y se compone de una buena cantidad de misiones en que debemos ir cumpliendo objetivos. La variedad de estas misiones no es la cualidad principal del t√≠tulo, ya que casi siempre tenemos que lograr los mismos objetivos: acabar con unos enemigos determinados, proteger un lugar especial o facilitar la hu√≠da de otros personajes. Adem√°s de estos objetivos principales, Band of the Hawk cuenta con una serie de misiones secundarias que nos otorgan "Behelits" con los que completamos una galer√≠a de im√°genes. 
Y por si fuera poco, al final de algunos niveles nos vamos a encontrar con jefes finales que requieren de toda nuestra habilidad con la espada. El sistema de combate es un digno heredero de todo lo que hemos visto en desarrollos anteriores de Omega Force, como Dynasty Warriors o Arslan. As√≠ es posible ejecutar golpes r√°pidos y otros potentes, para ejecutar combos sencillos, que se vuelven demoledores a medida que ganamos experiencia. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m0JNHlL7Lus
[h1]Violento como el anime[/h1]
Los momentos m√°s espectaculares de Berserk and the Band of the Hawk corresponden  cuando utilizamos los ataques especiales o "death blows". Son acciones capaces de acabar de un plumazo con todos los enemigos que nos rodean... de la forma m√°s bestia. Es un reflejo muy fiel del manga, que no escatima en usar litros de sangre y miembros cercenados para ilustrar lo efectivo de los ataques. Huelga decir que no se trata de un juego para todos los p√∫blicos, aunque tenga un aspecto de dibujos animados.
En comparaci√≥n con otros juegos del estudio el n√∫mero de personajes que podemos manejar en Berserk es bastante reducido. Y es que a Guts s√≥lo se le une una selecci√≥n de los h√©roes que aparecen en el manga, como Griffith, Zodd o Serpico... hasta hacer un total de ocho. Eso s√≠, todos estos personajes de Berserk gozan de un amplio repertorio de movimientos √∫nicos , as√≠ como de armas y habilidades exclusivas.  Adem√°s, podemos personalizar ligeramente a nuestro h√©roe, y escoger los objetos que va a utilizar antes de cada combate. 

Adem√°s del modo Historia, Berserk incluye dos modos adicionales para prolongar nuestra experiencia: uno de ellos es el "Free Mode" que repite los niveles de la historia, pero que nos permite jugar con el personaje que prefiramos. El segundo modo extra tiene m√°s gracia: en el "Eclipse Mode" tenemos que superar los encargos de distintos personajes mientras superamos oleadas de enemigos. Eso s√≠, no tenemos opci√≥n para dos jugadores.
Con todo, lo que ofrece Berserk and the Band of the Hawk me parece suficiente para considerarlo un buen representante del g√©nero. En particular, le va a encantar a todos los seguidores de la obra original. Puede que no capture su brutalidad por completo, ya que viene censurado de Jap√≥n, pero se acerca bastante. Aqu√≠ les hablamos de los animes Berserk, La edad de oro:  la batalla de Doldrey y La edad de oro: El advenimiento.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031197526', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2810, 'last_played': 1664037698}
review: As a new Berserk fan, after watching the movies for the first time this past Christmas, I immediately bought this game and I wasn't disappointed at all. Sure the controls are very very wonky but after a while you learn them and it will take time to master them. The story is great if you know the lore of Berserk especially in the later story but they show movie footage during the Golden Age so that should be easier to understand for non fans than later where they don't have any clips. The playable characters are somewhat disappointing since you can only play as 8 but there could've been a lot more (WHERE IS SKULL KNIGHT???). Overall it's a great game to get your fustrations out  and if you're a fan of Berserk then it's a must buy but I would wait for a sale and not spend the whole $60. I would give this a solid 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198036233434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1674438558}
review:
Absolutely the best Drakengard game.

But definitely one of the worst Musou/Warriors games, from the title on. It's a trainwreck, and that's especially a shame, though it shouldn't be a surprise for any Berserk fan. It's not optimized for PC, it's horribly unstable, and it's a massive chore to get working even on an extremely powerful system. There are few playable characters, and you only have any real incentive to ever play one: Guts. Gameplay is unbelievably tedious and slow as a result, and even the new things they played with in this title aren't worth using. It's also one of those games where you aren't given a dedicated jump button, which is always going to be frustrating, sooner or later.

You can turn off movies, and you'll want to. And while I'm a fan of Berserk in a general sense, the story isn't done any favors by its adaptation here. It's especially awful to start off at a more exciting part in the story and, as always, have to rehash the Band of the Hawk story. I may differ from some fans in this, but I am so tired of retreading that story, and in my opinion, it's among the weakest of the whole run. Berserk presents so many options for plenty of better, more interesting stories.

I'm a huge fan of the Warriors series, but this is one of those tie-ins that just shouldn't have ever happened. It would be more forgivable if it had been a good solid port, but it's not. It's crashy and has huge issues that will probably never be resolved. A game this old now should not be so unstable. This should have been figured out long before now.

Just to note, I originally pre-ordered this game for Vita and got to experience the disappointment twice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984405758', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1671714395}
review:
i Hate this game.

i LOVE BERSERK R.I.P. MIURA
Some games are mindless fun....this junk is just mindless....
i bought this so maybe we get more berserk. I throw money at this franchise because it's my favorite series of all time!!!! I just want more of this franchise so please just buy it, that's why I recommended it.
it's not a matter of "i wont buy an inferior product becasue of blah blah blah" if you pay for it they make more of it no matter what.


there's clearly some effort here, the graphical fidelity isn't too bad but there's really not much love or care put into the presentation. there really isn't much opf a challenge or anything compelling gameplay wise. beyond maybe an hour of the initial rush of cleaving dozens of foes at a time just like in the original comic. The comic is the reason im happy to shell out money for some of my favorite franchies just to see them take another crack. this game doesn't come close to the PS2 Berserk game, and I'd honestly rather play the dreamcast game instead of this and that game isn't particlarly good. 

Only boss characters really have any  interesting attack patterns, and you can easily brute force them anyway on all but the ridicoulous highest difficulty level. standard enemies might as well be inanimate objects, but this is the only thing the game and it's control of guts really excels at reproducing: the feeling of briefly being cuts during moments like when he slaughtered 100 men and had his early nickname i cant remember.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049329792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 2002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1648770180}
review:
Fun until the fight against the snake baron. There you really feel how awful the camerawork and stunloops are. You can't see a damn and you're often stuck between a wall and an enmies attack. The normal enemies are no deal at all (at least on easy), but the fights against big bosses are really terrible. From then on, the fights get extremely repetitive, tactic doesn't matter, attacks don't matter (much), neither does blocking or upgraded items. It's literally pure button smashing.
I loved the manga, loved the anime, liked the 3d anime and somewhat like this game. But it's not fun after the first vfew battles. I recommend everyone to watch a lets play instead. I'm especially angry because those flaws could be easily fixed with some small tweaks like letting you zoom out and changing enemy attack patterns to prevent spamming the same attack over and over again. There is no excuse for the game being that bad.
Aside from that, the game is okish.

Oh and of course the cut scenes are censored, but thank god, there are mods.

review:
Un mus√¥ tout ce qu'il y a de plus classique. C'est √† dire que c'est bourrin, peu subtil, peu complexe. Mais d'une part le genre colle plut√¥t bien √† une adaptation de Berserk et ensuite j'avais lu que le jeu retra√ßais l'histoire d'une quarantaine de tomes. N'ayant vu que les derniers films sur Netflix je me suis dit que √ßa pouvait √™tre sympa de d√©couvrir l'histoire autrement.
Pas de bol, le jeu reprend la structure et le cheminement des films, et ins√®re des extraits de ceux-l√† entre les missions. Du coup, je connais d√©j√†.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205917444', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1652289711}
review: Kentaro Miura created my favorite manga of all time, Berserk. It'll never get an ending yet It'll be known forever as one of the greatest pieces of media ever created. I hate having to utter he is no longer with us as of May 6, 2021, It's actually stupid we lost a God among humans. Please read Berserk, you won't regret it. And I know this is under a review for Berserk and the Band of the Hawk, and I'll just say It's a pretty fun button mashing game mainly only enjoyable for Berserk fans, It's just Dynasty Warriors with Berserk slapped over but It's still a great game nonetheless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198224202520', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1706759433}
review:
Pretty good port, the game is lack-luster...but that's because it's a Dynasty Warriors title.

The gameplay is a bit clunky, hack-and-slash games usually always have awful camera handling...which this game does have on controller (the intended and most well supported method of playing the game to be frank) but the combat is overall enjoyable for what it is and it does actually handle like you are legitimately hitting something...not one of those games to feel like you're just swinging at air. The graphics are great too and the environments are pretty nice...especially given the context that we don't really see them fleshed out in the manga or any of the official anime adaptations.

It does somewhat capture Berserk, it's fun if you like horde hack-and-slash games and Berserk, but if you want an authentic Berserk gaming experience check out "Sword of the Berserk: Guts' Rage" (JP: Berserk Millennium Falcon Arc: Chapter of the Flowers of Oblivion) for the Dreamcast. Not only is it a good game that hasn't aged all that poorly, but it is actually canon despite people not even knowing it exists. Not only that, but it features the return of Susumu Hirasawa, one of the composers from the 1997 adaptation...most well known for the track "FORCES".

author: {'steamid': '76561198449330203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1641321532}
review: Overall its a fun game if you're a Berserk fan, but it does cut out a lot of things from the manga, like Luca and her girls are cut out, Roderick is cut out even though the game ends with them on the boat, the fight at the ball at Vritannis is changed so you just rescue Farnese who is in a big empty room, and the bonfire of dreams takes place with Guts looking at a brazier. There are many more smaller thing that the game either cuts out or changes so it makes the story not flow as well but it is still a pretty fun game if your a Berserk fan, fighting with the berserker armour is also really fun. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198121399920', 'num_games_owned': 1257, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 11831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11831, 'last_played': 1550119526}
review:
I would only recommend if you're both a fan of the Warriors games/formula AND of Berserk. Its really interesting to control Guts kill as many men as he is reported to do in the manga.

However the Warrior formula is very basic in this game without innovation. So you're basically paying to experience the Manga/Anime which is why you should like both if you're getting into this game. I think Berserk is one of the easiest Mangas to imagine as a Warriors type game, but I wish there had been another take on it. Or maybe it would have transitioned into a more souls-like combat for bosses to make them have more emotional impact and struggle like from the source materiel. This type of game is just very poor at presenting a serious tone, there's so much emotion and depression, sadness and rage wrapped up in a lot of the characters in the series, and it just doesn't come across in a game like this. Its hard to feel a strong emotional connection when you're slapping X and killing literally hundreds of people.

But alas, hopefully we'll see some other adaptations, but with the passing of the great Kentaro Miura who knows what will happen with the property.

author: {'steamid': '76561198351732504', 'num_games_owned': 882, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1678869765}
review:
What a shame, this could have been something really special, but they chose the safe path. I give this a thumb up because it is Berserk, still a functional and somewhat an enjoyable game, but god dawg is it disappointing. 

So what is good first?
+ Gore is great (first gore in a Warrior game), the blood splat is a bit excessive, there is dismemberment where you can see soldiers got slashed into pieces and dropped on the ground. Overall they put up a good show.
+ Combat is enjoyable.
+ Graphic is nice and performance is smooth.
+ They covered a large portion of the manga, no critical segment is left as cutscene.

Ok so the bad?
- The Eclipse (both chapter and the mode) is fucking boring and disappointing, they didn't even try.
- You can play all characters in all stages in Free mode, but to unlock more states, you need to play Story mode. 95% portion of the Story mode you are locked to play only Guts, which is reasonable right? Since you mostly follow him in the manga. The problem is, this is a Warrior game, and you know the move set of a character in these games is very limited (because there are many many characters in other Warrior games that you can choose in Story mode). So, at the very least, they should have add more skills to Guts to unlock gradually. But no! They keep the same basic Warrior-style moveset for him the entire game!!!! Yes, you basically XXXX, XYY, XXYY, etc. you way through the entire game! It's literally a chore to play!
- Berserker armor is fast and destructive but his move set is very messy to look at, and very limited too. The only cool thing is his spin attack. Overall it is disappointing.
- They bare the Warrior format 100% here without trying to modify it to somewhat fit in the manga scenario, very low effort.
- In many stages you can just run straight to the goal. 
- The important set pieces are rushed and boring ones are dragged to hell. 
- Horrible AI (as usual).

The critic's scores are correct, this game is medicore, 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198409956587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1640495666}
review:
TL;DR: not a good PC port, a shit deal even on sale, buy it on console instead.  

As a major BERSERK fan, I wasn't  expecting much from this game than from being a celebration of the BERSERK series,
so I bought it on sale because I took the advice of the reviewers down below, after buying this game and waiting an hour for the bloody thing to install, I was greeted with "restart this game to install the Windows 7 compatibility patch" even though I was using Windows 10.

I just brushed it off and continued, the game's video was squished too all hell and had very shitty, confusing keyboard controls and the tutorial showed controller buttons only.

The feeling was very off, I felt like I paid 23.99 for a choppy emulation, let's hope for a better BERSERK game to come to steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043789946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1658514158}
review:
Gameplay is the same as Dynasty Warriors and Samurai Warriors: super OP characters bashing through massive quantity of enemies. Nothing new here, no big surprises and nothing that will stand out compared to other games.

Graphic is pretty meh since it was launched to PS3 and PS4 as well. 

You will probably buy this because you like Berserk and want to relive the first and most memorable (I guess) arc story.

The animation/cutscene is copy pasted from the Berserk: The Golden Age Arc movie. The game tells the story very poorly, so if you are new to Berserk I suggest you watch the movie or the anime (1997 ver. preferably). Funny that in-game models are more similar to the latest anime (2016 ver.).

Overall a good game.

RIP Kentaro Miura. Your masterpiece is incomplete, but the story and the characters will be forever in our hearts.

[spoiler]Fucc you Griffith. And you fucc you too if you think he did nothing wrong.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561199107888635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 5392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5392, 'last_played': 1638936564}
review:
[h1] 6.5/10 [/h1]

BERSERK, I love it since I knew about this series through this game and got to know it.  However, this game sucked.

Very low character playability experience, Uninteresting level design, this game could ‚Äãbe good, but it doesn't. 

Its story is the only place worthy of your experience in this game, but only before the Golden Age ends. The subsequent story has a very poor experience in the game. If you are not interested in the Dynasty Warriors games or the BERSERK series, this game is not your cup of tea. Also, this game may be very bloody, and the story of this game is also very dark and full of tragedy. You should not try this game, if you could not accept or appreciate this kind of story, too.

On the whole, the story of BERSERK is very impressive, however, this game is a little bad.
Finally, R.I.P, legendary manga artist Kentaro Miura, creator of 'Berserk, thank you for the good story you have brought to us.

review:

You will kill hundreds to thousands of enemies as you progress through 
the story mode. There are also other modes.
There is items to get which you can enhance with stones.
It plays like Dynasty Warriors or at least that's what I heard.
You can slash everything as if they are twigs in a tornado.
As a fan of the series I enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028002660', 'num_games_owned': 855, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1198, 'last_played': 1636250391}
review:
Good musou/warriors game, meaning for people that likes destroying hundreds of enemies while mashing attacks. This is not anywhere near a Dark Souls experience, so don't come expecting that, even if Berserk would work perfectly.
As the manga's story wasn't near being complete when it released (not even today, as we know), the game's story just stops at certain point. I wouldn't have minded if they made some original stages that "ended" the whole story even if they could call them "Dream stages" or something, like in other Warriors games.
Would have also been nice if there was some other kind of better mode than Endless Eclipse, for better replayability, like a conquest mode or something, as this is all about war...

RIP Miura, I really hope we can see the end of the story someday, even if it won't be by his creative mind and awesome drawing skills anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038094265', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1633411897}
review:
This is a botch Japanese PC port. Something that is a bit of a rarity in 2021. What's even more disappointing is that this game is from the same developer of Dynasty Warriors. Who have proven in the past to be competent at porting their games to PC. Dynasty Warriors 8: Empires is a great port with excellent controller mapping so I don't know what happened here. Maybe it was their Z-team working on this port. 
First of all, the game barely runs at all. I have a decent MSI PC. I'm not gonna go into specs, but it can run Crysis 3 without so much as a stutter, but I can barely run this port because it has been optimized so poorly. So if you want to play this game, let me give you a rundown of what your Graphical options will be:

Resolution 800x600
No Fullscreen.
Everything else either low or off (I still kept enemies to their maximum, because it's Berserk after all)
I gave myself a little treat and kept Anti-aliasing on.

With these options the game will usually run at a steady frame-rate...usually. But with no fullscreen and the low resolution, it'll feel like you're playing it on a handheld. Plus with all those fancy graphical settings turned off, it'll barely look better than a PS2 game. This is a travesty because the appeal of the Berserk Manga is it's beautiful visuals. Furthermore there are intensely bad graphical glitches that smear the screen and essentially make the game unplayable.

As for the gameplay itself...It's a Dynasty warriors game but with Berserk characters. I like the shallow mindless hack-and-slash of Dynasty Warriors, and I like Berserk. I wasn't asking for much. I thought "Finally! I can go through the entire Manga in one medium or another." I was really looking forward to this game taking me to the later parts of the Manga. Unfortunately, this port is just like the Anime: Shoddy, lazy, and insulting to the Franchise. Get the Console Version if you can, otherwise, just go play Darksouls with the Guts Sword, or Mount and Blade/Dynasty Warriors if its large scale battles you want. Don't waste your time on this garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090109435', 'num_games_owned': 2290, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5440, 'last_played': 1632782086}
review:
Yes! I love the anime/manga and I love this game for what it is. It's kinda hard to recommend this game to some 
who doesn't know Berserk and what it is but if you like those warriors games you'll feel at home in a dark fantasy world were things go down hill pretty fast. If you wanna dip your toes in the show itself then watch the Golden Age Arc and then play the game. The endless mode is a bit unfair to certain characters and money becomes redundant at a certain point especially when you are wanting to 100% the game.
If you are gonna try and 100% this game save at least one kind of item every item to save yourself.
8/10 "Too big, too thick, too heavy, and too rough, it was more like a large hunk of iron."

author: {'steamid': '76561198106585037', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 5553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1635799131}
review:
DO NOT BUY this game unless you are a huge Berserk fan (buy it on sale).

Cons:
-Its a game focused on extreme repetition, killing and killing thousands of extremely weak masses of enemies. Slash, repeat, slash repeat every single level.
-You need to play it on hard right from the start to find it a little bit more enjoyable and even then it is almost impossible to lose in any scenario.
-Scenarios have nothing special on them, they are closed, completely plain and need no exploration at all. Very repetitive.
-No matter what enemy type you are facing it feels like there is only 1 type of enemy with different skins. Their AI is the worst and its seriously so easy that you will sometimes wonder if they actually have attack moves in hard difficulty.
-Battle preparation screen is totally pointless. At first you might find it exciting and think it will add strategical value to your fights by knowing where your allies and enemies are located. You will think that it will help you to coordinate your objectives. Just hack and slash your way through everything you see, there is 0 strategy in this game. 
-Itemization is pointless as well. It does not bring anything fun to the game and there is no real until extreme later parts of the game.
-Horses are not even fun to ride, they add nothing to the game except for the extra speed to reach for the next wave of enemies, and as soon as you reach them you will want to keep going on foot right away because of how uncomfortable and unenjoyable it feels. Controls while riding¬† are not very responsive as well.
-Weapons like the crossbows, daggers and even the hand-cannon of guts are useless. Again, you only need to press 2 buttons to beat this game (attack and charge attack)


Pros:
-Weapons mentioned before are actually cool to play with and can be effective against bosses if used correctly.
-Basically includes the movies
-Great soundtracks.
-The amazing story and its superb character development is one of the few things that will want you to keep playing and enjoyng the scenarios. Basically the thrill of what is happening next even if you already know the story.
-Playing and being part of your favorite characters will totally make a fan enjoy this game.
-The endless Eclipse does make the game more challenging if you do want to go for all the achievements, making the game more fun and enjoyable (still completely repetitive but makes it a lot better).

author: {'steamid': '76561198062566128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 5000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3350, 'last_played': 1632943592}
review:
Before you buy this game you must understand that this is a "Warriors/Musou" game. If you've never played a game of this sort then maybe do a little research on what that consists of. Musou games are incredibly repetitive, blind fun, mind numbing hack and slash affairs filled with bombastic spectacle and ridiculous kill counts. I had absolutely no idea what BERSERK was before playing this game. Of course I know of the subject matter however was not very familiar with the characters or plot. (Fuck Griffith) This is honestly one of the best Musou games I've ever played, hands down. The main story mode will provide absolutely no challenge whatsoever on the lower difficulties. If you want to 100% this game and play all the various challenges. Good luck to you, this game has broken my brain Femto can fuck off and die. This is one of the most fluent and satisfying Musou games out there. The challenges, like all Musou games, can fuck off and rot. I hate this dogshit endless eclipse horrorshow. I love this game, buy it if it's on sale and have an awesome time absolutely massacring hordes of little pushovers that sob in the wake of Guts.

TLDR: This isn't a Berserk game, it's a Musou game that has a Berserk theme. Swish Swish, Clang Clang. Story mode - easy, Challenge mode - absolutely fucked.

Fuck Griffith, any of you incels who dare to defend this man are cracked and need to be admitted. I long for death.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091346049', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1378, 'last_played': 1676440779}
review:
Dynasty Warriors-esque game with a sprinkle of manga/anime on top. 

You had a bad day at the office? Use Frenzy.

Your girlfriend broke up with you? Use Frenzy.

Your pet goldfish died? Use Frenzy.

In short, this game is therapeutic in the sense of using your pure, unyielding rage to smite your enemies with the Wrath of God.

After a while, the combat gets repetitive and the dialogue is sitting around the campfire. If that doesn't bother you; then have a whack at it (pun intended).

As Vince McMahon would say in that WWF Wrestlemania Arcade Game: "He's gone Berserk!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198049091479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1599, 'last_played': 1674639376}
review:
This game is exactly what a Berserk game should be. It'll appeal to fans of Berserk and fans of the Musou type games, and maybe even hack and slash fans.

The storyline is a pretty okay abridged version of about 90-95% of Berserk's plot, only missing the last ~10 years of development. (It was a long boat ride, okay?) Some of the scenes during the Golden Age arc are adapted from the anime movies and look absolutely gorgeous. After that, they strictly use CGI for the cutscenes, and for the most part, it looks good. I take umbridge with Guts's "grimacing" face, the first time I saw it I died laughing because it looked like he was at the dentist's. Otherwise they do a good job. The game's got a lot of cutscenes, which is a big plus if you're a Berserk fan.

The gameplay is standard for this genre, what I'll call "horde hack and slash" instead of the "horde shooter" genre. The most significant attracter to this game over others in the same genre is that you're playing as Berserk characters, and it feels like it. When you play Guts, you swing that big, heavy sword around just like he does in the manga. It's got weight, it's got heft, and most importantly, it's got the power. Griffith moves like demonic lightning, Zodd is heavy and powerful, Wyald is... well, wild, the list goes on. It really feels like you're playing through Berserk, and I loved every single second of it.

The only downside I see is the missed opportunities for playable characters. Why we got Wyald over Skull Knight, I'll never know. I kept thinking I'd unlock more characters and then found out there's only 8, and none of them were Skull Knight. You get his horse, but not him?! C'mon.

This game gets a big recommend from me. It's exactly what it says it is, and it's good at it. If it sounds like it would appeal to you, it probably will. It's an older game, but still full priced, so pick it up on a sale if you can. I got this game, the scenarios DLC, and the horse DLC (because I HAD to get That Horse, Berserk fans know the one) for around $30 and consider that a pretty good deal for the enjoyment I'm getting out of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097167626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1314, 'last_played': 1657416120}
review:
Honestly, if you're a gamer looking to get a taste of Berserk's incredible story, this is not a bad place to start. It's a lot of fun, the writing is immaculate, the slow descent into dark fantasy madness is incredibly compelling, and it's actually shockingly well optimized. It does suck that there's only eight playable characters, especially when far more than that are present with obviously unique movesets, but the characters that are there all have distinct playstyles(Guts prioritizing huge sweeping strikes with high burst damage, Casca focused around combos, Zodd around devastating blows and mixups with his abilities, etc) that make each one a truly unique beast. Is it a tad overpriced? Kinda, yeah. Can it get repetitive? Well, it's a musuo game, of course it can. But did I enjoy it? Hell yes. Fingers crossed we get a sequel with an expanded roster, I'd LOVE to play as my boy Rickert or Grunbeld or hell, even Skull Knight.

RIP, Kentaro Miura. We'll miss ya.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979693740', 'num_games_owned': 5710, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1109, 'last_played': 1701217340}
review:
One of the few Berserk-licensed media, in any form, that doesn't [i]just[/i] focus on the Golden Age arc.  For that reason alone, this game is a joy to play for any Berserk fan because you can finally experience events from the entire span of work instead of just what the old 90s anime covered.  I didn't even watch the newer one because it was just so fugly.

That said, while this is a fine title and fun for fans, it is arguably among the lower tier of musou games in terms of what's on offer and the spread of characters you have available, but this is more using the musou format to cover the story of Berserk rather than trying to making a true musou game out of it, if that makes any sense.  With that in mind, the game serves the content well and covers all of the major events you can think of from the manga.

Berserk is the foundation for lots of peoples' imaginations, inspiring the likes of Dark Souls and even Cloud Strife, and it is dear to many, many hearts.  As a dyed-in-the-wool fan of the manga (it is on my extremely exclusive list of Best Things Ever Made, sharing a shelf with the likes of Band of Brothers and the current Hitman trilogy), I recommend this game, even if it isn't the best of its category, because it is exactly what I wanted out of a Berserk game ever since I played "Sword of" on the Dreamcast a bajillion years ago.

RIP Miura-sensei.  You left us too soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998332513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 2430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1843, 'last_played': 1631810345}
review: A very good setting for a Warriors style game. Warning on it for depictions of sexual assault. A gruesome world. Very close to the manga in terms of its detail, but the levels are set chronologically. Good replayability, and I like the sound design and voiceovers (Japanese over English subtitles). I am currently working on 100%ing it - about 66% done at 30 hours. If you are a fan of Berserk or Dynasty Warriors titles, this is an easy recommendation for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098429739', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1631490145}
review:
If this game is on sale when you see it and you are a fan of BERSERK then you should just pick it up. 

The animation and graphics are nice to look at and it definitely brings a new experience to the anime. I enjoy this as a casual "I don't want to stress about anything and I want to HACK and SLASh hoards of enemies" kind of game - it is fun, the combos are smooth and in my opinion movement is responsive.

An issue I read about and noted was the fact that it would be more enjoyable with a controller. I spent a bit of time adjusting my keyboard controls to make it work and I found it OKAY to play through the introduction and first mission, I could go through and make further adjustments /or/ just use a controller (then i'd have to leave the house to buy one *UGH*)...

You do not need a high-end PC build to run this but everything still looks nice!
I don't think there will be any complicated puzzles but you could still challenge yourself by increasing the difficulty. I think it is just a simple and enjoyable title to play and to watch - although I don't think it's worth full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962245021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1631721666}
review:
May adjust my review as I get further into the game, but I feel like I get it, mostly because it's a by-the-books musou game. If you've played one, you've pretty much played them all. I'm by no means an expert on the musou genre, though, so feel free to take that with a grain of salt. For reference, the ones I've played the most are Dynasty Warriors 4 (back on the PS2), Hyrule Warriors (on the Switch), and now BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk. Of those, Hyrule Warriors is far and away the best, but BERSERK's got its charms. Here's what I think about the game.

Pros:
+The musou genre is a good fit for BERSERK, for the most part. You wanna feel like Guts, killing dozens of enemies at a time with your giant sword? This is as close to that experience as you'll probably get.
+As is generally the case with recent musou titles, there's lots of stuff to collect. I'm sure you could really get into it if you wanted and could find a pretty deep system here. I'm not about to min-max this game, I'm just looking for something to play casually as I read the Berserk manga and watch the 2016-2017 anime and this fits the bill. But it's there if you want it.
+The game is pretty true to the Berserk canon so far. Before and after missions, there are surprisingly lengthy clips from the Golden Arc movies, which is a nice treat, I guess. Nothing touches the 1997 anime, but the inclusion of cutscenes from the movies puts the game above Hyrule Warriors in the story-telling department, at least. Also, the little audio snippets you unlock after completing missions all seem to be lines from the manga/animes. Which is to say, the game hews closely to the story we all know and love, even if it is a musou first and foremost.
+It's Berserk

Cons
-I mentioned above that the musou genre is a pretty good fit for Berserk, for the most part. Where it isn't a good fit for Berserk is in the one-on-one battles. It can't be beat when it comes to slaughtering dozens of enemies at once, but when you're facing off against a single monster, it's really easy to see how bland and repetitive the gameplay is. If you're in the mood for a game that accurately represents a challenging one-on-one experience, then look no further than Dark Souls (heavily influenced by Berserk, and you can even play a greatsword build). 
-Hyrule Warriors spoiled me. There is so much content in that game, even if it is built around relatively mindless musou gameplay. I haven't dived into everything here, but I can already tell there's less to do than in that game.
-Strip away the Berserk coat of paint, and it's just another generic musou. If you like Berserk, then this is definitely the musou to play. If you just want to try out the genre, there are probably better options for that (*cough* Hyrule Warriors *cough*). 
-Censorship. It's not a deal-breaker for me; I'm not about to go turbo autismo over not seeing Casca's nips for the n-teenth time, and I can understand why they couldn't go balls-to-the-wall here, but still. The manga doesn't pull any punches, so when this game does, you notice it.
-Not worth the full price. It also rarely goes on sale. I got it for $23.99, which feels like a fair price for the amount of game you get here. I don't regret buying it. Any more expensive than that and I probably would. They really should just permanently lower it to $19.99.

TL;DR: If you like Berserk, get this game when it's on sale. After all, you have to take your Berserk where you can get it, as we likely won't be getting any more.

Those are my thoughts. Do with them what you will. And as everyone else has said, RIP Miura.

review:
Como descrever o qu√£o pat√©tico esse jogo √©...

Vendo de cara as analises est√£o como "extremamente positivas " logo deve ser um jogo bom.. n√©??? N√£o.
A maioria das analises s√£o em cima da morte do Kentaro Miura.

Come√ßando com o port: 
- N√£o tem como jogar no teclado, caso voc√™ quiser, ser√° necess√°rio baixar programas para portar movimentos do seu mouse para teclas, assim redefinindo e conseguindo minimamente fazer o movimento da c√¢mera 
- A resolu√ß√£o m√°xima √© 1280x768 ( Lan√ßado em 2017)
- Mesmo usando patches feito por f√£s, o fps fica travado em 47 (fora de combate) e em combate vai de 28 at√© 18fps

Gameplay:
Os menus, caixas de di√°logos, mapas s√£o todos reciclados dos outros jogos da empresa (como dynasty warriors e pirate warriors )
- O jogo √© um Musou, ou seja 200 inimigos na tela devastando seu fps, que n√£o te atacam e s√≥ ficam andando (mesmo n√£o optando pela dificuldade f√°cil) tem uma pouca variedade de movimentos a principio. 
- Os objetos se resumem a " capture tal objetivo ", " mate tal inimigo (normalmente inimigos " especiais " mas eles sempre gen√©ricos, repetidos e reciclados), destrua tal coisa e qualquer coisa do g√™nero. 
- A dificuldade √© **nula**, os inimigos ficam parados na sua frente, uma hora ou outra algu√©m tenta fazer algum ataque, e quando acerta n√£o tira nada de vida. (mesmo n√£o optando pela dificuldade easy)

A " parte anime ":

- A anima√ß√£o √© at√© aceit√°vel, apesar de ser muito utilizado o 3D e ser muito pouco expressivo e for√ßado em algumas partes.
- As bocas dos personagens dialogando n√£o encaixam na dublagem (que por sinal n√£o √© l√° das melhores).
- Tem v√°rias coisas que n√£o fazem sentido, como em uma parte que preciso enfrentar e **matar** o Corkus, sendo que 10 minutos depois ele t√° de boassa sem nenhum ferimento.
- Pelo tempo que eu tentei aguentar aparentemente a adapta√ß√£o est√° levemente fiel, tendo v√°rias incoer√™ncias comparado com o mang√° / anime, mas d√° para relevar.
- O jogo s√≥ tem em ingl√™s, n√£o que seja um problema para mim, mas √© bom mencionar

Me arrependo de ter comprado ? 
-N√£o, consegui me divertir apreciando essa divindade em forma de jogo que Kentaro Miura nos proporcionou. A ousadia de isso sequer ser lan√ßado. Mas felizmente irei pedir reembolso

Se voc√™ estiver lendo e tiver o m√≠nimo interesse, seja em ter uma nova experi√™ncia com a obra, ou se divertir jogando, possivelmente o jogo n√£o √© tudo isso e provavelmente n√£o vai conseguir lhe proporcionar isso. (como aconteceu comigo), e lembre-se esse jogo foi feito para tirar dinheiros de f√£s ing√™nuos da obra (como eu)

author: {'steamid': '76561198161522385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2214, 'last_played': 1643246807}
review: It is obviously not the game you play if you are not a fan of Berserk, you gotta know the anime to find this game more enjoyable and that is my case and honestly, you cannot demand much from a Dynasty Warriors type game, it's mindless slashing and hacking with a giant sword, it's fun to just turn off your brain and obliterate everything in front of you as Guts using the Dragonslayer, though I do have to say that there is a quite steep difficulty curve, there is a point in the game where you truly feel like it's impossible to pass, mostly in the endless eclipse, and the fact that the cooler rewards are locked behind that is quite infuriating, though I still enjoyed reliving the story, it went for a lot longer than I thought it would, it really went deep into the story, but regardless, it is a game that you need to be a very specific sort of fan to enjoy, if you are looking for deep gameplay and in depth strategy then this is not your game, it is good mindless fun for a fan of Berserk but fairly boring for everyone else.

review:
[h1]Berserk em gameplay de Musou[/h1]

Para quem gosta de Berserk e gosta de jogos de Musou, eu recomendo o jogo. O jogo faz uso de cenas da anima√ß√£o de mesmo nome e ap√≥s um certo momento da hist√≥ria √© na base do CG. A trilha sonora do jogo √© muito boa, o design do som com as miss√µes achei bom demais. Jogar apenas com a trilha sonora e sem mais nenhum efeito de som ou de voz foi uma experi√™ncia deveras agrad√°vel.

Obter todas as conquistas do jogo foi deveras satisfat√≥rio para mim, n√£o tive l√° tantos problemas para consegui-las.O repert√≥rio de combos que podem ser feitos com os personagens acabam n√£o sendo t√£o vastas, o que pode tornar a experi√™ncia um pouco entediante, mas uma vez que voc√™ aprende o padr√£o das sequ√™ncias, voc√™ pode ter uma liberdade maior para tentar fazer sequ√™ncias variadas. 

A variedade de personagens jog√°veis para poder refazer a hist√≥ria com outros personagens √© bem interessante e a pequena Schierke foi a que mais me surpreendeu em campo de batalha. 

Uma das grandes dores de cabe√ßa √© enfrentar o Femto na camada 100 do Endless Eclipse, com aquelas esferas transl√∫cidas pra l√° e pra c√°, foram os √∫nicos momentos que eu beirei o stress.

Entretanto consegui conquistar todas as conquistas e me tornar um True Berserker (heh) ent√£o todo o esfor√ßo e sufoco enfrentando tantas vezes o Femto valeram a pena no final.

E por fim: O jogo valeu cada hora jogada e cada centavo gasto, mas recomendo comprar em promo√ß√£o caso n√£o consiga arcar com o pre√ßo cheio =]

author: {'steamid': '76561198013055491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 2651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1167, 'last_played': 1663445482}
review:
Very good Samurai Warrior like game in the universe of Berserk, with a lot of attention to the lore and story it covers.

Sure there are simplifications and the gameplay part does not convey on a 1:1 scale what actually happen in the source material, but the character progression have a lot of fidelity, the gameplay is agreable (it's a MUSOU tho, just so you're warned).
Story can be completed in around 15/20 hours, based on your ability to ignore the dialogs. It took me 25 hours taking my time.
Aside the story there is a long and difficult Endless dungeon mode, for those who want to push their characters to the limits, which extend the lifetime of the game (didn't finished that one yet)

[b]Pro:[/b]
-Fun gameplay
-High fidelity in character abilities/progression
-Voice acting is actually done by the anime cast for most (Guts, Casca...)
-A good way to (re)discover the story from the start up to Millenium Falcon Arc (volume 30)
-Quality cutscenes (Golden age arc cutscene are actually the 3 anime movie recap)

[b]Con:[/b]
-Dialogue scenes animation can be a little janky, which contrast to the high quality video cutscenes.
-Some story element have been cut (but the game still cover an awful lot)
-The level design and the maps are bland, definitely the focus of the game is the action, not the scenery (might be intended.)
-Overall graphism quality is good but it struggle to run on older machines (see tips in the community guides)
-Difficulty is not balanced, easy/normal/hard are all super easy,, then Berserk difficulty is nearly impossible at start, so you basically have to finish the game hard(easy) before being able to try in Berserk mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054259951', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1688693766}
review:
If you're a big fan of the Berserk series, whether it be the manga, anime or the movies, and/or you want to live out your "Badass with big sword" fantasy, you need to play this game.

First of all i want to say i am a huge Berserk fan so i will have some bias here.

I've played the entirety of the Souls series as well as many Monster Hunter titles so i am very familiar with over the shoulder action adventure/fighting games, and ill also use those as references.

[b] Combat: 8.5 [/b]
If youve ever played a "Warriors" game (Hyrule Warriors, Dynasty Warriors) then the combat here wont be anything new. Its the exact same style combat as any Warrior game before it. You have a light and heavy attack that you can chain together in different ways to beautifully massacre enemies in a brutal fashion. However after a certain point the game stops adding mechanics and combos, so its starts to get a little repetitive, however remaining insanely fun and satisfying to unleash those combos and watch your combo and kill counter soar. Combat animations are also stunning.

You unlock more characters as you progress through the main scenario or "story" of the game, which you can then use to go back and replay everything using your preferred character. The game also offers an "Endless Eclipse" mode, which acts as a horde mode that progressively gets more and more difficult, completion of the Endless Eclipse with different characters will yield you different rewards that you can then use in game, like more characters and cosmetics! All these characters have different movesets and playstyles that change drastically from character to character.

You're also able to equip your characters with accessories that will increase various different stats and skills, even further changing/tuning the character to fit into the exact playstyle you want. You can focus your characters stats on only heavy attacks, or spamming fast lights, or being able to constantly be in Rage Form, or spamming secondary skills like the Repeater Crossbow, Cannon Arm and Throwing knives, stunning enemies more, launching them in the air more. The build possibilities are huge in number.


[b] Story: 9 [/b]
It's Berserk. 
"Minor" cuts happen (pun intended) including the Lost Children Arc and The Bakiraka fight. Both are not hugely important to the overall plot, however if youre a fan of the original work it is noticeable and a little disappointing for those who's favorite arc is the Lost Children (me). But its sill Berserk, amazing story line and lore. Fantastic characters and character design. Truly an iconic story, and one worth experiencing if you haven't yet.

The game uses scenes cut straight from the movie trilogy and parts of the 2016 anime as well as in game rendered cut scenes to drive the story/plot in between fight sequences, and are almost entirely voice acted, however it is in Japanese and is fully subtitled, the voice acting sounds phenomenal.


[b] Re-play ability: 7 [/b]
There's lots to do in this game, however once you do it, its kinda done. Yes theres always the Endless Eclipse mode and the ability to replay the story with new characters and cosmetics, but once you've done that once or twice, theres really not going to be much more for you to discover and no new mechanics to unlock sadly. 

That doesn't mean you wont be enjoying the combat enough just to run through Endless Eclipse every now and then just to crack some demon skulls with your massive sword, because you definitely will. Just know that when you do, there isnt really anything new from the first time you did it, except maybe what you decide to equip on your characters.


[b] Overall: 8 [/b]
Story is gripping, emotional and amazingly executed.
Combat is fluid, satisfying and flashy all while staying simple. Think low skill floor, high skill ceiling. Easy to get into, takes time to master.

I definitely recommend this game to anyone who is a Berserk fan, as well as anyone who enjoys dark fantasy settings with emotionally gripping story.

I also recommend this game to anyone who wants to feel like a big bad ass while carving through huge hordes of demons and mercenaries alike.

review:
not a bad game, i would say this is way better than warriors orochi 4. however

difficulty

while it can be hard at times, but the frenzy meter mode is cheap as the time stop move in warriors orochi 4. frenzy mode makes you have god mode for a short time but also build up your death blow aka musou attack. this makes the game easier rather than challenging.

characters

the only good one is guts berserker armor or as this game calls it beast of darkness. the other characters are a good choice but also suck, it is also lacking alots of characters that could of been playable or fight against. this game does not have a fight against mozgus disciples or rosine for example. you might see certain characters in the cutscenes, but other times they don't have the character models.

endless eclipse

this is what warriors orochi 4's Infinity Mode should of been like. endless eclipse is like the only good game mode in this

the price

same problem as warriors orochi 4, this game needs a sale if you want to get it

hit boxes

certain characters like zodd's Apostle has some awful hit detection

review: I was skeptical about this game when I'd first heard about it, figured minimal effort would be put in to capitalize off of a popular property with a serious need for a game, but I was wrong! While I did run into some mild issues here and there (one crash and some mild optimization issues), I definitely had lots of fun with this. Combat is a bit repetitive after a while, but considering this is by far the best attempt at adapting anything post-golden age arc, I'd recommend for any fan of Berserk.
