author: {'steamid': '76561198073887495', 'num_games_owned': 389, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1520536163}
review:
Okay first of all anyone that flat out hates this game because it's a port or loves it because it's Berserk is short sighted and needs to see the big picture, this isn't a good game but being a port has nothing to do with that. The biggest issue I have with this game is how they try  to cut so many corners that it completely ruins the experience, you literally cannot enjoy this game like you would a regular hack and slash because it's a Berserk game and it's so clear what it's missing. Here's a list of all the short cuts they took and how it affects the game.
-Use the movies to substitute for cutscenes, this wouldn't be so bad if they were at least consistent and didn't butcher what they lifted from the movie, they apparently got the rights to use the movies but couldn't let the full scenes play out so that it was a coherrent plot?
-Butchered the story, they not only remove things from the plot but also rearrange and oversimplify the story, almost all nuance is lost, they continuously try and hint at it which you will recognize if you are a fan of Berserk but it will remain unsatisfactory
-They flooded the levels with meaningless enemies which just don't work with the narrative causing continuity errors and fundemental issues. If you're going to flood the game with meaningless nobodies then make them die in one dramatic slash, don't make me sit there slashing multiple times to clear nobodies
-Enemies are incredibly minimal with an abundance of unnamed ones, basically you've got the scrubs, the base leaders, the commanders, and then the unique named enemies, the amount of scrub enemies could be cut by 90% and nothing of value would be lost
-The difficulty and combat are beyond broken and it's emberrassing, you can basically walk through the battlefield unempeded when it's filled with scrubs, that is unless you set it to Berserk difficulty in which the very first mission which has the lowest enate difficulty will become near impossible because scrubs literally litter the battlefield and will now lunge at you instead of just standing around and whenever they land a hit a significant amount of health is removed, this wouldn't be an issue, it is expected after all that a higher difficulty mode will deal more damage but they connect so easily and they're so many of them it's like if you went out into a field of grass and for every blade of grass you touched someone shot you with a 9mm, kinda makes it hard, doesn't it?
-Even on the lower difficulty playing against apostles, the one thing that should be the most fun, is near migrane inducing because anytime they hit you you'll be stunned but even your heavy attacks don't stun them, the game tells you to use support weapons but even then the throwing knives don't help, and the repeating crossbow does about as much damage as a real life paintball gun, the only weapon that's affective is the cannon and that takes a longer time to be ready again since they want to make it a scarce support weapon.
-The whole plot is at a breakneck speed compared to the manga or anime and it's not even adapted well for a video game, it just doesn't work, it's painful, nothing with emotional impact is impactful in the game, hardly anything even makes sense to a first time viewer and it's just atrocious.

I seriously don't get how they could cut so many corners and not realize that the game would've been so much better with fewer, more unique enemies, a better -maybe Dark Souls like- combat system, and a stronger more drawn out story, it would have been less work to just cut the movies up completely to act as the cutscenes instead of just switching between a butchered movie cut and the lifeless trash they use for the charecter model dialog. I don't understand how this game can be so bad considering I played the AoT: Wings of Freedom game that this company made and it wasn't flawless but it was actually good. This is just emberassing trash and I can only hope that it is easy to mod this game and someone with talent and passion is working on fixing this mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993576796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1511103389}
review: I like Berserk but this musou game is very bland and boring. Started to play it after completing Ringed City because I wanted more dark fantasy. Even on hard difficulty it's a joke and impossible to lose. There is also Berserk difficulty which is running away from mob simulator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067462972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1690106284}
review: As a fan of the Beserk series (both manga and first anime adaptation) i find the story flow of the game a dull version of recent golden age films and new 3d anime adaptation. As a video game i find the hack and slash mechanics in it fun and fitting for how guts is. Swinging a slab of iron through 10 enimes at once and seeing them fall is how it should feel and it delivers. I do not reccomend playing on keyboard as the game is a port but if you are able to play with a controller i highly reccomend picking up the game and playing it through. My best examples to compare are the God of War games and Dante's Inferno. Button masher, arena combat and all around good time. This is the best beserk branded game released yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257542282', 'num_games_owned': 1526, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 2325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1672393265}
review:
I have to say this game isn't very deep, but if you like Guts as a character and like relaxing slashers then this is for you. 
Pros: Most characters are satisfying to play; endless mode will keep you hooked forever; the game covers the story better than either the three movies, or the new tv show.
Cons: The game has some stuttering issues; even though it covers the story better than most, it still leaves notable gaps in the story; a lot of characters are left out; and no Playable Skull Knight is unforgivable.
But as I said, if you want to play as Guts and feel the weight of The Dragonslayer as you eviscerate monsters, then this is for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040312391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1621224867}
review: If you are a fan of Dynasty Warrior game mechanics and are looking for a game similar in style I think this is the best canidate. If you're looking for a hack and slash 2017 crazy 420 dope mega spins graphic that will burn the eyes from a million suns game, i do not think that this is for you. Love Berserk and this game 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022754383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2671, 'last_played': 1512014795}
review:
Some things to understand: 

- This game is based off of one of the most brutal manga series of all time. While the story arc the game follows can seem pretty freaky/disturbing at times, it does not hold a candle to the manga. Same goes for the Berserk anime and the Golden Age Arcs I, II, & III. If you are interested in the unabridged, and FAR MORE graphic/violent Berserk storyline, please read the manga.

- The story arc for this game DOES NOT catch up to the current place in the manga, but it does go a good bit beyond the anime's current place.


Okie Dokie... anyway... The game.

Berserk and the Band of the Hawk was developed by the same team that does all of the Dynasty Warriors games. It's very simmilar to the Dynasty warrior series in mechanics and layout. However, because this game is based off of a preexisting series, the levels are more mission oriented and focus less on large scale battles. This can be a weclomed change of pace from the usual DW games, but can also become repetitive as many of the maps (or portions of maps) and generic NPC skins are recycled. People unfamiliar with the series may still enjoy the game, but it likely won't become a favorite unless you enjoy the Beserk storyline.

-The artwork is great, but since art is subjective thats really up to personal preference really.          ?/10

-The audio is great if you don't mind subtitles. Same voice actors from the Anime.              10/10

-With the achievements and tons of unlockables, there is plenty of replayability here.              8/10
(The recycled maps and skins can make it feel a little repetitive though)

-Story is based one of the most intense, gritty, violent, and disturbing sagas ever created.        ‚àû/10


Overall; as a fan I 100% recommend this game to anyone considering buying it. The Berserk storyline is too good to pass up, especially if you're new to the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986625138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1604911269}
review:
Firstly, this is a skin for Dynasty Warriors hack and slash so please don't buy this game if you're expecting a new 2017 full action / RPG style gameplay, if you're looking for that with high performance and stunning graphics please purchase Dark Souls 3.

This game is a bit repetitive - yes, but it is a lot of fun and if you're a Berserk fan I would definitely purchase this. You get to kill a lot of enemies including demons & apostles, as well as epic battles with big bosses and there is a tonne of stuff to do from side quests, the main story and side games which are a load of fun. 

I wouldn't say the game is worth the ¬£49.99 price tag but I just bought it on 50% off sale and I would say it's worth the ¬£24.99 price.

Gameplay - 7/10
Graphics - 6/10
Story - 9/10

Overal - 7/10

Definitely recommend a controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032039961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1708, 'last_played': 1600910033}
review: First off, if you are a Berserk fan then this is a must own game!!! Its rare that we get Berserk games and half of them are not released in the States. I read the manga and watched the anime, if you want a tame version of the whole story this is your answer. Its much better than your basic Dynasty Warriors game but not nearly as frustrating as Hyrule Warriors. Collecting Behelits every mission adds replayability but the best part comes from the weight of feeling like Guts throwing around Dragonslayer or getting your ass kicked by Zodd. Gameplay is pretty repetitive I would say if you are a casual then wait until a Steam Sale because $60.00 is overpriced for as long as its been out and Dynasty Warriors games tend to be kind of niche.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090507075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1638591032}
review:
looks pretty damn good, which surprised me given the pc port of OP pirate warriors 3 that was released being nowhere near as good as the console version
the medieval europe aesthetic is a lot better than your typical chinese and japanese dynasty warriors imo
gore also helps

gameplay is a lot better than normal dw too, given the abilities/tools you're given and the transformations the apostles get
i got burnt out easy on dw but i can play this for a lot longer, something i could also say for pirate warriors 3 thanks to the devil fruit abilities (even with the graphics being downgraded and downright broken in areas) and dynasty warriors gundam
mounted combat is as boring as ever though

sound is fine, voice actors are clear and nice, music is *ok*, effects also *ok*

animation is standard but i'll gladly take it over berserk CLANG 2016-2017

i give this a 8.7/10
the price is iffy though

review: Esse √© o t√≠pico jogo feito para f√£s, tem um bocado de personagens jog√°veis, como o improv√°vel Wyald, conta a hist√≥ria do mang√° at√© a luta contra o Ganishka, sendo que a parte referente a era de ouro tem cenas do anime! Depois de passar por certas partes do modo hist√≥ria d√° pra jogar com a forma de ap√≥stolos do Zod e Wyald, d√° pra jogar com o Femto depois da torre do renascimento e com o Gatts possuido pela Berserk Armor depois de enfrentar o Grunbeld na casa da feiticeira Flora, por√©m √© por tempo limitado, pra jogar com esses caras "transformados" sem precisar encher barra de energia, tem que concluir o modo Endless Eclipse que demora bastante, e no caso do Femto, tem que concluir esse modo com todo mundo! A parte chata do jogo √© justamente ser repetitivo, por isso que eu disse que √© um jogo pra f√£, voc√™ entra nas fases, e faz sempre o mesmo, desce o sarrafo em todo mundo pela frente at√© o final da fase. A dificuldade n√£o √© das grandes, por√©m jogar no n√≠vel berserk do come√ßo pode ser complicado j√° que com n√≠vel baixo pode-se morrer com 2 golpes de qualquer soldadinho. O pre√ßo tamb√©m n√£o √© dos mais atrativos, portanto √© bom esperar alguma promo√ß√£o, a menos que seja um f√£ sem no√ß√£o como eu que comprou na pr√© venda e ainda fez 100% do jogo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198143036328', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1063, 'last_played': 1531868799}
review:
The english translators had one god damn job, and they couldn't even get THAT right!

I am a huge fan of the manga and series as a whole, so when I see what they have done to this series these past few years, it genuinely disappoints me, because this series deserves much better than a garbage CGI anime and a game that is poorly translated.

Yes, the game is fine and somewhat forgives the grammical errors that are constantly made in the dialogue and plot points, but not enough to forgive and forget. They could easily update and patch the game to fix these errors, but so far they haven't. Why is it that the people behind the media of Berserk have been exceedingly lazy? 

Are the translation issues THAT big of a deal? I suppose not, but as a huge fanboy of the series, it genuinely bothers me that they overlooked so many grammical errors in the english version of the game, when that was basically the only thing they had to do for the US/UK release of the game. I could be wrong, maybe more than just translations were put into the Englsih release, but even so. They had all the time in the world to iron out the errors. 

It's truly disappointing. These guys are better than that. Fix this, PLEASE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182525366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3805, 'last_played': 1632213816}
review:
Siendo yo un gran fan de Berserk, en el primer momento en el que vi el trailer del juego, me interes√≥ el t√≠tulo y pens√© en comprarlo tan pronto tuviera oportunidad. Pero el tema interesante es: ¬øEste juego en verdad vale la pena tanto para fans y no tan fans? Vamos por partes.

[b] Cosas buenas [/b]

- El juego te relata la historia de Guts comenzando directamente por el arco de La Edad de Oro y cubre la mayor√≠a de eventos hasta el fin del arco de El Halc√≥n Millenario.

- El juego se ve muy bien, pues tiene un excelente apartado gr√°fico.

- El gameplay es bastante sencillo y sus din√°micas son explicadas con brevedad en forma de notas que aparecer√°n al iniciar el juego o cuando alguna nueva mec√°nica se presente.

- Cada personaje jugable se siente √∫nico y es como si de verdad tuvieras en tu poder a los personajes del roster, y es genial que tener la habilidad de elegir con qu√© personaje jugar en el modo libre.

- En ciertas misiones podr√°s elegir si quieres jugar con Guts u otro personaje que ha participado en el evento a jugar dentro del modo historia.

- Hay una gran variedad de jefes, que en realidad son enemigos importantes dentro del manga, ya sean estos simples caballeros al servicio de una milicia enemiga, criaturas m√°gicas o incluso los infames ap√≥stoles.

- La existencia del modo Eclipse Infinito, que es algo as√≠ como un modo oleada con misiones sencillas que extiende la vida de este juego por bastante tiempo, ya que en este modo puedes desbloquear m√°s personajes jugables, trajes, monturas e incluso accesorios y habilidades que tus personajes pueden utilizar, hasta la oscura armadura Berserk o la forma oscura de Griffith: Femto.

[b] Cosas malas [/b]

- El juego no est√° bien optimizado para PC y es algo muy notorio debido a la ca√≠da de frames de la que muchos otros jugadores se quejan, y esto te puede ocurrir aunque cumplas con los requisitos recomendados del juego. La verdad es que yo no tengo una muy buena tostadora y de todos modos tengo que lidiar con bajadas de frames de infarto. Otra cosa que cabe mencionar es que el control de Xbox One tiene un glitch muy molesto que ocurre cuando intentas presionar el bot√≥n RT, ya que este bot√≥n no funciona para este control en espec√≠fico, as√≠ que debes precionar la tecla P cada que quieras transformarte, cosa que llega a sentirse muy inc√≥moda si lo que te gusta es jugar algo s√≥lamente con el control.

- Las misiones son muy cortas y se acaban tan r√°pido como empiezan, la verdad yo recomendar√≠a poner el juego en el modo dif√≠cil, por lo menos, o dificultad Berserker para los m√°s aventurados.

- Las cinem√°ticas son demasiado largas y a veces se meten en el gameplay, sac√°ndote un rato del momento para tener que explicarte algo de la historia, cosa que puede llegar a ser frustrante porque pasa muy a menudo. Incluso puedes llegar a pasar m√°s tiempo viendo una cinem√°tica que terminando una misi√≥n, ya que, como dije antes, son muy cortas las misiones de este juego.

- Las misiones son muy repetitivas, puesto que todas tratan de matar a cierto n√∫mero de enemigos (a veces con un tiempo l√≠mite), o escoltar personajes a alg√∫n punto del mapa.

- La m√∫sica es bastante repetitiva y gen√©rica, lo que me ha obligado a silenciarla cuando termin√© el modo historia para poner los soundtracks del anime del 97 y las pel√≠culas, los cuales son infinitamente superiores.

[b] Veredicto final [/b]

Dicho lo dicho, podemos ver que este juego tiene bastantes fallos e incluso dir√≠a que hasta dentro del g√©nero de musou, este t√≠tulo se queda muy corto. Pero eso no significa que no sea muy entretenido y es de los pocos juegos dentro del universo de Berserk.

Tambi√©n cabe mencionar que se omiten algunos eventos del manga y tambi√©n a algunos personajes, como el ni√±o de la luna llena o Sonia, pero la justificaci√≥n de esto es la misma de la ausencia de Puck en el anime del 97, no se les logra dar importancia debido a que ni el manga ha otorgado una respuesta clara de su sitio en la historia o que no se toman en cuenta porque no tienen un contacto directo con la aventura de Guts, siendo el primero el caso del ni√±o de la luna llena y el segundo el caso de Sonia. Tambi√©n se omiti√≥ el episodio de los ni√±os perdidos, pero es que debemos considerar lo que hay en ese episodio, porque si hubiera aparecido en el juego, se ganar√≠a la clasificaci√≥n Adults Only, y ya sabemos lo complicado que es publicar un juego con esa categor√≠a.

Pero al final de cuentas es un juego que recomiendo bastante para los fan√°ticos de Berserk y la gente que est√° curiosa sobre este manga. Tambi√©n lo recomiendo a la gente que est√© interesada en jugar alg√∫n t√≠tulo musou, aunque para estos √∫ltimos s√≥lo les puedo decir que hay muchos peces bajo el agua, y Berserk and the Band of the Hawk no es el pez m√°s grande en el oceano.

review: No me gusto, muy repetitivo, una de mis peores compras.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239861804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1620, 'last_played': 1540515652}
review:
10/10 game, I love berserk, better than the 2016-2017 anime (obviously). Overall really fun to play, easy to get the hang of, also a great stress reliever too.

- on a side note though for reccomended specs it specifies that you need a i7 to run it "properly" however i have an i5 so.... just a heads up for any potential buyers, also if you do have a i5 try and keep the graphic settings on medium, seemed to drop frames during "heavy combat scenarios"

-overall 10/10 though

author: {'steamid': '76561198039083541', 'num_games_owned': 1205, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1302, 'last_played': 1690330228}
review:
Simple hack and slash fun. 

I'd recommend reading the manga before playing this game. Then forgetting about it for a year. Later, when the next manga update eventually is about to be released, playing through this game to catch you up to speed with all the dope shit leading up to the boat.

Wish there was more time with the berserker armor, the mofo is fast and brutal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045058624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1511846902}
review:
Not the berserk game we deserve but it's the one we got.

7/10 however I'm biased becuase the source material is the best story that will never be finished. 

Compared to the not released in north america ps2 berserk game, this is trash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080781826', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1117, 'last_played': 1499008641}
review:
A meaty hack n slash game, interwoven with animated scenes from the movies.
The first half is pretty solid, however halfway through the game tedium does tend to set in, 
this isnt helped by the loss of animated scenes from that point as well.

It's lacking certain characters such as Skullknight and Silat, which I don't really understand why.
Hopefully if this one does well sales wise then a sequel will come out, which Koei-Tecmo does have a habit of doing.

An average Warriors game, but you do get to experience the story up to "The boat".

review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
For me Berserk is one of my favorite anime So I buy this game because I love this anime and now I will tell you a good and bad thing in this game.

[h1]Good[/h1]
- Great story

[h1]Bad[/h1]
- Bad Graphics
- Cheap Gameplay
- Content too short
- Lately cutscence is really bad 
- DLC Are you crazy!?!?

[b]So I still love this game because It's Berserk but I can't stand with Cutscences (anime cutscence is good)[/b]

review:
bad graphics, ugly textures  yet horrible fps on gt960m. 

and i think there should be a warning in game store page, saying "cannot be played without a controller." or "not suitable for mouse and keyboard". i know this kind of games are designed for controllers but there always should be an option for mouse and keyboard.

i had bought this one on summer sales and didnt try on time, now i cannot refund. worst purchase of my steam library. not worth a single byte of bandwith to DL even if it were free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031662764', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1505565128}
review: How anyone can release a game without mouse look in 2017 is beyond me. While I understand that this is the kind of game that is best played with a controller not even having mouse look just feel like the port was a rush job.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049793488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1605064840}
review:
As a big Berserk Fan (because of the manga and the 1997 anime of course), and someone who enjoyed playing Dynasty Warriors games (DW2 and DW4 mostly, also played DW Next) this game is just very bad, it doesn't even feel as good as other DW games in fights, fighting mechanics are pretty bad.

And the storytelling, well, they're using parts movies that came out some years ago as cutscenes (which I think aren't good at all, they only nailed one scene here or there), the story isn't really clear at all, it woudln't make much sense for someone new to Berserk, they'd probably think it's a bad story.

Sadness.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984390881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1505534315}
review:
This is a great game for ppl who are interested in Berserk Anime & Story, i have not finished the story mode yet but i think the game story starts from Berserk 1997 to 2016 anime, to get the full story it's best to watch the anime as some of the scene here were done in a way that we already knew what happens sometimes.

Game is poorly optimize i would say, need good graphic card to run it smooth. Im on AMD Phenom II X4 955, 12gb of ram & R9 380 2GB, the game runs smooth for me on all high detail (1920x1080) but i turn the environment details to low as i dont see much difference in detail for having it high, turning it low makes loading stages much faster on a regular HDD, have yet to try it on SSD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046951393', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1738, 'last_played': 1503681137}
review:
Somewhere at Tecmo Koei's headquarters, some dude wondered to himself: 

"What if Koei Tecmo were to make a Berserk themed warriors game?"

This magnificent stinker with 'Berserk' slapped on it is the answer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025220943', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1480, 'last_played': 1503533281}
review:
If you are a fan of Berserk and have not looked at it in a while, than this is a game for you. 

The game offers a really good recap of the first 4 arcs of the manga, with the exption that it does skip a lot of the minute details going on in the back of the story. This is more apparent towards the series.

In terms of a medium to enjoy Berserk, I would rate this somewhere in the middle of the anime series and the manga. However I do not recommend that this game be your first exposure to the game.

Game play is smooth and fun, with abilities drip fed through out the story, however due to the nature of the game, combat becomes very repetitve.

tl;dr Get this game only if you are a massive fan and don't mind a bit of reppetitve gameplay

author: {'steamid': '76561198052641164', 'num_games_owned': 6, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6182, 'last_played': 1503074400}
review: Ce jeux retranscrit assez bien l'histoire du manga dans l'ordre chronologique des evenements non pas comme il est raconte meme si il manque  trois apotres,deux juste avant lord of thieves(la femme au tout debut du manga et l'homme-chien qui provoquera la decouverte de la tueuse de dragon) et celui qui provoquera sa rencontre avec farnese et serpico(l'elfe pikarf).Il manque aussi les gardes du corps de mozgus et l'homme chevre des heretiques qui se font transformer par l'homme-oeuf et le soldat transforme par le compte. Je crois que ce sont les seuls bemols vraiments marquant du point de vu des ennemis a affronter ah si il y a aussi les bakiharas qui manque juste apres la liberation de griffith je crois.Ensuite ce n'est qu'un avis personnel mais la violence des combats n'est pas assez bien retranscrite, j'entend par la que les ennemis ne se font pas couper en deux par la dragon slayer et que les menbres des enemis ne volent pas(bon je sais que les corps disparaissent pour un soucis de fluidite graphique et ne pas ralentir l'action du jeux) meme si la sensation de puissance de guts et zod est assez bien retranscrite, le nombre d'ennemis ne les desavantage pas surtout guts.Dans l'ensemble c'est un bon jeux, les graphismes sont bien,les effets sonores aussi et les derniers niveaux du mode eclipse mettent un peu de chalenge par rapport au niveau de difficultes berserk du mode histoire. Plus de personnages jouables aurait ete bien aussi mais bon c'est centre sur guts. Dans le mode histoire quand on refait les batailles avec d'autres personnages des missions specifiques au perso(casca, griffith, judeau, serpico et shierke) jou√© aurait ete bien.Malgres tout ce que je viens de dire je le recommande mais a 50 euros add-ons compris.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050808806', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 3765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3279, 'last_played': 1604581859}
review: very nice slashy game, lacks content compared to the other warriors games that have been made but the game still is faithful to berserk

author: {'steamid': '76561198006544250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1501849409}
review:
Do you like Berserk? Do you like Dynasty Warriors? This is literally a mix of the 2 and its fun, real fun. There are parts that are lacking however, like long load and frequent load screens and long anime cinematics that cut out sections for no particular reason - but when the game starts - its 100% fun. It mixes up the Mosou system in Dynasty warriors by promoting its use rather than saving it against harder enemies but leveling it up each time you use it and the addition of gore and blood effects really make a difference.

I like Berserk. I like Dynasty Warriors. I like this game.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198005965931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 10055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7993, 'last_played': 1593460270}
review:
"DO NOT" expect the explicit sexual content from the show, you will NOT find that here, buuuut you will find buckets of Blood and Gore, while reliving the story-line for one of the best anime ever! The game also does a fantastic job of making each character fight and feel like their anime counterpart. It's very very well done.

The Game Itself : Dynasty Warriors style combat (Tons of Enemies on the screen at once, but your abilities are also meant to tackle X number of opponents). If you enjoy the anime, this is a great way of revisiting the story line, also the game goes well beyond the first season. Yes, it does get repetitive, and a lot of times you find yourself on auto-pilot, but that's not always a bad thing. Sometimes, you just want a game you can just sit back with and plow into. Lay waste to their armies. You against legions. 

Okay, that may not be everyone's idea of relaxation, but it certainly chills me out.... I wonder if that says something about me on a subconscious level? Anyway, he DW style combat is a perfect fit for Guts and his crew, considering their style of combat and does a good job of making you feel like a Berserking Beast!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033277548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3717, 'last_played': 1561829652}
review: Still have better animation than the anime. A good hack'n slash with a lovely roster of characters. It respects the manga quite well for a videogame and has a pretty decent lifetime with the Eclipse mode that increases it. It isn't the best game you'll ever play but it's a fine Berserk game we waited for. I'm happy with my purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034766576', 'num_games_owned': 1721, 'num_reviews': 725, 'playtime_forever': 6171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3141, 'last_played': 1621698330}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006880759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1487818456}
review:
If you like repetitve gameplay, mediocre Programming and unpolished  ugly Graphics this game is for you!
Im a big fan of the Berserk Mangas and have waited for a Game in which i could play as Guts smashing in Demon Heads,
the Warrior series seem'd like a good foundation for that.

But to me it was like a slap in the Face, a game made with absolutly minimal efford, which you can see from the very start looking at the but ugly menu. 
Character Models look close to the characters of the Series but Expression is simply put awkward and offputting. 

The Gameplay you know from the Series has been striped of all Fun, and it doesnt make much sense to play something outside of the Storyline. It makes no difference which gamemode you play, it's punching out the same combination over and over and over. 
I have bought this game on steam at first and quickly decided its a bad PC Port so i refunded it and bought it for the PS4 and played it to some extend on there. 

I really wanted this game to be good and really gave it a chance, im not one who neeeds top notch Graphics i can handle flaws or bugs as long as I see that there has been some efford and love put into the Game. 
This has been made as fast as possible and put on the market to grab the money of the Franchises Fans, i myself consider myself being a great Fan as before but i won't be blinded by the Cover when the game is nothing but Cheap and Lazily done.

review: Was fun at first but gets boring quick. Also its rated M for no reason. author: {'steamid': '76561198197105918', 'num_games_owned': 764, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1621743374}
review:
Just to set the record straight, this is Dynasty Warriors with a Berserk theme.

The animation is Berserk (2016), but that does very well in a video game setting, Overall, I loved this game and thought it was well worth the money spent on it, which I believe was around $45. I never liked the Dynasty Warrior games, but the Berserk theme and story actually allowed me to enjoy this game.

8.5/10 Hours of fun and replayability, the perfect game for Berserk fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011635974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2007, 'last_played': 1512163916}
review:
This is a poor Dynasty Warriors with a toned down Berserk skin.

No Guts, Gore or disturbing content.
No depth to any combat, hit x till you want to hit y sometimes enter rage
Terrible look and feel to everything but the main characters, and even they suffer from animation that makes Berserk 2016 look not good but advanced.
Horrible boss fights which will pin you in corners, no ability to escape and with parodies of phases and rage modes that are only marked by a pink mist.
Cutscenes that are just chunks of footage lifted straight from the various modern anime.
No lost children, pirates or sea gods
No enemy variety, all just reskins and bigger reskins with more HP
Overpriced mission pack DLC and horse armour

author: {'steamid': '76561198037907189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1509700519}
review:
I have an issue where the game runs 60fps on high settings with foilage set to low but 3o minutes into the game drops by 10 frames, then another 30 minutes pass....another drop. Eventually the game  ends up with an fps of 10. This issue also happens with other games made by KOEI TECMO. I wasted $60 on this game and i cant even play it and because I was changing settings trying to see if I could manually resolve my issue my 2 hours were up and now I am not eligible for a refund.

My specs:


Windows 10
Geforce GTX 970
Processor AMD FX 8320 Eight-Core 3.90 ghz
8 Gigabytes RAM DDR 3

Hopefully they will fix the isssue in the future.....not just for this game but for others too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037924998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3993, 'last_played': 1548227637}
review:
10/10, Pure violence.  

Even with that dynasty warriors Garbage camera, and a rushed story(maybe I am expecting too much here),  I would still recomend this. 

It feels very smooth to play, even with the bigger clunky characters.  Guts esp, has a very good kratos-ish feel where every attack has "the feel".  Performance on a i7-4790/16gb/1tb-ssd/980-ti,  was great even with like 200 dudes on screen.

Music and sound effects are amazing, plus it comes with pretty much a movie worth of the 2011 remake.

I never felt that I was being unfairly punished and I earned each loss. If you consider yourself good, consider playing of hard setting.

Late game you get to customize your playstyle with gear choices, but most times there are obvious supperior choices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064568395', 'num_games_owned': 9709, 'num_reviews': 968, 'playtime_forever': 1623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1623, 'last_played': 1498811058}
review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th][h1] My Playthrough [/h1][/th]
        [th][url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLTZKn1hLlcQMrZJ2CQpJNr00pCpMIFRk9] Youtube Playlist [/url][/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][h1]The Review[/h1][/td]
        [td]I really feel terrible for Berserk fans. The manga constantly go on hiatus, the newest anime is badly done, and one of the few games that they get of the franchise is not good. This game is not changing that anytime soon. The main problem with this game is that it doesn't capture the spirit of the franchise. The main points of Berserk is not the over the top action. The point is the following the continuing struggles of Guts and how he interacts with other characters. Berserk is a more somber series. So it's not a good thing that this game have little interaction between the characters and cut out major plot points. And what is really annoying for the begging half of the game they use scenes cut from the BERSERK: The Golden Age Arc movies. That is so lazy. But even if you ignore the series that the game is based on you will find that this game is a chore to get through. I guess I should have expected this with a Musou type game but this game seems more repetitive than a usual Musou. Each mission usually boiled down to kill the generals. Even though you can take over bases the game never expects you to do it. Even though their a multiple playable characters you will mostly chose berserk armor Guts as he is far more useful. This game just fails to be a good Berserk game. All fans of the series should avoid this game.[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198016634049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6063, 'last_played': 1531143161}
review:
After finishing the game at 100% I guess i've seen everything that the game as to offer, then I'll start by a point about Story, Graphics, Gameplay itself, then the endinggame and the grinding

Let's begin " Enjoy and Excite, you fools " as would say Wyald !

*The game is censored, you'll not be able to find some sequence as hard as you can see them in the anime or manga, i've felt a little disappointed but okay too... Westernisation, I guess..? "

Story follow the highlight of the anime, original manga, you find every importantcharacter, but not necessarily in the " correct order " of the manga. Even having some background, if you are a total new interested person in the story there is some characters that do not offer quite interesting moment ( Count, Lord of Thieves, Grunbeld.. ) I recommend to read it for everyone who wants to get further of Berserk's story

Graphics are quite okay, I can run it perfectly with a Titan X, sometimes drop of FPS especially during the Pishka invasion, destroying the flaming stands. What I found quite interesting is that it's taking the cinematics of the three movies for the 3 first Arc then it's totally animated by the studio... Sometimes the facial expression of the character is a bit to exagarated or last too long, making it ridiculous but at this point it's just detail ( guts especially ! )

Gameplay, I've found a quite decent form of gameplay through all characters, but there is some of them who are just painful to play especially during eclipse such as Casca, but some others as the apostles or Guts are very funny and amusing to play with. Depeding if you are quite accurate with tehe choice of the stats you put on item, you character can change totally from gameplay, from a real Berserk ( letting the health dwon below a point and just ruining the game with special ) or making a strong character with a lot of defense.. as you wish; Lot of guides recommend some special stats to start the grind...

Concerning the grinding and late game, it is doable if you have some moitivation, I recommend to take frenzy stats, which make it more easy, and more about timing gameplay, also as postionniong ( Casca's super as example... ). The grinding take some times, but guides are here to help you with that, but still do not getting angry if the game crahs at layer 96-100 and you have to done it twice... Just keep calm and get back later to it..

I guess that's all... The music are quite okay, but you'll soon forget about them when you'll have to do the eclipse, just use a good medieval, gregoroa, chorus playlist, it'll fit quite good too..

Enjoy and Excite, you fools !

author: {'steamid': '76561198047680468', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1500641319}
review:
Hack and slay is great and like usual, I knew what to expect and I like it!

I recommend it to Berserk fans even though it is a bit chunky (have to play in wondowed mode to have sound f.e.) but nothing too nerve wrecking.
But I can't recommend due to the scensoring of the cutscenes (not really imprtant but censoring nonetheless)

author: {'steamid': '76561198183507825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1627, 'last_played': 1573292427}
review: I loved this game I only wish the story was longer, don't get me wrong the story a decent length but for a hardcore gamer such as myself I feel there needed to be more. However I always crossing my fingers there will be another game or some kind of story DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267420770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1297, 'last_played': 1514514600}
review:
*Note: If you have litttle to no interest in the Berserk series (which I doubt is the case. Why are you here then?), then I cannot reccomend this game. 

If you do have interest in the Berserk series, but not have not had any prior exposure to the manga, then do not pick up this game yet. I don't think it will be the best first impression of the series, since this is quite a generic dynasty warriors game. I suggest starting with the 90s anime first, and if you like that, move on to the manga and prepare for the illustrations to fuck your eyes in the most nastiest and gorgeous ways until they cum. If you must see more Berserk in animated form, then watch the movies. But Please, please stay away from the abomination that is the 2016 and 2017 anime adaptation, it really isn't worth your time. 

(Actual Review)After all that, if you feel like playing some Berserk, then get this game. There's also the PS2 game that's considered the best Berserk game, but this is arguably easier to get your hands on. This game was mostly a guilty pleasure for me, since this is a dynasty warriors game and all, but foretunately, I have only ever played one Dynasty Warriors game before this, so I am not as tired of the Warriors formula as others. Still, the game gets repetitive as hell, but it's god damn satisfying to slash things up as Guts. The game has other characters you can play as, but they are very rarely playable in the story mode, and I doubt that the free mode and the endless eclipse mode are going to keep your attention after the ending credits roll, so their inclusion sort of feels pointless in some ways. I tried some of the other characters, but in all honesty, I do not find them as fun to play as Guts. 

Still, this game is a better adaptation of its source material than the 2016/17 series. In fact, the in-game cutscenes (not the ones from the movies, and not the talking events, since those look cheap as fuck) are better directed and animated than the recent anime series. I really wish I was joking, but I am not. This game is mostly a guilty pleasure, but it does give me enough content to satisfy me as a Berserk fan. So if you're a Berserk fan and have been interested in this game, go for it. Otherwise, it may be best to steer clear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048304379', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1337, 'last_played': 1602220837}
review:
Game is amazing for Berserk fans that love Musou games.

There are some faults, such as the most cutscenes are just characters standing and talking, and most of cutscenes in Golden Age arc were taken from movies, but also shortened and censored (Like the FAMOUS scene at the end of 3rd Movie)
And it lacks 2 only good things that were in poopy 2016 TV adaptation - Music and CLANG.
I don't care how stupid it sounds, i get eargasm when i hear CLANG.

But overall, it's a nice game for Musou gamers.
Let's buy it and hope that in Berserk Musou 2 or Shin Berserk Musou they will do even better, as they did with Fist of the North Star: Ken's Rage 2 ^_^

PS. Oh right... where is Fist of the North Star: Ken's Rage 2?

author: {'steamid': '76561197993360824', 'num_games_owned': 3453, 'num_reviews': 371, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1396, 'last_played': 1499744861}
review:
Decent musou characters with Guts being a joy to play. Works great as an inroduction to the Berserk series as the story includes everything from the beginning to when he gets on the boat. 

Game ran a little choppy on max settings, but looked pretty great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327599341', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1606015176}
review: ‰∏ç‰∏∫Âà´ÁöÑÂè™‰∏∫ÊÉÖÊÄÄÔºåÊàë‰∏∫ÂâëÈ£éÁª≠‰∏ÄÁßí

author: {'steamid': '76561198271740185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1578174052}
review:
I sincerely don't understand these reviewers, it seems that many are far too jaded and give this great game a bad wrap. No you can't do Guts' taxes, dress him up in my little ponie armor, take him on a spaceship to mine asteroids, or plant stuff in his garden. That's not the point:

Big sword => a lot of skulls to crack... 

It can't be simpler, that's what we call a beat 'em up. In this sort of game, your character goes out on a quest beating up everyone they can find on their path. That is what this game does, and it does so awesomely. The graphics are top notch, the music keeps the pacing and the voice acting and effects are AAA all the way. 

Of course if you want to play an RPG, this isn't going to cut it. And also this game is about Guts; yes, you can choose other characters but they really don't matter, and are there for flavor only; your main is Guts and that's that. 

I love this game, I think they made a great work and I think that if you like beat em up games and would love to have glimpses of Berserks story while destroying everything in sight, you'll have a great time like I am. Don't expect top notch AI, multiplayer stuff, or pointless house building... If you feel like thinking, play something else, if you feel like beating everyone up to a pulp, this is great. 

I highly recommend this as a casual release valve for any work aggro 

Again NOT AN RPG, NOT A WORLD BUILDER, AI DOESN"T KNOW HOW TO SOLVE A COMPLEX PARTIAL DIFFERENTIAL EQUATION ON THE SPOT  .. take that into consideration, and you'll have a blast like I am 

PS I love RPGs, they are probably my favorite genre, but what a boring thing to have all games be the same darn thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306306126', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 5059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5059, 'last_played': 1499721496}
review:
I'll start by saying I'd give this game a 6/10. 

That is just above average, so I'd still recommend playing it, but compared to other Koei-Tecmo games the gameplay is kinda lacking. Not many characters, and at least one character slot is wasted on Wyald, who doesn't deserve a character slot in any game.  The localised equivalent of the musou attack now has two layers to it for added nuisance factor, and necessitating more fiddly nonsense in order to get that lovely AoE attack of doom. Oh yeah, and expect to redo the Endless Eclipse all the way to the 100th level with EVERY character if you want those cheevos.

Still... we don't get enough good Berserk games, and it does that reasonably well, even if it does skip the entire Lost Children of Misty Valley arc  (apparently the latest anime / CG adaptation skips it too though).  Apparently even if the children are mutated into little bug-fairy things, a lot of folks still don't approve of them being burnt, splatted, sliced apart and.... well, they kill and r4pe each other too, which is kinda funny. But no, we don't get those in the game. Instead we get playable Wyald, who has been made goofy. Remember him? The guy who was chasing down the Band of the Hawk with dismembered bodyparts of people who had helped them on spikes to provoke a reaction?  Serial r4pist, murderer, torturer, kills his own men... THAT Wyald. Has a very brief appearance in the manga just before the eclipse and is killed off by Zodd. Dude is nasty. So nasty even other demons hate him. This game treats him like a comedy character... but it still skips out the entire Lost Children of Misty Valley arc. Typical. 
READ THE MANGA, FOLKS.

But anyway... yeah.  This game kinda disappointed me... but then it is still entertaining for a while. Good filler between other, better musou games maybe. Definitely better than wasting your time on all the Visual Novels Steam spams on a regular basis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128125812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1546831516}
review:
I'd been looking at this game for quite a while before finally my wife decided to buy it for me for our anniversary. I'm a huge fan of berserk and have also been playing Dynasty Warriors since their original release years and years ago, so I knew exactly what I was getting into, but for some reason just couldn't get hyped for it -- probably something to do with how many re-skinned Dynasty Warriors games I've seen and played.

Finally, I sat down one night, hooked up my controller and got rolling. I was surprised to see that the game looks pretty good all around for a DW-esque game, not to mention that they actually use a lot of clips from the Berserk animated movies. The character models and maps don't always stay true to the anime/movies (as one would expect) but there are still a LOT of variations in costume -- particularly for Guts -- and as far as I'm concerned, they did a good job of immersing you in the scene...although you do loose sight of how cool the "hundred-man slayer" title is after you've just chopped a thousand dudes in half.

What really impressed me was their inclusion of severeal chunks of story from the manga that neither the anime nor the movies chose to include; Wyald and the Count. I was originally expecting some pretty cut-and-paste Dynasty Warriors gameplay in a Berserk skin slapped in between movie-ripped cutscenes, but the storytelling outside of (and even past) the animated movie portions is surprisingly great.

Overall, the gameplay is exactly what you'd expect from a DW game. Nothing more, nothing less. The story aspect, however, should be enough to please the hell out of any Berserk fan -- or even anyone looking to get into the series. Also, if you plan to sit down and play this game (the story mode, anyways), be prepared to invest a good chunk of time, as the cutscenes can get lengthy. You're going to spend as much time watching a recap of the Golden Age arc as you are cutting up badguys like a lawnmower.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068429472', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 1002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1551300707}
review:
Positives:

+Schierke
+decent port
+uses good movie scenes
+great voice acting
+better than the new anime. (not a huge achievement there)
+has its own cutscenes 
+also has in game model cutscenes of decent quality. 
+playing as schierke was surprisingly really fun
+playing as guts feels good
+covers a lot of manga
+game looks good (outside of a few lackluster textures)
+unique skins with "somewhat different move sets" (not speaking of dlc.)
+multiple game modes with replay value
+I was impressed with how well some things were adpated and translated to their gameplay formula.

Negatives
-some subtitle spelling and grammar issues. I can remember more than a couple of errors
-very repetitive. not enough combos and moves in general. I'd like to see the combat more thoroughly fleshed out to make it take more skill
-boss fights can range from tedious to outright frustrating. It can be a fight in itself to get over how boring they can end up. the eclipse fight with femto was expecially bad. slowing mechanics are not fun or interesting game design. I understand what they were going for but it falls flat. It's hard to design a fight based around something the protagonist in the source material had no chance of beating (at least at the time)
-dlc skins. didn't bother myself
-I've crashed 2 times in 8 hours. I guess that is okay. I had to repeat 2 missions though.

I love Berserk. It's a shame that the new anime is going to turn off a lot of people. I did enjoy the movies, but the new show has been quite amatuerish with many faults. Fortunately this game doesn't seem to suffer from the same issues.

This game is acceptable fan service I guess. I wish we could get some highly motivated people with the proper talent to make something better with the IP.

It's not bad. get it on sale especially if you're a fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969380357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1500220933}
review:
If you enjoy watching the anime, then this game is for you. So many anime cutscenes that probably last as long as 2 full movies. The quality of the animation is great too, you can tell that a lot of time has been spent on the cut scenes for this game.

The game play is very repetitive on "easy", I would recommend ramping up the difficulty and enjoy the challenges a bit more. Wish they had a bit more depth to the difficulty of the gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014091908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1499112135}
review:
I like Berserk. A lot.
I like Dynasty Warriors. A lot.

I did not like this game.

Everything is fine, not great, but fine right up until you get to the part of the game where you start fighting apostles. Then the combat system completely falls apart. My experience basically devolved into:
-Try to dodge an attack.
-It can't be dodged.
-Try to block the same attack.
-It can only be blocked once, then you enter guard break and get combo'd.
-Now I'm in a corner and can't see anything but the inside of the apostles chest.
-Still getting combo'd
-Health is in the red, so guage is charging
-Go berserk, no damage for 10 seconds yay!
-Still in the corner getting combo'd
-dead

If they had somehow managed to make the apostle fights anything other than tedious and frustrating I would have viewed this as a good game. With them the way they are, I uninstalled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128292070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1504845024}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967295501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 973, 'last_played': 1499038253}
review:
Do you like Dynasty Warriors?  Do you like Berserk?  You'll like this.

I've only read some of the manga but this game really nails the "Get covered in blood and destroy demons" vibe.  Full animated cutscenes (at least in the beginning/middle), a combo system that feels way better than any DW game, pretty good gore, and it was on sale.  This is a genuinely fun game but it would have been amazing if they went more Dark Souls as it would seem Berserk would fit a bit better in that combat style.

Oh well, Apostle Zodd is amazingly fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016607923', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1707852756}
review: It's a weightless button masher like all Musou games, except in this one there's barely any side modes and no multiplayer. No multiplayer? Why?! Even if you like Berserk, I suggest not bothering with this game - go check out the movies if you haven't already (they are on Steam), since this game uses clips from the movies as cinematics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977378705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1543548195}
review: if you are a fan of berserk, then dont buy this game. if you can even call this a game. the enemies just stand around and dont do anything. i really dont know why we even have a health bar in this "game". the loading times are super long. there are even loading screens while navigating through the menu. its ridiculous. the japanese gaming industry is 10 years behind the western gaming industry, and this game is the perfect reminder. the graphics almost look like this game was developed for the ps2. if you really want to buy this game, then wait until it costs 10$ or less. but i would recommend playing the dreamcast and ps2 versions instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033376718', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1507669827}
review:
A la base j'avais pr√©vu une vraie critique, mais y'a une limite de taille et senscritique marche pas, donc nique steam, je vais droit √† l'essentiel.

[b]8 PERSOS DANS UN JEU MUSO????[/b]

MAIS LE FOUTAGE DE GUEULE

T'as que 8 persos dans ce jeu (et ils se manient tous pareil √©videmment) : Guts (sans dec), Casca (pas de surprise), Griffith (Femto en costume, donc √ßa va ils ont pas gratt√© un slot en en faisant deux persos √† part), Judeau (y'a plus important, mais ok), zodd (cool), shierke (√ßa respecte pas le manga, mais c'est cool quand m√™me), serpico (cool) et Roulement de tambourin...............................................



[spoiler]Wyald (qui que quoi?) [/spoiler]










WYALD PUTAIN

Le perso tellement charismatique et important que j'ai du relire trois fois le manga pour me rappeler de son existence.

Nan mais vous vous rendez compte que y'as un gars dans l'√©quipe de dev, qui a lu le manga et qui s'est dit "Nan les gars, mettez pas isidro, farnese, pippin, mozgus, le chevalier squelette ou silat, mettez plutot wyald, c'est un perso que les gens adorent"

Alors d√©j√† que seulement 8 persos dans un muso, c'est un record de pauvret√© (je m'attendais certes pas √† retrouver un cast de 80 persos comme les derniers dynasty warriors, mais y'a quand m√™me de quoi faire une vingtaine de perso √† partir du manga.) Mais en plus parmis le peu de perso qu'il y a vous avez foutu un ennemi random sans personnalit√© qui dure deux tomes.

Et en plus le pire, c'est que tous les persos que j'ai cit√©, sont dans le jeu, mais pas jouable.

Donc allez bien vous faire.

Jeu √† acheter que si on est en manque de muso, et encore, √† moins de 10 euros (sinon tu te fais entuber s√©v√®re).

author: {'steamid': '76561198062281852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1646, 'last_played': 1499568295}
review:
[h1][b]Se voc√™ √© f√£ da s√©rie Warriors e quer alguma coisa diferente, esta pode ser uma op√ß√£o v√°lida. Agora, se voc√™ √© f√£ de Berserk e quer uma experi√™ncia bacana sobre o mang√°/anime, melhor pensar umas duas vezes...[/b][/h1]

BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk cobre a saga de Guts desde sua entrada para o Bando do Falc√£o at√© a sua sa√≠da do continente em dire√ß√£o a ilha dos elfos, na tentativa de curar a loucura de Caska. Ent√£o espere uma quantidade razo√°vel de fases e consequente horas de jogo.
Entretanto, √© importante informar que ao longo do game temos diversas mudan√ßas de enredo e adapta√ß√µes, normalmente para evitar momentos de viol√™ncia extrema e/ou conte√∫do sexual expl√≠cito. E, a n√≠vel de informa√ß√£o, as anima√ß√µes em forma de anime s√≥ ocorrem at√© o final do arco de Midland. Depois disso √© s√≥ anima√ß√£o usando o motor do game, ent√£o n√£o espere ver todo o game como um anime.

Ao contr√°rio de outros games da s√©rie Warriors, BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk possui uma lista bem curta de personagens, com uma ou outra escolha duvidosa. Temos Guts, Griffith, Caska, Judeau, Zodd, Serpico, Shierke e Wyald. Cada um possui um estilo de jogo diferente, como manda a tradi√ß√£o da franquia. Guts, Griffith, Zodd e Wyald ainda contam com variantes, como Zodd se transformando na sua forma dem√¥nio ou Griffith com a skin de Femto, que muda totalmente a jogabilidade do personagem.
Surpreendentemente, o game n√£o possui um sistema de customiza√ß√£o de armas, mantendo o mesmo armamento para o personagem durante todo o game. √â claro, n√£o se pode esperar Guts sem sua espada massiva, mas a limita√ß√£o de customiza√ß√£o em BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk √© decepcionante, se limitando a apenas tr√™s slots de itens que podem dar melhorar o status do personagem ou garantir habilidades passivas.

Os controles s√£o um pouco diferentes de outros games da s√©rie Warriors, mas a premissa b√°sica de combos com ataques fortes e ataques r√°pidos continua a mesma. A principal diferen√ßa fica em volta do uso de itens durante as fases, como recuperadores de vida, aumento de ataque ou defesa e similares.
As fases s√£o visivelmente menores se comparadas a outras fases da franquia Warriors, ent√£o espere ter que correr menos pelo mapa atr√°s dos objetivos, com exce√ß√µes de uma ou outra fase.

Os gr√°ficos n√£o s√£o excepcionais, mas cumprem o seu papel. Os personagens s√£o fi√©is ao material de origem, e mesmo os inimigos, que tradicionalmente neste tipo de game s√£o todos iguais, apenas variando nas cores, possuem uma certa variedade. Entretanto, o game n√£o apresenta uma boa variedade de configura√ß√µes gr√°ficas. Em fases muito escuras, por exemplo, a n√£o possibilidade de alterar o brilho e contraste do game tornam as coisas dif√≠ceis.
A dublagem japonesa √© bem vinda, j√° que normalmente a adapta√ß√£o para outros idiomas sempre se torna um alvo de cr√≠tica. A trilha sonora, entretanto, deixa a desejar, sem contar com os principais temas oriundos do anime.

Ap√≥s completar o modo campanha √© poss√≠vel se aventurar no modo Eclipse, onde voc√™ pode ir infinitamente atrav√©s de miss√µes, at√© onde suas habilidades permitirem. √â uma √≥tima maneira de conseguir novos itens e dinheiro, al√©m de garantir mais horas de jogo. Mas ap√≥s algumas horas, a repeti√ß√£o de objetivos e a falta de variedade podem tornar a experi√™ncia entediante.

[b]BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk √© uma adi√ß√£o mediana na s√©rie Warriors, trazendo problemas j√° presentes em outros games do g√™nero. Apesar de se basear numa s√©rie rica em personagens e ambienta√ß√µes, a falta de personagens jog√°veis e miss√µes pouco inspiradoras passam a sensa√ß√£o de um game feito pela metade, uma sombra do que ele poderia ser.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198074826496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1498533105}
review:
Pick it up only if it's below $30. It's fun, but it's not worth over $35, sadly.

I had to think a little bit about this because I really like Berserk, and I really like hack and slash games, so I thought this would be great for $36. Luckily, it is a fun game, but I'll probably refund it and pick it up some other time when it's cheaper than it is on sale now.

If you enjoy Berserk and Dynasty Warriors, you may like the game. Just don't spend too much money on it.

They also spared us from the "CLANG" sound.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007564372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1841, 'last_played': 1502687727}
review: Great game for long boat rides

author: {'steamid': '76561198119523823', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1498463641}
review:
DISCLAMIER: If you plan on buying this game make sure you own a controller of some sort; mouse and keyboard will not work! 

I have to say that after playing through the entire story that I am very pleased with the game and it was even longer than I expected. There were a few parts of the game that I thought didnt work well such as the horse mechanics but overall the game was solid and a fun experience for the whole 11 to 12 hours of the main story mode. I feel that fans of the series will enjoy this game more than someone who has never read the comics or seen the show due to teh fact that they may get a bit confused due to the fact that the game doesn't tell the story exactly the way the comics and show does. My biggest complaint is the fact that I felt this game was too easy even on one of the harder modes; I only died once in my whole playthough on the seconed hardest difficulty but other than I enjoyed this game as a fan of the series and will eventually go back to 100% it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014254879', 'num_games_owned': 1309, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 1378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1235, 'last_played': 1499198390}
review:
So, lets start with bad stuff:
1.Unstable - expect a lot of crashes, especially if you need to frequently alt-tab for some reason.
2.Bosses in apostle forms tend to have weird hit detection problems - even though you are right next to them swinging your slab of raw iron at them, their HP doesn't seem to decrease. Probably due to them having such bizzare design that their hitboxes get all kinds of issues
3.If you aren't familiar with berserk, you get spoiled during the tutorial.
4.If you are familiar but have a stick up your ass, you will surely find something to complain about :v
5.Loading times are annoyinh
Debatable 6: Price can feel steep.
Now the good stuff:
Uhhh.... everything fucking else?
I mean... you get to play as Guts, you get to FEEL what it would be like to BE Guts(the 100 man-killing aspect of him, not the PTSD), you can play as the rest of his new and old party... and Zodd since he's badass. You even get to kick Griffith's ass multiple times which will surely bring satisfaction to anyone who knows how the eclipse went. What's not to like?

author: {'steamid': '76561197984170060', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 1461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1461, 'last_played': 1498394686}
review:
Capped at [b]60fps[/b], but I noticed GPU usage was worryingly low, even at the highest graphics settings possible.  

Atrocious [b]HUD[/b] - it seems to be made for 1920x1080 resolutions but when you go up to 2560x1440 or 4K, the HUD scales and takes up too much space.  There aren't any options to change this. This isn't something specific to this game, it's quite common among ports.  Sad. 

Good [b]story/lore[/b] - it follows the manga/anime pretty well.  It does feel a bit padded out at times but all the characters are there, even the ones that anime missed.  

[b]Skills system[/b]! - I really really liked the accessories-skills system.  You gradually get familiar with the accessories and stats, you're then taught the enhancement system, then the amalgamation and finally the skill transfer.  I thought it was a great way of progressing.  The buy/sell is simple and straightforward. 


The [b]animation[/b] - the story covers the 1997 series  and the 2016 continuation, so you get a mix of 2D, 3D and what appear to be remastered scenes from the original anime.  Based on the reviews I thought the game would look fantastic,  but IMO the current anime looks better.  The game's animation itself is... alright.  Some of the facial expressions look a bit hilarious especially when someone is angry and they simply bare their teeth and hold it there for an eternity.

The [b]gameplay[/b] - it's supposedly a hack-and-slash, sort of, but not really.  A lot of the enemies just tend to stand around waiting for you to hit them.  Some scenarios tend to be there for no reason and it can get quite repetitive at times.  If you're looking at this for a hack-and-slash, I suggest going somewhere else.  You can also play as some of the other characters (Casca and Zodd are pretty good) but it's mostly as free mode.  I tried it for a bit but decided I'll stick with Guts to progress the story. 

[b]Recommended tl;dr[/b] - if you're already a Berserk fan AND it's on sale, you will enjoy going through the story once more.

review: It's just a Dynasty Warriors game with Berserk characters, but as a huge fan of Berserk there is just something perfect about putting Guts in position to slaughter thousands of fools. Even Lu Bu can't fuck with Guts. It follows most of the arcs and even has boss battles. It's not perfect but I have really enjoyed reliving Berserk through this game. No english language option which is fine it just becomes hard to read the subs while your bustin out combos on hordes of monsters. O and rape horse is still super disturbing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020305189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1638, 'last_played': 1498253715}
review:
huge fan of the series .lots of fun , very good progression with items, unlocks and upgrades , challeging at later stages. always handing you something new to play with as you level up , big roster , not a fan of hack and slash normally but it fits the style of berserk and this one kept me going the whole way through, read a lot of comments in other places moaning about it not being more like dark souls , and i have to say as a fan of both it absolutely fits in more as hack and slash , i can't imagine guts slowly walking through linear areas fighting enemies a  few at a time and being two hit, truly a horrific idea.

8/10 
fantastic game

author: {'steamid': '76561198077797026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1518, 'last_played': 1488478801}
review:
honestly this is almost like a fan game and feels like one but its super fun, i highly recomend this for people who like berserk and kinda and kinda dont recomend this for people who have not read the berserk manga or original 1997 anime but as a game itself its still fun and overall its worth the price tag even without the background lore but knowing the lore only enhances the experience.

the only reall negatives i see with it is that it gets really repetivie with the monsters and the combos are a little easy to pull off unlike a fighting game as its mostly one or two buttons and the missions get so reptitive that you grunt when you do a mission you have done a millon times before.

a fan side note i dont like the lack of... (cough) adult content... in the berserk game but thats only a negative if your a fan of the series.

the positives far out number the negatives as its a long game not 4 hours it took me a little over 10 hours to beat on the easy mode and its much harder and longer on higher difficultys (thou its mostly just repetivie but fun to overpower the bad guy missions) but the fun part comes when you get to the endless eclips game mode where you can fight waves of monsters with a optional objective to get better items where if you beat a certain number of waves it literaly rewards you with amazing things such as infinite berserk armor and more. as i said the missions are repetive but the reward is great and the story is done well. you can also play as most of the main charachters in the story and get alt costumes that make you look cool or just to laugh at.

this game for me gets a 7/10 good game

author: {'steamid': '76561198077726464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1498058731}
review:
great game if you enjoyed the original series/manga (not the 2016/17 atrocities) and typical musou style games of hack and slash

if not it'd be better if you tried one of the two first to see if you enjoy it.

Personally, I love both, so this game is a definitely a buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019853496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1558755436}
review:
Standard Musou game with a Berserk paintjob. Graphics are better than the 2016/2017 anime by far (which is ****ing sad). Gameplay is not much different than Dynasty Warriors, which is okay if you like hacking away at legions of faceless bad guys and the occassional boss.
I'd recommend this game if you're a Berserk or Musou fan. Otherwise, you're better off picking up this game when it is cheaper and on sale if you want to feel like its money well spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964156880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1488413771}
review: Think of this as an interactive story. Kind of like the tell tale games, but a little more interactive. As someone who is a fan of the button masher kind of games like this I prepared for a degree of repedativeness. This I could not tollerate though. If you are just interested in experiencing the Berserk story then this is a great wat to experience it. Is it worth the price point, absolutely not. On 50 -75% off, sure. The lack of depth in the game play is what killed it for me. Everything you see happening in the game play videos; you do that, you do that the entire game, over and over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012657386', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4829, 'last_played': 1497773240}
review:
This is a game for Berserk fans, if you're after a more filled out hack and slash game there are better options out there. I enjoyed myself playing this title but I'm an old Berserk fan. Like similar games in the genre it can get boring once you beat the story and try out the other modes just slashing apart humans & monsters repeatedly, the different play styles of characters and the various objectives do make it more interesting, and it is a great title like others in the genre to play while watching or listening to something on the side.

Pros: Currently has the most accurate respresentation of the manga in animated form, shows many characters not yet seen or fleshed out in the anime/movies and the story is mostly well done. Combat is smooth and objectives don't have you running around aimlessly. Movesets across playable characters are accurate in my opinion but can be frustrating to play as certain characters sometimes (but they can't all be beasts in battle lIke Guts & Zodd).

Cons: Objectives can be odd sometimes, base commanders on levels where it doesn't seem necessary to have them for example. Bosses can be annoying to fight due to their cheap moves and large size, they can trap you in a corner or block the camera, spam attacks you can't escape from causing your death. 

Few characters playable, I would have liked to play as other characters from the series and I was confused why some characters were even made playable in the first place. Also key story moments were altered due to censorship issues that non fans of the series will be greatly confused by, again censorship also had key story moments entirely omitted from this release due to how graphic they are (while I do understand it would be nice to have had them in as some kind of option or dlc). 

Summary: Truthfully this game may not be as interesting to people who are fans of other hack and slash games but aren't fans of the Berserk manga & even fans may get annoyed at the censorship, story omissions or lack of their favourite characters being playable. I do think the harsh reviews for the game aren't needed, it still holds it's own and it is great fun hacking away hordes of monsters with the dragonslayer. I do feel the game could have done with more content and not covering so many arcs in one game title as at times it did feel rushed as you go through the story. All in all I do recommend people to watch gameplay or give the game a try but not to buy the game at full price unless you are like me and are a sucker for the fact it is part of the Berserk universe.

review:
!!Warning!!

This game has NO Mouse control and very horrible keyboard controls.
If you wanna play with a mouse you will have to use AHK, but the camera controls will be poor.

review:
Je suis fan des Dynasty Warriors mais pas vraiment de Berserk (je l'ai lu quand j'√©tais gamin mais √ßa remonte). En terme de jeu, BatBotH est ultra r√©p√©titif, plus qu'un Musou car il y a tr√®s peu de personnages et de toutes fa√ßons vous allez jouer Guts 95% du temps (parce c'est oblig√©) et peu de custo de perso. Pareil, vu que les missions ne sont pas des batailles rang√©es, elles sont assez r√©p√©titives (tuez tout le monde. point.).

N√©anmoins, le jeu reste propre (pour un Omega Force), j'ai (re)d√©couvert le sc√©nario (excellent) de Berserk, avec de nombreux extraits tir√©s de l'anime et j'ai vraiment pass√© un bon moment. BatBotH est tr√®s accessible pour un Musou et √ßa fait plaisir. Bref, je le conseille pour ceux qui veulent d√©couvrir le genre ou qui aiment le Lore. J'ai pass√© une petite quinzaine d'heure dessus avec grand plaisir, et m√™me si je n'ai pas pouss√© le mode Endless Eclipse, je pense que ce n'est pas trop la peine que je m'y attarde (comme je l'ai dit, peu de custo, peu de persos).
