author: {'steamid': '76561198039209337', 'num_games_owned': 440, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2915, 'last_played': 1671672007}
review:
¬°Buenas!, antes de empezar este peque√±o an√°lisis quiero comentar que no soy un "profesional" haciendo an√°lisis, por lo tanto si hay cosas muy desordenadas, no os asust√©is.

Qu√© decir, al igual que hice un analisis del Attack On Titan: Wings Of Freedom hoy me dispongo a hacerlo sobre "Berserk and the band of the Hawk".

Actualmente, llevo 45 horas jugadas. Por lo tanto creo que tengo bastante idea de lo que puedo opinar sobre el juego.
El modo historia completado al 100% en su dificultad m√°s alta "Berserk".

El juego dispone de la historia completa de y original (quitando quiz√°s alguna misi√≥n de la historia, 1 o dos sin m√°s) del manga. O sea, que podr√≠amos decir que es bastante fiel a los hechos. Las cinem√°ticas de la historia, desde el principio hasta el final de la edad de Oro ser√°n sacadas a raiz de las 3 pel√≠culas, que a mi parecer, merecen bastante la pena.
El resto de cinem√°ticas ser√°n "ingame" por as√≠ decirlo, a parte de much√≠simas conversaciones entre los personajes. 

Como en cualquier Warriors tenemos el modo free, que sinceramente, casi nunca lo toco en los Warriors ya que voy a la historia y al resto del contenido que tenga directamente. Pero bueno, por estar, est√° ah√≠ para quien le guste. B√°sicamente este modo te permite jugar la historia, el cap√≠tulo que tu quieras con el poder de elegir el personaje que m√°s te apetezca.

Endless Eclipse Mode, es un modo de bajar pisos en el cual en el momento que te salgas del modo, tendr√°s que empezar desde el piso 1 o desde el checkpoint m√°s cercano que tengas, siendo estos los pisos en los que hay checkpoint: 20-40-60-80-100.

Endless Eclipse Mode. B√°sicamente, este modo se resume en un contenido totalmente enfocado al end game, para nada hacerlo mientras haces la historia. Literalmente es bajar pisos infinitamente, recibiendo ciertos "premios" cada vez que llegues a X pisos. El tope/m√°ximo digamos, es 100. A partir del piso 100 puedes seguir bajando infinitamente (cada vez ser√° m√°s dif√≠cil), pero no recibir√°s m√°s premios. Todos los personajes tienen un m√°ximo de recompensas hasta el piso 100. Siendo el piso 100 el m√°s importante. 
Este modo de juego se resume f√°cilmente: Te dan una misi√≥n (puede ser con o sin Behelit). Seg√∫n cual aceptes, puede que te den oro y materiales u objetos, todo depende de lo que ponga en la misi√≥n. Cuando entres a la batalla tendr√°s que bajar 5 pisos seguidos. Siendo el piso 1 el m√°s sencillo y el piso 5 de esa misi√≥n el m√°s complicado, siendo el √∫ltimo piso en el que est√© el boss/los bosses m√°s fuertes de la misi√≥n. 
Cada vez que terminemos esos 5 pisos saldremos al men√∫ de elegir misiones para proseguir. Elegiremos otra nueva misi√≥n, y adelante. As√≠ hasta el piso 100. Como ya dije al principio, no os salg√°is nunca de este modo de juego si quer√©is seguir avanzando o tendr√©is que empezar de 0.

Por √∫ltimo pero no menos importante: La galer√≠a, basicamente, para la gente que quiera completar el juego al 100% dispondr√° de todo el men√∫ de m√∫sica; del men√∫ de todos los personajes; las im√°genes (behelit, los cuales iremos consiguiendo en las misiones) y de todos los objetos del juego. 

Sin m√°s, el juego me est√° gustando mucho. Para quien se pregunte cuantas horas puede llevarle completarlo al 100% unas 70-80 horas aproximadamente, quiz√°s algunas menos. 

El juego por mi parte bastante fiel a mi parecer a lo que Berserk se refiere, divertido, sangriento. Joder, ¬øqu√© m√°s quer√©is? Hahaha. 

Siento si me dejo algo de inter√©s. Creo que he tocado todos los puntos, en caso de tener cualquier duda, no dud√©is en dec√≠rmelo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082612211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1516530612}
review:
If you like musou games like me, I grew up with Samurai Warriors, then you'll obtain a level of satisfaction worth your purchase. Though it's disappointing that there is only 8 characters, just playing the story alone with Guts is satisfying as it is.

I don't know about anyone else, but even the repititative combat gave me a run for my money in certain battles unlike other musou games. Certainly didn't expect much of a "challenge" from these types of games but it keeps me from mindlessly playing the game the entire time.

The story of Berserk, if you want to experience it, I'd recommend reading the manga first then play the story here as a complimentary adaptation.

The graphics don't look as good as the trailers a while back but it's not bad for a musou game budget. Certainly better than Samurai Warriors 4-2 on PC.

But again, if you're a sucker for warriors games then you can't help but enjoy it. I've started ordering all the musou games of my childhood for my collection. That's how much I like this franchise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133185466', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1488449756}
review:
I am planning on refunding this game and rebuying it whent it gets some serious discount.
holy shit though, i believe it wont take long, the game is a piece of shit that doesnt worth 5$ let alone 60$

I mean what the fuck were they thinking when they put the price!

also the game is worse than dark souls 1 in pc controls (at least you could use the mouse) imagine dark souls 1 without  being able to use the fcking mouse (its that bad in controls)
(btw the dark souls 1 without any mod fix)

and in graphics and many things it reminds me of devil may cry 3, seriously, if i hadnt played dmc 3, I would  never get the controls so quickly

but the difference between dmc 3 and berserk is that berserk is worse in graphics and while dmc has better graphics and original videos (which are not taken from a movie), a better loading screen, a crystal clear tutorial guide to explain the controls, playable controls on pc.
THE ONLY THING BERSERK HAS IS A BIGGER PRICE! AND LESS COMBOS (next to none) but hey, maybe they didnt put almost any combos to make the game less complicate cause , ITS NEARLY UNPLAYABLE ON PC! wait! ITS A PC GAME!!!! HOLY SH!T!!! now i must get a controller since keyboard doesnt work in this game.


i am not planning on giving it up, but on second thought, now that i played it and seen how horrible it is. I think i can wait for a discount, seriously the game is that bad, maybe next week, the game will be flooded with negative reviews, so discounts will come like rain on this game.
or the price will change.

guys either buy devil may cry 3 or wait for the pricce to change!
its my only advice for you!

edit: btw i am not saying the game, is that bad, but that it doesnt worth the 60$
in my opinion its worth 10$ or less

dont get me wrong I too am a berserk fan, otherwise i wouldnt bother buying it, but i too have my limits, with a piece of shit game

author: {'steamid': '76561198034343876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1489532577}
review:
If you've ever wanted to get stunlocked into burning debris by an apostle, this is the game for you. 

Saltiness aside, this is a must have for any Berserk fan, I've enjoyed almost every moment of it, even if it's getting a bit repetitive. You pretty much get a movie thrown in with the game, but you wont be seeing any cinematics for the parts of the story that hasn't been made already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131223642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1434, 'last_played': 1492228028}
review: I would of loved this game even without my grasses 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198065799546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 6332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3524, 'last_played': 1540894188}
review:
No lo recomiendo la verdad, el juego esta muy verde.

Pros:
-Facil y entretenido
-La historia es fiel y te lo explica super bien
-La Berserk Armor sigue siendo la polla.
Contras:
-Eclipse mode es entretenido si...
-Del layer 95 para arriba es un infierno en tierra y la batalla contra Femto es simplemente una tortura, vas a estar todo el rato comiendote knockback.( y si quieres todos los logros tendras que llegar a pasartela 8 veces..not bad)

Lo recomiendo? Si vas a jugar la historia y eres fan de Berserk este juego es lo tuyo, si vas a jugar a eclipse mode mejor piensatelo 2 veces, al principio pensaras"esto es la leche" al lvl 95 lloraras sangre y te iras arrancando la piel a tiras.

Yo no lo recomendare debido a que subirse el Daunt resistance no sirve de nada y encima da igual cuantas veces subas lo de Frenzy mode o Death Blow, simplemente me molo el hecho de poder mejorar tus habs pasivamente pero te acabas dando cuenta de que no sirve de nada e incluso no me queda claro si sirve la pena repetirlas o no, me parece una mierda esto ultimo porque pense que iba a ser la leche pero no hace nada, solo sirve Slow Burn, Frenzy Inertia y Resurgence los demas desde mi persperctiva no hacen absolutamente nada.Una pena echar a la basura una caracteristica del juego que me parecio la leche al  principio y encima no lo van a actualizar para hacer que el juego  sea lo que deberia haber sido.

"Pero entonces porque le has dado mas de 60 horas?" 
-Facil, es Berserk, me la pone demasiado dura Guts en modo berserk y a ti tambien te pone, por eso lo seguire jugando a pesar de mucho que sufra me parece la pena para un fan de Berserk, para el resto deberiais pensaroslo 2 veces.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029372563', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1491982519}
review:
Though i dont think the movies are the best way to expirience berserk, youre better off watching the movies, this is honestly such a bad reprisenttation of the story it makes me mad, a needless entry in the series. All you do in this game is press the x button and the y button, there is no depth, no strategy and a botched up cencored verion of the movies haphazardly smushed in for really no good reason

as a person wanting to learn more about this series, i strongly recommend the movies as its the fastest way to expirience the golden age arc

author: {'steamid': '76561198071625446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1362, 'last_played': 1642807788}
review:
I really like this game, everything works well together in my opinion. I only have two complaints - the ending will likely leave you somewhat unsatified, granted it catches up with the manga very well for a video game. Also I think there definitely needs to be more playable characters. The fact there is already DLC and it's kind of expensive doesn't sit well with me. All i'm saying is that i better not have to pay $15 to play as the Skeleton Knight. FR. Pls gaem mekers. Overall it's very fun and very addicting with those points aside. It runs easily on my 660 graphics card which is rare for new games and i feel like finally berserk was given a decent game! 

griffith did nothing wrong

author: {'steamid': '76561198113347296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1713, 'last_played': 1574043141}
review:
Unless you're a hard berserk fan don't buy it

The entire game is just rushing how fast you can charge your special attacks

The between battle conversations add a bit of fun interaction between the rest of the characters and for the golden age portion they use scenes from the movies but in that regard:
1. Eclipse scenes heavily edited
1.1 no potato rape
1.2 no seeing guts hack off his arm besides zooming in on his face

It is satisfying to hack through mounds of enemies as guts but they lessened the impact of each soldier:
"100 man slayer"
1200 kills that battle

I wish steam had a system to rate better than thumbs up and down because this is like barely a thumbs up and only because I love the series, as I said don't bother unless you're a fan

author: {'steamid': '76561198061775011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1488424829}
review:
Before delving into my quarrels with this game I'd like to say this: Berserk is one of the best fantasy stories I've ever read, and if you're into Dark Souls, well, it takes inspiration from Berserk, so I'd reccommend you read it. That being said, YOU NEED TO READ THE FUCKING MANGA IN ORDER TO FULLY ENJOY THE IN GAME STORY! I feel Omega Force greatly marginalized its audience by having one pf the biggest events in the series featured IN THE FUCKING OPENING CUTSCENE! 

Alright, onto the game: WHAT THE FUCK?!

A little extreme, but come on!? THE MAX RESOLUTION IS 720p! I don't know if no one else has this issue, but my friend and I both bought it and we have this issue. Alongside this, the options are very, very simplistic and I've had the issue of having to make the game fullscreen by going through the in game menu, because if you set it to fullscreen in the out of client options menu it becomes borderless windowed in a 4:3 aspect ratio! Really!?

The cutscenes for the entirety of the Golden Age arc are shamelessly stolen from the movies, which is annoying because when I pay $60 for a game I expect real effort to be put into it.

And that really sums up my views on the game: it feels like there's a serious lack of effort. It looks like an Xbox 360 game from 2009, and feels like it too. I will say that the gameplay can be fun, because the Warriors series is definitely the best way to adapt Berserk into a game, and the berserk modes are really fun to use, especially since it gets stronger every time you use it, but I just expected more. I played some of Hyrule Warriors, and it left a really good impression, but this just left a bad taste in my mouth. 

I will say that this game has its moments, like your first encounter with Zodd's big ass apostle form really made me feel the same panic I imagine Guts did when he charged at me. I also appreciate that they tried to add in all the dialogues between characters, but that's about it. 

If Omega Force can give this game some proper resolutions and possibly add co-op then I'll happily return to this review and reccommend it, but as of now I'd reccommend a friend to spend their money on a better game, like For Honor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031998265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 7227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2353, 'last_played': 1637859343}

author: {'steamid': '76561198077248587', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1393, 'last_played': 1488257929}
review:
COMING FROM A PERSON WHO HAS NEVER HEARD OR REQUESTED THIS GAME! IT SHOWED UP IN MY QUEUE AND I WAS CURIOUS.

Graphics 5/5: It's not life-like but I have seen reviews and heard from friends that this is also an old anime so the cartoonish look is fine by me =]

Controls: Never tried keyboard as these type games I prefer controller

Animations 4/5: Love every one of them except when they used gameplay graphics as an animation to prevent long load times (and possibly money for extra scenes) but it seem quite buggy. Clothes "twitched" or more like a flicking motion in almost every scene and seems like an easy fix with a patch or something.

Story 10/5: Yes, that's right a ten out of five that's how good the story is. It pulls you in wondering what's going to happen next and you might think of what's going to happen but the plot twists and you're stuck there with your jaw dropped. I'm actually going to go into the anime and watch the rest of his story but so far this game alone has a very good story.

Overall 9/10: I don't want to give it a full 10 because I feel like there could've been more effort into the animation and gameplay. I only played it on Normal but it felt kinda repetitive since it's the same style as Dynasty Warriors (Biggest difference is you get to slice people in half). Although I don't give it a full 10 I do recommend people of age to try this game when they want since it just came out and it's still $60 but it does get my 2 thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015000012', 'num_games_owned': 1805, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1488125044}
review:
Era meglio Sword of the Berserk uscito nel 1999 per Dreamcast. E ho detto tutto.

Tralasciando il commento "a effetto" ma comunque tristemente veritiero almeno sotto il profilo dell'atmosfera e del coinvolgimento, questo titolo fallisce in una cosa fondamentale, ovvero ricreare la magica atmosfera del manga. 

Nessun tratto davvero distintivo che possa differenziarlo dalla marea di altri musou sul mercato, nessun contenuto DAVVERO accattivante, ma solo il minimo sindacale: la possibilit√† di rivivere una buona parte della splendida storia narrata nel manga dalla prospettiva di una manciata di personaggi. 

Un gioco per pochi, pochissimi: i veri irriducibili del brand ovvero gli unici in grado di passare sopra ai suoi evidenti limiti.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I8USXW-OATA

author: {'steamid': '76561197962127913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 2800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2800, 'last_played': 1501520293}
review:
I like it. I like it a lot.

It's not the best Musou game in the world, but it's pretty good.

There is only one downside that I've encountered so far: Crashes. It's crashed when selecting a level, it's crashed when finishing a cinematic, it's crashed when completing a level. Some problem with VisualBasic, it seems.

Hopefully they patch it soon. I hate to have to keep ctrl+alt+deleting to end the program and start it back up again. Haven't lost any progress because of it yet, but it's very likely to happen at some point.

EDIT: Just now got around to finishing the game after taking a break for a few months.

There' s a couple quirks about this game: You unlock seemingly very-important game functions way, way late in the game. For apparently no reason. You get the ability to switch out individual skills in items you have at basically the end of the game, after you've already created maxxed out items working around the idea that you *couldn't* choose specific skills. So by the time you get it, it's basically pointless. Likewise, at the end of the game you unlock Guts' berserker armor, which completely changes everything about the game - combat now entirely revolves around getting into berserk mode as soon as possible, and literally anything that doesn't get you closer to that goal is a complete waste. So here you are at the end of the game with your items that increase stun duration, and stunning becomes pointless. It may have been on purpose, as now you can use the newly-unlocked ability of choosing which skill to gain on an item to remove the useless ones and replace them with the newly-important ones you've been ignoring the whole game. Still, it feels somewhat schizophrenic, especially considering...

The game's storyline has no satisfying ending. It sets up the big-bad to be this one guy the whole game, and then you spend half the game looking for him and killing everything in your way, and then he reappears aaaaaand you fight some other guy as the end boss and never see the actual big-bad again. And then the game's over.

I assume they're looking to fit this into a sequel or even a series, but even still as a single game the story leaves much to be desired. It at the same time feels too long and yet not enough gets done in the duration.

review: This games got alot of good qualities in it! bascially its a dynasty warriors game with more objectives really. It really does a good job sort of keeping up with the anime. I have had some frame dips and it crashed once when i killed too many enemies so it has some bugs to be wary of but on the bright side its no COD blunder of epic proportions. I think they chose the right people to bring this game to life I love the anime soo much I got tattoos and would buy this game again for slightly lower but i wanted to support it for another game! Its hard to get content for your favorite series so hopefully it brings more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017203380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1518535741}
review:
Un indispensable pour les fans boy de Berserk tel que moi, pour les autres... bah je pense qu'il y a des Muso plus sympa √† faire ;)

Le Plus :

- L'histoire, reprennant enfin plus que le Golden Age (Histoire jusqu'au tome 33)
- Le mode Endless Eclipse (un par perso), un donjon au 100 lvl, √ßa sent bon les RPG gamecube tout √ßa
- Le contenu, en 13h j'ai √† peine finis le Golden Age (47% de l'histoire) et 50 lvl du Endless de Guts
- Un gameplay plus beat them all que simplement Muso assez souvent
- Zodd jouable, what else ^^

Les moins :

- Les cin√©matiques √† 20 fps, alors que le reste du jeu est parfaitement fluide
- Wyald jouable ! Pourquoi lui parmis tout les apotres classes qui sont aussi pr√©sent dans le jeu ?
- Casca est immonde dans ce jeu
- L'animation en cutscene digne d'un jeu PS1 sans budget
- Les expressions de visage en cutscene juste ignoble
- La censure de certaines cin√©matique qui enl√®ve tout enjeu dramatique

author: {'steamid': '76561198033670932', 'num_games_owned': 1823, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 5230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2183, 'last_played': 1631440871}
review:
Berserk + Musou-Gameplay = Instant Buy!!!

Das ist meine Meinung, denn ich wei√ü aus Erfahrung mit anderen Musou-Titeln, dass diese polarisieren. Man liebt oder hasst sie. Ein zwischending gibt es nicht wirklich. Jedes Musou-Game, welches ich spielte fand ich super, auch das hier. 
Die erste H√§lfte des Story-Modes spielt sich wie jedes typische Musou-Game, hei√üt meistens Armee vs Armee und selten mal 1 vs Armee. Die zweite H√§lfte ist man meist allein oder in ner kleinen Gruppe und k√§mpft gegen ne armee. Soweit so bekannt.
Berserk hat 2 Dinge, die sich von den meisten Musou-Spielen unterscheiden: 1. Es gibt nur wenige Charaktere (8) und 2. Es hat RICHTIGE 1-on-1 Bossk√§mpfe (von 2 bis 5 HP-Balken).
Die Story von Berserk ist gut aber nicht perfekt pr√§sentiert, alle mal besser als Arslan (find ich).

9,5/10 f√ºrs geilste Musou-Spiel ever




+10 weil Guts endlich Femto/Femuth t√∂ten kann :-D

author: {'steamid': '76561197995907959', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 1912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1771, 'last_played': 1545764496}
review:
La review va √™tre vite fait !

D√©j√†, faut savoir que je connais pas la s√©rie ! Donc pour moi se jeux est un ovni^^.



Un jeu de qualit√© ! Un mossou, jeu √† caract√®re r√©p√©titif ? Ben comme dansDiablo 3 on slash du mob et on suis le court de l'histoire sauf qu'on est pas sur de l'open world, donc ce n'est en sois pas un point n√©gatif.

-Des personnages attachants. (Sp√©cial mention "puck" la petites f√©e elf, je la mangerai toute crue !)
-Un syst√®me de craft comprenant tout base de RPG ! Du common au legendary qui se loot direct en jeux ou qui peut-√™ttre acheter au magasin.

-Chaque personnage est unique √† jouer, et je ne spoilerai pas.

-Un mossu aux allures de l'univers de dark soul. Gollem/Ogre/Squelettes/esprit......Vous les smasherez comme de la merde par 50aines et √ßa, c'est bon ! √ßa revitalise cette aspect Moussu ou l'on voie toujours le m√™me type de guerrier sur le terrain qui au final donne se cot√© r√©p√©titif. L√† on parle d'un mossu qui au fil de votre progression va vous surprendre tant sc√©naristique que gameplay !

-En effet, le gameplay est √©volutif ! Non seulement vous leveler votre personnage comme tout RPG, mais en plus vous d√©bloquerez des combo, ajouter √† cel√† que votre perso compte 3 √©volution diff√©rente, et ces √©volution change carr√©ment les animations. Et √ßa, c'est de la bombe, car les animations sont de plus en plus brutal ! Surtout la 3√®me √©volution, mamamya.

-Des combat de boss d√©dier ! des √©volution qui influe sur le pattern comme dans dark soul, mais ne prenez pas peur, on est loin d'un dark soul ! i√ßi, vous aurez le temps d'appr√©cier le boss et de le combattre. (J'√©met n√©anmoins une r√©serve sur les 2 difficulter apr√®s le mod normal, car les mob de base attaque plus souvent et font plus de d√©gat et ons plus de PV, je pense qu'il en va de m√™me pour les boss, mais la difficulter est r√©glable en d√©but de mission).

-Une descente aux enfers ! Mais une ascention en puissance de guts qui se rescent dans le gameplay.


Un point important, j'ai pas mal de mossu, √ß'es mon 2√®me sur pC, et Berserk va √™tre le seul que je fini, l√† j'en suis √† la quasi fin, et pourquoi me direz-vous ?

Et bien de mon point de vue personnel, c'est le seul mossu √† offrir une vrai sensation de brutalit√© !
Si je doit compar√©, prenez dragon quest/dynasty warrior, bref vous avez compris, quand rentre dans la foule, on √† l'impression d'un gameplay l√©g√©, on √† toujours se plaisir de foncer dans le tas mais de taper des feuille de PQ.
Du coup bon, √ßa enl√®ve le plaisir de jeu que poss√®de Berserk √† savoir:
Taper dans des gros tas de merde en masse !
On sent le poid de la Batarde qui tape la chair.
Et √ßa j'ai envie de dire, vous le ressentirer d√®s les premi√®res minute de jeux.
M√™me si vous regarder du gameplay, vous senter que √ßa tape !

-Un mode Endless eclipse qui se d√©bloque apr√®s avoir fait la premi√®re mission.
Il faut savoir que j'ai test√©, √ß'est un principe de Rogue like Proposant des objectif et des r√©compenses non n√©gligeable pour la progression.
Le but descendre le plus bas possible sans mourir, bref.

Enfaite se jeu est une sacr√©e surprise car √† l'achat, je me voyai d√©j√† envisag√© un refund car mossu= d√©j√† vue d√©j√† jouer, mais enfaite non ! Le jeu m'√©rite largement sont pris car derri√®re le massacre de mass qu'offre le jeux, y'a une m√©canique de jeu travaill√©.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034297875', 'num_games_owned': 7840, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 2809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1799, 'last_played': 1561654807}
review:
Berserk And The Band Of The Hawk is Omega Force‚Äòs latest musou adaptation of a popular media franchise, and it‚Äôs probably one of their best efforts to date, thanks to the extraordinary quality of the source material and the way the company‚Äôs ‚Äúone versus thousands‚Äù design fits the manga‚Äôs depiction of the hero‚Äôs swordfighting prowess.

The first third of the game follows the ‚ÄúGolden Age‚Äù story arc, and it features high quality anime cutscenes that work perfectly as a way of easing newcomers into the world of Berserk. Sadly, since only the Golden Age arc has received an up to date official anime adaptation, these cutscenes give way to CGI once the first third of the game ends, something that I personally found a bit jarring. The narrative is easy to follow, and even players with no previous knowledge of the manga shouldn‚Äôt have any problems keeping up with the story arcs featured here. It‚Äôs important to note that all the voiced segments are in Japanese, and the actors did a truly exceptional job, bringing their characters to life in a way that elevates this particular musou over older titles that relied on English dubs. Some people may dislike the fact that they must read subtitles mid battle, but I didn‚Äôt have any problems following the plot.

As expected, Berserk and The Band Of The Hawk‚Äòs gameplay is very similar to Omega Force‚Äòs Warriors series, with our playable character facing hundreds of weaker opponents and fighting moderately powerful officer units from time to time. During the Story mode we‚Äôll usually play as Guts, an incredibly strong warrior who wields a powerful greatsword and different sub weapons that can be activated in order to gain an edge during particularly heated battles. Our heroes‚Äô main horizontal slashing attacks can be used to start combos, and their charging (or heavy) blows may be combined with normal attacks in order to create powerful finishing moves. A character growth system is also in place, letting us learn more advanced combos, and gain helpful boosts to four different stats (Vitality, Attack, Defense, Technique) which may also be further upgraded through the use of accessories that can be found after defeating key enemies or completing specific objectives.

In place of the usual Musou gauge we can find a Frenzy meter, which can be filled up by attacking enemy forces or using special items. After triggering Frenzy mode, characters under our control will hit harder, killing weak foes in just one hit, and will also fill up another meter, the Death Blow gauge. We can use this special attack to decimate scores of enemies in just one hit, obliterating most non-boss combatants in one fell swoop. Frenzy mode can be used as many times as we can fill the bar during each battle, and it can also level up, becoming even more powerful as we use it. Berserk fans hoping for gory combat will be happy to learn that using Frenzy mode lets us dismember enemies, and our character will quickly be covered in their foes‚Äô blood.

As the game progresses, we will also unlock new costumes (which come equipped with sub-weapons) as well as a number of accessories, consumable items and different horses. Up to three accessories can be equipped at the same time, and we may use them to increase our characters‚Äô stats (Vitality, Attack, Defense and Technique) or add new skills. Since our heroes‚Äô weapons can‚Äôt be changed (for lore related reasons) these accessories will be extremely important if we want to succeed in harder difficulties. After a certain point in the story we‚Äôll be able to upgrade accessories using materials found in the battlefield, and later on, we may even mix several items in order to upgrade our favorites with skills found in trinkets that weren‚Äôt in use at the moment.

Aside from the usual ‚Äúone versus hundreds‚Äù gameplay style, we will also come face to face with boss characters in both closed 1vs1 arenas and larger battlefields that also include weak mobs. These powerful foes come in all sizes, will withstand Death Blow attacks, can use Frenzy mode, and may even transform into bigger versions of themselves mid fight (not unlike the bosses found in Souls games). I‚Äôm not entirely sold on the way boss fights work in Berserk and The Band Of The Hawk, since some encounters may quickly become frustrating wars of attrition against enemies who abuse special attacks or seemingly broken hitboxes, but I welcomed the extra challenge after hours of slashing through less worthy opponents.

Most battles also feature side objectives that can be tackled in order to unlock Gallery items, and they may range from escort quests (which are far better than the ones featured in the Attack on Titan game, thankfully) to defeating a specific number of enemies before a timer runs out, vanquishing a boss before they transform, or helping party members in need.

Beating stages lets us replay them in a Free Mode, using any character we may have unlocked so far (there are eight playable characters, each with their own moveset, characteristic weapon and array of sub-weapons) A roguelike inspired mode called the Endless Eclipse is also available, offering specific objectives for every character and featuring an impressive number of floors to be conquered, though aspiring masters of this mode should know that death will reset their floor progress unless they reach specific checkpoints (and that the same boss fights present in the Story mode also make an appearance here) Achieving certain milestones will not only reward us with the chance to start this mode from more advanced floors, but also with new characters, horses and costumes which can be used in the Free Mode as well (character levels are also shared in all the playable modes).

As it is usually the case with Omega Force‚Äôs titles, Berserk and The Band Of The Hawk will not win any awards on the tech department if we focus on texture quality and polycounts (though the character models are exquisitely detailed and always stay true to the source material) but the sheer number of enemies on screen more than makes up for the game‚Äôs graphical shortcomings. Performance wasn‚Äôt an issue on my computer, something that was a relief after experiencing Toukiden: Kiwami‚Äòs PC port, and the title‚Äôs gamepad controls work perfectly. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend using a keyboard, however, as the game doesn‚Äôt support mouse input, so players using this control scheme will have a hard time adjusting the camera, for example.

To conclude, Berserk and The Band Of The Hawk is one of the best musou titles to date, offering tons of quality content, a well told story and fun gameplay that will enthrall fans of the franchise and newcomers alike.

8.5/10 ‚Äì Great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045659727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1897, 'last_played': 1488443066}
review:
Berserk fans. This actually takes it past the Golden Age. It plays scenes from the movie and the Musou team animated their own. Very well done. If you watched the movies and never got into the manga, this is game is the best way right now to catch up. Besides the manga itself of course. The recent anime adaption is shit compared to this game, to be honest. Combat is fun, you feel like Guts swinging that sword around. You feel like Zodd, transforming into your Apostle form and shooting that tornado thingy at people.
If you are a Musou fan and you don't know anything about Berserk. Then you are about to experience one of the greatest stories ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003884281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1488064627}
review:
The base game and everything about is great. It's a Dynasty Warriors style game that fits well in the Berserk universe.

However, the performance of this game has been the worst I've encountered in a long, long time.

Normally, my old machine (better specs than the minimum required) can run at 1600x900, at the very least with med/low settings. But for Berserk, I was still getting stuttering and lag with the lowest settings and 600x400 resolution. 

In short, wait until this game is patched. If it never is, than be careful with your money, as you might not be able to enjoy this title with its performance issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043016195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 7225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7069, 'last_played': 1590606715}
review:
Da grande amante dei warriors game non posso che ritenermi soddisfatto della spesa.
Modalita pazzesca con l'esclisse infinita e filmati mozzafiato, il tutto condito da sangue e pezzi di cadavere in pieno stile miura.
Un must have per gli appassionati e non.
Aggiungo: da comprare il pacchetto dei cavalli, non ve ne pentirete!

review:
Bon bah un bon petit Musou √† l'ancienne avec l'univers du sublime Berserk...

Enfin l'univers vite fait... O√π Est l'ambiance sombre, violente, profonde et gore de l'oeuvre originale ? On se croirait presque au pays des bisounours, quelques goutes de sangs et c'est tout...

Faute √† la magnifique censure de nos frileux √©diteurs.... La magie n'est pas l√† m√™me la version Dreamcast √©tait plus fid√©le :(

Apr√®s les persos sont bien mod√©lis√©s, sa rame pas un poil sur mon MSI-GT70 vieux de plus de 2 ans, la Bande-son est cool mais les passages OAV auraient m√©rit√©s d'√™tre en HD...
V√©n√©rant ce manga je ne peu pas le d√©conseiller mais cela manque de saveurs...

Dommage j'en attendait plus... Un petit 14/20 en attendant des Maj...

If you like Berserk the anime/Manga, go right ahead and revisit the story. If not, please kindly reconsider before clicking buy. It's really, REALLY boring!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991122213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1488124781}
review:
TL,DR: Not really a bad experience but doesn't worth the money at all
(would not recommend until it drops at least below 20)

First thing first: that's my fisrt Mus√¥ so it may influence my judgment.

Berserk and the band of the Hawk felt really disappointing to me.
Characters doesn't not really seem to have interresting combo.
Guts is the only one that feels like having a complete moveset, but feels quite poor too.
The feeling is really good though, the feeling of sending people flying at each swing of your sword is cool!
Sadly I didn't understand how the difficulty levels works:
Hard mode (3/5): "Only bosses really deals noticables damages (and not that much)"
Berserk mode (4/5): "Minions kills me in 4 hits WTF?"
There are very few differents environments that you will see again and again ... and again!
Didn't understand the block systeme either: why would i want to block instead of using my always-convenient-dash when the only ennemies that really deals damages breaks my guard in one hit?
Everything about menus feels like they didn't care. For an exemple: bonus stats on items are stated as "strengh bonus lvl5". Can't you just tell me how much strengh it gives?! I don't care about the bonus level, give me actual values!
Despite interface issues, the gear part of the game is quite interesting though.
And to conclude, beheliths (items you earn but completing special objectives during missions) only unlock pieces of artworks. It already felt disappointing to me that the reward is something that don't improve/change my game experience (and that i can have in 2 clicks on the internet), but even more frustrating, you need like 20 beheliths to unlock 1 full artwork and you can hardly earn 3 per mission, making the beheliths system totally worthless.


In the end, i didn't felt like playing a really bad game, but more like playing a below-average game that i paid way, WAY too much for.
15-20 would be the price it actually deserve imo

author: {'steamid': '76561198190583586', 'num_games_owned': 1136, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 3757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2064, 'last_played': 1489504821}
review:
Berserk and Band of the Hawk is another IP based from the one of the best manga Berserk. I suggest you read the manga first if you arent familiar with the story, because the story is the strong point in Berserk. This game is a hack and slash like DW series, but with gore. So,you're going to have fun in killing, watching those body parts flying and blood splattered on the ground.

Story:
Not gonna comment on this one, its good. Read the manga or jump straight to play. I do recommend reading the manga first tho, to know what is what, who is who. Imo, Griffith is a d*ck. 

Graphic:
Graphic is nice, but nothing spectacular, cause its PS4 port. Graphic option is very simple, similar to DW series.

Gameplay:
I am not gonna comment about the hack and slash part. But there is a frenzy system, which acts like a berserk mode, cause in the manga, whenever Guts angry, he is kinda like go into berserk mode, more powerful. When you are in frenzy mode, everytime you hit enemies, you will fill the deathblow gauge, this is basically the musou attack. Oh, the frenzy is bar is filled by hitting enemies too, the higher your combo goes, the faster it will be. Or you can use items. 

Items in this game is divided into two, consumables and sub-weapons. Each has its own charges, once it depleted, you have to wait for the cooldown. You can fasten it by getting enemy's drop which shortens the cooldown. 

Equipmens, equipments is basically accessories and horses, you will get this when you kill enemy general/officer/boss, or you cam buy it in the shop. In the later story, 2 options will be unlocked, Amalgamation and Enhance. Each accessories has its own stats(ATK, DEF, VIT, TECH, etc) and atributes, and one is locked, means it cannot be replaced.
Enhance is strengthening one particular atribute using materials with the same color as the atribute. Example: to increase attack atribut, you need to use red material, for defense atribut you have to use brown materials, etc.
Amalgamation, this is the real deal, you can combine two accessories to increase the base accessory's stats and atributes. This is the key to make Guts more powerful than he already is. 

Endless Eclipse
This mode is the tower mode in DW. Instead of floors, its called layers. First time you enter this mode, you will have to select one of several desires to complete it, each desire will be completed in 5 layers, so you have to progress layer to layer to complete missions until you reach the 5th layer to complete 1 desire. Its a grindfest, but its fun one, I can see more blood and body parts. Perfect.

Behelit:
Behelit in the manga is an artifact or a thing used to summon the 4 Gods of hell/darkness. But in this game, behelith is like a sub mission in every stage on story mode, everytime you get one, a section of picture will be revealed in the gallery. Dont worry, they are easy to get, the requirements are straightforward, just play on easy. 

TLDR, here is a quick pro/con:
Pros:
- Story
- Guts with Berserk Armor, this armor makes Lu Bu like a small kid with anger management. Wearing this armor makes Guts looks bad-fakin-ass, faster, more powerful, AOE attack, epic deathblow attack, and ofc more blood and limbs scattered. 
- Skeleton Knight horse, I was hoping he is one of the playable character, but he isnt.At least we got his horse.
- Gore, when Guts is in frenzy mode, almost every attack will tear enemy's limbs, charged attack is rekt guaranteed.

Cons:
- Very few playable characters
- No Skeleton Knight
- Content wise is not that much, its not worth the current price. Besides story mode and endless eclipse, there is no more things to do. 
- Camera, god damn the camera, when I fought against the large apostle, sometimes the camera can get too close, so close the only thing I can see is the apostle's body, I was being pummeled till death a few times because of this. 
- No FOV slider, after playing for 19 hours, its kinda annoying being too close to the character's back, if someone could make the fov slider mod like the one in dragon quest heroes, that would be great

Get this on sale if you are not a fan. If you're a fan, get it now or on sale, its up to you.

Update 1: I dont recommend buying this until a patch comes out. The game keeps crashing in Endless Eclipse after finishing 1-2 desires, I tried borderless gaming, setting priority to high on the task manager, updating my driver to the newest one, reinstalling the game, after all those, still getting crash. I will try rolling back to the previous driver, I will update the review after i get the result. Dont buy it, wait for a patch.

Update 2: I rolled to the old driver 376.33 to be exact, and the game stop crashing in endless eclipse mode, I just finished the 100th layers just now. So, if you have random crashes, try install the 376.33 driver from NVIDIA website

author: {'steamid': '76561198030199830', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1513221118}
review: You know, when I first started I was really excited about this game. I love Berserk, it was what got me into anime and Dark Souls. I really enjoyed the visceral feel as I brutally tore through whole legions. But then I fought Femto. What the fuck is that? What the fuck do you think you're doing, making a boss battle that does nothing but slow you and knock you back? What the fuck kind of game design is that? Slow my movement, fine. But put it IN AN ACCESSIBLE PLACE. WHY THE FUCK WOULD YOU PUT THE SLOWING THING BEHIND FUCKING TORNADOES AND UNBLOCKABLE SHOTS THAT KNOCK YOU DOWN. AND THE SHOTS FUCKING TRACK?! Fuck this game, and fuck the developers for making stupid fucking decisions. The game is supposed to be FUN. I'd rather flay the skin off of my own hands than deal with that fucking battle again. Fuck you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027367228', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1488083412}
review:
Solid game if you are a BERSERK fan. 
Fighting in the Berserk armor is freaking awesome, but late in the game. 
Combat could use a little more variety, but it's standard Musou/Warriors fighting.
Goes from Golden Age Arc to the Falcon of the Millennium Empire Arc.


Probably not worth it if you are not a berserk fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079410930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2247, 'last_played': 1671250661}
review:
-Sobre os pontos positivos desse jogo - 

O jogo √© otimo, uma grande parte dos filmes e do anime e conta uma parte relativamente boa do mang√° de forma bem precisa. A jogabilidade √© bem fluida e √© bem facil de pegar o jeito do jogo rapido. Os graficos est√£o lindos e as anima√ß√µes est√£o muito bem feitas. Apesar do jogo ter poucos combos cada personagem √© unico e tem sua forma de jogar o que faz com que cada jogador tenha seu personagem preferido de se usar. o modo endless eclipse tr√°s miss√µes bem interessantes a serem feitas e um modo mais tatico por assim dizer, j√° que voc√™ precisa ser cauteloso com seus itens j√° que eles n√£o s√£o reestabelecidos facilmente. A trilha sonora esta simplesmente perfeita, assim como as outras OST de Berserk.

- Sobre os pontos Negativos - 
Apesar de n√£o ser um problema para mim o jogo pode se tornar bem repetitivo com grande facilidade, √© um jogo Musou afinal de contas. como dito anteriormente existem poucas varia√ß√µes de combos. o porte para teclado esta bem complicado de se usar, e uma vez ou outra o controle tambem da uma pequena bugada na hora de transformar o personagem, que falando neles, existem bem poucos, acho que o que mais me surpreendeu foi o fato do Skull Knight n√£o ser jogavel. o jogo tem uma optmiza√ß√£o mais ou menos, mas pelo menos ele tem a descencia de avisar que caso voc√™ esteja usando windows 8 ou 10 se n√£o usar modo de compatibilidade vai perder performance. A censura do jogo, sinceramente n√£o teve muita √© facil ver peda√ßos voando pra tudo que √© lado quando se ativa o death blow, s√≥ estou reclamando pois acho que alguns personagens n√£o estra√ßalham com tanta facilidade os inimigos, mas tirando isso √© tranquilo.

- Considera√ß√µes finais -
O jogo esta otimo, mas esta meio salgadinho, eu recomendo voc√™ esperar por uma sale caso voc√™ n√£o seja um f√£ da serie berserk mas queira jogar o jogo mesmo assim ou ent√£o tem curiosidade. por outro lado caso voc√™ seja um f√£ que realmente gosta muito de berserk eu acho que o pre√ßo atual √© toleravel para se comprar pois eu gartanto que voc√™ gostar bastante. O jogo √© 8,5 - 9 de 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027349524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1487975771}
review:
NOTE: The issue I'm having isn't a universal one. It may not affect a large number of users, this is from my personal experience on a machine with the following specs:

i5-3570k @ 3.40GHZ
16GB RAM
GTX-770 2GB
Windows 7 64-Bit

----------------


The game ran fairly smoothly for me, after setting Environments to Low. After adjusting a few settings, I was able to get a steady 60fps at 1080p.

The problem I was having is, after almost every single mission, the program would crash. I kept trying to play it, crashing every time after the third story mission, coming up on the 2 hour limit before I decided to refund..

As for the game itself, I REALLY hope this issue is resolved, because it's a good bit of fun that I could see myself losing hours and hours to. If the crashing issues are resolved, and maybe some tweaks to help fix whatever's causing framerates to tank on some systems, I would definitely re-buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044279527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1622014985}
review: pretty easy recommendation if you enjoy warriors games you'll like this too. the only downside so far is the camera isn't great. In Hyrule Warriors the camera is almost completly above the character your playing giving you a good view of your sorroundings and making it easy to keep track of where you are, they don't use that in this game for some reason. Instead the camera is directly behind you and if you're playing a smaller character (like Scheireke) you can lose track of them once the crowd gets to dense...

author: {'steamid': '76561197995703913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1631, 'last_played': 1488214475}
review:
Tl;dr : un jeu tr√®s sympa dans l'ensemble malgr√© quelques trous dans le sc√©nario et quelques boss maladroits. A recommander aux fans du manga ou de Musou pour une vingtaine d'heures (bien plus si l'on souhaite finir le jeu √† 100%). Quelques freezes en d√©but de session qui s'estompent apr√®s quelques minutes.

Le jeu a le m√©rite de proposer tous les arcs termin√©s du manga dans l'ordre chronologique : Golden Age (qui est agr√©ment√© de cin√©matiques... beaucoup de cin√©matiques, issues de la trilogie de films l'Age d'Or I, II et III), Black Swordsman, Conviction et Millenial Falcon.

Le premier arc est assez complet quoi que censur√© par moments (notamment au passage de l'Eclipse sur certains plans, en revanche l'histoire est respect√©e), reprenant m√™me des personnages oubli√©s de l'anime comme Wyald. En revanche le boss final de cet arc souffre d'un design mal pens√© qui rendra l'affrontement plus frustrant qu'autre chose, dommage.
Le second nous fait revivre les deux combats iconiques de cet arc, plut√¥t bien dos√©s ceux-l√†.
Conviction est l'arc le moins bien r√©alis√© je trouve, Luca y est totalement absente, donc toute une partie de l'histoire et la r√©v√©lation sur Casca passent √† la trappe ou sont amen√©es rapidement au d√©tour d'un couloir.
En revanche avec le dernier arc les cin√©matiques avec le moteur du jeu se font meilleures (quoi que toujours imparfaites) et l'histoire est relativement bien respect√©e, √† une ou deux petites censures pr√®s qui ne nuisent pas au jeu. Seul b√©mol, le boss final dont on ne sait rien √† moins d'avoir lu le manga, et le twist de fin qui n'appara√Æt pas, certainement par manque de temps.

Niveau graphismes, √† part donc les cin√©matiques avec le moteur du jeu qui oscillent entre le sympathique et le (tr√®s) passable mais qui ont le m√©rite de suivre le manga parfois √† la ligne pr√®s, le jeu est honn√™te.

Le gameplay est vraiment sympathique et dynamique, les personnages sont en nombre r√©duit mais chacun a un style de jeu tr√®s diff√©rent, et en plus des furies habituelles on a la possibilit√©s, sur certains persos, d'acc√©der √† leur transformation (la forme ap√¥tre de Zodd, ou l'armure Berserk de Guts vers la fin du jeu) au lieu d'utiliser le finisher, des formes tr√®s puissantes mais limit√©es dans le temps.
Fort heureusement, la gestion d'objets (qu'on d√©bloque au fur et √† mesure) permet de personnaliser les capacit√©s des h√©ros (en augmentant les d√©g√¢ts de la furie par exemple ou en diminuant son temps de rechargement) pour coller au style de chaque personnage. Ca n'est pas n√©cessaire en mode Normal qui √† quelques exceptions pr√®s est une promenade de sant√©, mais en augmentant la difficult√© ou en visitant l'Endless Eclipse le challenge est l√†.

L'Endless Eclipse d'ailleurs, est une sorte de Palantir de Sauron (pour ceux qui ont jou√© √† RotK il y a une petite √©terint√©) o√π l'on doit aller le plus loin possible sans pouvoir recharger nos potions et autres items de soin entre chaque mission pour d√©bloquer des r√©compenses (skins, montures, objets sp√©ciaux et m√™me un personnage suppl√©mentaire) et finir le jeu √† 100%. Sans dire que ce mode est original, le challenge est pr√©sent m√™me en mode normal cette fois-ci. Tuer Zodd et le Lord of Thieves sans pouvoir recharger ses objets peut √™tre compliqu√© si l'on a pas encore fini le jeu. En revanche une fois l'armure Berserker d√©bloqu√©e, booster la difficult√© est une bonne id√©e.

En tout et pour tout un bon jeu qui exploite bien l'univers et les personnages de Berserk, avec quelques oublis et trous dans le sc√©nario mais rien de trop handicapant. Et, petit d√©tail amusant, sur l'√©cran de chargement l'on peut incarner Puck qui frappe le texte "now loading", de quoi s'occuper et se rappeler le Tortue G√©niale volant de Budokai 2.

review:
I can't really recomend this game at its current price, it's really fun killing loads of enemies as Guts for like 20 minutes, and then the rest just feels like mashing x.

Main Complaints:
 -It is way too much just mashing X.
 -The difficulties are either too easy or way too hard.
 - Mainly just too little variety.

Things I liked:
-The Gore
- The little mid battle animations are really neat
- The Boss fights are pretty fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002695589', 'num_games_owned': 1989, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1536973348}
review: I'm usually not a big fan of M√ªso kind of games, but I have to admit it's simply the best kind of gameplay for a Berserk adaptation. The battles feel truly brutal and bloody like in the manga, and the game faithfully follows the chronology of the story, with quite long (and well chosen) bits of the golden age arc anime. Also, the visuals are really well executed, which is rarely the case in Dynasty Warriors and its many clones. Here, everything from models to textures and effects makes the world feel like the real Berserk world and honor Miura's designs. So, if you're a Berserk fan, this is undoubtedly a must buy, as well as for m√ªso fans that will discover one the best universes ever adapted in this kind of gamplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000632204', 'num_games_owned': 1382, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1513998764}
review:
I should start off by saying, if you haven't watched the anime, or read the Manga, you should do that first. The game is going to have massive spoilers you can't avoid. If you just want this style of gameplay, I'd suggest just going for another one of the Warriors games.

TL;DR It's Berserk + Dynasty Warriors. What more could you want?

I absolutely love this game, but that may be because I love Berserk. It's hands down one of my favorite Anime/Mangas. I'm not however very well versed in the Dynasty Warrior style games, the only one I've ever played was Hyrule Warriors on the Wii U. So far this one seems to be up to the par that one set!

This is probably a half finished mess, but I'll try to explain some stuff.
------------
Story
------------
I haven't gotten far enough in the story yet to full judge this, but from what i've played so far, it follows the Golden Age Arc pretty faithfully, which is a huge plus. It's one of the more interesting and engaging stories I've seen before, and I don't at all mind playing through it, or watching it for the 100th time! Will probably update this part later.
------------
Mechanics
------------
The gameplay is solid, it follows almost all the same styles as hyrule warriors, you can dodge cancel out of heavy attacks to speed progress, you can cut down swathes of enemies with almost zero effort (the berserk way!), and the equipment system is very solid from what I've seen. While it seems like it's really simple, and you just hack your way through things, if you want to complete challenges you have to use time saving techniques and tricks.

Horses were added to this as well, which allow for even faster movement throughout the battlefield, which is something I've wanted in Hyrule Warriors.

The equipment system while not as robust as some of the one in hyrule warriors, which as weapons of varying degrees of power, I can see why they opted for an accessory system instead, it allows the characters to use their iconic weapons.
------------
Characters
------------
They're characters from berserk, they start off happy, and end up sad. Playing as some of my favorite characters though is great, I love Judeau and having the oppurtunity to play as him is great! I don't yet know how full the roster is going to be, but I'm really looking forward to playing them all.

Each character I've played has really felt like them. Guts has large sweeping attacks and slow charge attacks, Shierke has ranged and AOE magic effects. They don't really feel the same, and that's great.
------------
Voice Acting
------------
Sad that they didn't get the English voice actors from the anime, I know I know dubs and all that, but they are iconic, and very well done for a dub. I think it would be a lot more enjoyable, and better for new people to the series to not have to deal with a langage barrier. 
------------
Pretty Graphic Stuff
------------
If you are not a fan of rape portrayed in media, or the shear amount of blood an gore, stay away from this game, and probably the series.
------------
Cut Scenes
------------
I feel this might be one of the weaker parts, it feels like they just took  movie clips from the Golden Age Arc movies, which has a different style than the in game parts a lot of the time. It really breaks it. Other times it's a non 3d style, usually with close ups of just faces. It's a bit strange they chose to to that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198229047568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1487890318}
review: i personally love the beserk series (and i know ill get bashed for this) and even the season 2 for its raw and untamed behavior. if your into a game where your taking down armys with simple combos then it will be a great game. sadly out of my love for the show i bought it right away and may have made a mistake with my com specs. the game wigs out bad and i hope its just my com. i also hope the game holds to the story. sadly id like a refund. the show is all i need. but the game is still fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198264050513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1488856646}
review: Soy fanatico de la historia de Berserk y me emocione cuando salio este juego pues solo me toco jugar el de ps2 y les puedo decir que es muy superior a este en cuanto a jugabilidad, en cuanto a graficos este esta bien y la historia es fiel a la ova y al manga pero el juega es extremadamente facil y repetitivo que llega a aburrir despues de un rato, la batallas son flojas y no requieren de habilidad por parte del jugador, si eres fan de Berserk compralo pero cuando este con un descuento pues es tan repetitivo y facil que aburre rapidamente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119748150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1495610077}
review: Fans of Berserk and Musou games should have an enjoyable experience with Band of the Hawk. Of course, the game is not perfect. The number of playable characters is rather low and I would've liked to have the option to play as characters such as Skull Knight. The playable characters can also only be accessed by progressing through the main story so I was rather let down when I couldn't play as characters such as Zodd in the games free mode right away. For those who are familar with Musou games, repetition sets in rather quickly and this is what is going to either make or break the game for lots of people. Musou games have always been a guilty pleasure of mine so I find it rather fun but some may not be as forgiving. In summary, I woud recommend this game for the fans. If you are on the fence or haven't tried a musou style game, I'd wait for a drop in price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999724900', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1488219755}
review:
! AMAZING !

I got like the 3 first mangas of Berserk, and i really loved the vibe of the world. Really dark, i mean, it's like Conan and Silent Hill have a son, what's his name: BERSERK ! 

I was hesitating about buying game, because that kind of game (Dynasty warriors & cie) is kinda always the same. Bashing waves of pointless guys and that's all... But seeing all the good comments, it conviced me to buy it, and i absolutly dont regret it ! Not knowing the whole history made me enjoy the game a lot, because going through the game guaranted a lot of surpises. Ok, the gameplay is kinda the same as that kind of games, but the story is so freaking good that you just keep playing to know what's next. It's like being fan of a show like Walking Dead, GoT, etc: you just want to know what's next !!! The chars get new costumes, new mounts, new combos, etc so you always have something new to keep you excited. I only have ~10 hours on the game and i don't even made half of the game, the story is rich and cinematics make it greater.

So.... 

If you're a big fan of Berserk: BUY IT ! 
If you know Berserk, but that's all: BUY IT ! 
If you like Dynasty Warriors: BUY IT ! 
If you don't like any of these: SACRIFICE !

author: {'steamid': '76561197972397411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3376, 'last_played': 1553228468}
review:
You're going to have to stick to Skyrim mods if you want to kill children........

No skull Knight 
Can't play the game in 21:9 or any other aspect ratio than 16:9

They butchered the battle of Doldrey and when Guts takes on 100 men in the forest 
(don't even get to fight Samson he's completely missing from the game like many other characters)
They removed the part where Caska infiltrates Doldrey and what do you know it was released later as DLC with Horse DLC.

No English Dub despite most of the content used already being in english (why did it take them half a year to localise it then)
Can't even minimize the game or use windows keys like volume control without steam overlay and if you do minimize out most of the time the game doesn't even show up on the taskbar making it annoying to get back in the dam thing.....

Game is censored (we did get the dismemberment tho only when in berserk mode and only on certain NPC's)
Still better than other Warriors games but that not saying much
Only buy if you a Berserk fan as we will most likely be getting nothing else...

review: While I do enjoy Berserk, this game is straight up not good. You get maybe 10 hours of story mode gameplay plus however much time you choose to invest in endless mode. Cutscenes are ripped directly from the latest movie trilogy, and the gameplay becomes repetitive in minutes. I could see this being worth a pick up at around $25, but for $60? That price tag is standard for well polished releases of game with plentiful content. This game is neither of those things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052737626', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1588458290}
review:
What can I say? It's BERSERK at it's finest. Gamplay-wise, Koei Tecmo doesn't pull punches in the storytelling. The go into every detail without fail. I wouldv'e prefered they followed the style of the manga rather than the films so that content wouldnt be cut but for what there is, it's a lot of fun. I asked for a bloobath and I got just that; no complaint in that domain.

Aesthetic wise, I got to hand it to the KT team for what they've done witht he visuals. It may be 3D but it's the best 2D into 3D adapted work I've ever seen that looks clean and polished. Blood could use more detail rather than just being goop but when my whole screen is red, what do I care!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059859091', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1487799915}
review:
i love all dynasty warriors games. and im a massive anime fan. berserk is one of the best anime's to have ever been created. but this game? well the price tag for it alone makes it sketchy. 
the gameplay is your typical hack and slash. and its fun. alot of fun. 
i can't reccomend it though. 

from what i played and seen from this game. it seems empty. not alot of content and they are just pushing the name berserk and hardly any meat to go with it. 
i wanted to recomend this game. and i would. if the price was lower. 

I had no problems running the game. very well optimised. and it does follow the berserk lore very well. 
its the price and how much content you get with it that puts me off. 

THIS IS MORE OF A NEUTRAL REVIEW THAN A BAD ONE. 

If this game lowers in price pick it up without fail. but the price it is at? its just not worth it

review:
Pros
-It's Berserk. 
-It's a Berserk video game released on a system that isn't the fucking Dreamcast. 
-It's a Berserk MUSOU game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364263118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1488517529}
review:
A good game if you're a fan of the Berserk manga.

It's NOT worth $60 at all, so wait for a price drop or torrent this, otherwise you'll get cheated.

As far as PC performance goes my machine handled it at a solid 60fps without issues, although I'm apparently super lucky to have had 0 issues while playing. 

I'm kinda dissappointed with how lacking this game is in it's content, it has 2 modes, story and endless eclipse (free mode is replays of story missions with different characters therefore I don't count it as a separate mode). With how well packed other Warriors games are  this is honestly a letdown.

The big seller of this game is the story mode, which is very well handled here, you get about 90% of the manga covered in the game, and playing as different characters feels great since they each play slightly differently and have their own abilities.

Overall it's good at a price drop for a fan of the manga who wants to experience the story in a more interactive way, don't expect any multiplayer or other modes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041731496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 845, 'last_played': 1613366882}
review:
If you are a fan of the Berserk manga or anime, this is definitely a buy.

If you enjoy Dynasty Warriors games, this is more of the same except with an anime skin and a few extra goodies.
If you play a lot of DW and get burned out then you might want to wait to buy until the mood suits you.

If you are new to the manga/anime or DW then this is a game you might want to check out. It faithfully follows the source material and the gameplay is fast pace and brutal (also like the source material). The main drawback is that like most DW games, it can get repetitive BUT the game conveys, very well, that you are a powerful warrior. You FEEL powerful when playing which is how it is ment to be. When you finish Story Mode, check out Endless Eclipse. It is similar to Endless Tower from Mortal Kombat X in that you keep going for as long as you can and reap the rewards of how challenging it is.

Is Berserk and the Band of the Hawk a perfect game? No, however it is definitely fun and I have no regrets getting it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998329271', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2104, 'last_played': 1628541223}
review:
It's been ages since the last Berserk game...
And I gotta say, Samurai Warriors + Berserk is such an amazing combination.
Swinging the Dragonslayer through hordes of enemies feels pretty damn good. 
Although they skipped a good portion of the story and that I wish there was a few more playable characters, I'm really happy with this game and I think they did a fantastic job.
It has a fair price in my opinion, but there's no shame in waiting for a good sale to save some money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057218732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 1395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1395, 'last_played': 1488325090}
review:
[h1] Berserk, il capolavoro di Kentaro Miura, su PC. Parliamone...	[/h1]

[quote=Griffith] Per quanto siano irrealizzabili, la gente ama i sogni. Il sogno ci d√† forza e ci tormenta, ci fa vivere e ci uccide. E anche se ci abbandona, le sue ceneri rimangono sempre in fondo al cuore... fino alla morte.	[/quote]

Parlare di Berserk non √® facile. Non lo √® affatto. L'opera fumettistica creata da quel genio (svogliato) di Kentaro Miura √® diventata uno dei capisaldi della letteratura nipponica gi√† dal lontano 1988, anno in cui l'autore sconvolse il mondo intero: violento, brutale e oscuro, Berserk narra le vicende del guerriero nero Gatsu, formidabile spadaccino armato di una gigantesca spada e di una mano meccanica, che vaga solitario in cerca di vendetta verso dei terribili demoni...

Detta cos√¨ sembrerebbe un'incipit normalissimo, classico, direte voi. Ma no, Berserk √® molto, molto di pi√π. Per una questione di principio e sopratutto di rispetto, non ho la bench√® minima intezione di spoilerare nulla, anche perch√® sarebbe davvero un crimine precludere a qualcuno che si √® avvicinato da poco (o che per lo meno ha intenzione di farlo) a questa incredibile e coinvolgente storia...Quindi, recensione spoiler-free! 
[i]BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk	[/i] fa parte di uno dei generi pi√π controversi del mercato, ovverosia i [i] musou	[/i]: questo genere, nato con il celebre [i] Dynasty Warriors	[/i] √® molto amato dai giapponesi, e raccoglie una miriade di titoli, alcuni dei quali titoli con licenze parecchio "pesanti", come One Piece, Gundam, Zelda e ora anche Berserk. I musou sono un genere di nicchia, c'√® poco da fare, o ti piacciono o non ti piacciono, e io rientro pesantemente nella seconda categoria...MA. C'√® un MA grande come una casa, ovverosia che riesco a soprassedere a questo "odio" (non √® che li odio eh, sia chiaro, per√≤...) solo per un motivo, ossia Berserk. O One piece. O meglio ancora Ken Il Guerriero. Gi√† il solo fatto di poter interpretare Gatsu o Ken Shiro √® qualcosa di fottutamente esaltante, se poi il gioco, al di l√† del gameplay estremamente ripetitivo, √® curato parecchio dal punto di vista dei dettagli e della fedelt√† del brand a cui si ispira...Beh, promosso! Non a pieni voti, si intende, ma √® comunque promosso!
Il gioco non presenta molte modalit√† (tre in totale), ma solo lo story mode, da solo, porter√† via parecchie ore di gioco per il semplice fatto che copre quasi tutto il manga, dall'inizio e dall'epoca d'oro fino, pi√π o meno, ai capitoli pi√π recenti. Non male direi! La seconda modalit√† √® gioco libero, nella quale potremo ripetere tutti gli scenari con qualunque personaggio a nostra scelta e la ultima, la Endless Eclipse, √® una sorta di modalit√† senza fine ad obiettivi che ci permetter√† di sbloccare contenuti aggiuntivi e oggetti extra proseguendo di livello in livello. Questo √® quello che offre Berserk, in sostanza. 

[b] Badate bene: prima di acquistarlo date un'occhiata ad alcuni gameplay, il genere musou tende ad essere molto ripetitivo, e per evitare "brutte sorprese" √® meglio informarsi bene su cosa investirete i vostri denari! Vi allego qualche video trovato sul tubo:	[/b]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dkFB1bLQGec

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uGXIDEWRTH0

Ecco. Giusto per farvi capire bene che genere di gioco √®. Non √® un caso che ho detto "o lo ami o lo odi", perch√® non √® una tipologia di videogiochi che piacciono a molte persone, per l'appunto a causa della loro natura estremamente ripetitiva. 

Comunquesia, dal punto di vista del gameplay la struttura √® sempre quella: attacco pesante, attacco leggero, tasto per entrare in modalit√† "frenzy" (nella quale diventeremo pi√π forti), tasto per la parata e tasto per la schivata, oltre che il tasto per il lock e per utilizzare oggetti o armi secondarie. Zappando i nemici aumenteremo la barra del frenzy cos√¨ da poterla attivare, e se caricheremo la special potremo disintegrare qualsiasi cosa  davanti a noi. 
Le missioni sono tutte simili, alla fin fine, ma sono ovviamente contestualizzate alla storia e agli avvenimenti del manga, e rendono meno "pesante" il fatto di dover ripetere sempre le stesse azioni. 
Potremo inoltre equipaggiare degli oggetti che aumenteranno le statistiche dei nostri personaggi e potremo fonderli tra loro per ottenere rewards ancora pi√π potenti (ulteriormente potenziabili grazie a oggetti speciali e materiali). La formula dei musous alla fin fine √® sempre quella e non cambier√† mai, ma devo ammettere che con Berserk calza a pennello. Certo, avrei sicuramente preferito un gioco su licenza non di questo tipo, ma mi accontento. SOLO perch√® √® Berserk. 

Parliamo ora della cosa migliore, ovvero il comparto tecnico (le prestazioni le vedremo in basso, ho da dire un due cosette pure su quelle...). Graficamente √® su ottimi livelli, i modelli dei personaggi principali sono perfetti, pochi cazzi, il doppiaggio giapponese originale dei film animati fa la sua porca figura e le animazioni sono fatte bene, pochi cazzi; colonne sonore evocative tra l'epica cavalleresca e l'horror ci accompagnano in modo calzante, dando a Berserk la giusta atmosfera che si merita. Le cut-scenes inoltre sono tratte dai tre film animati usciti da pochi anni, e come intermezzo per spiegare le vicende (solo della prima parte, i film coprono solamente l'et√† dell'oro). 
Io quei tre film non √® che gli apprezzi granch√®, primo perch√® non sono una trasposizione fedele dal punto di vista delle emozioni (il manga √® su un altro pianeta, non ci sono cazzi, questo anime √® una versione di Berserk annacquata, edulcorata) e secondo perch√® inspiegabilmente sono met√† animate con disegni e met√† fatti in una cgi a tratti ridicola. Boh, sta cosa non l'ho mica capita, ma vabb√®, non √® il luogo adatto per parlarne...
Ah si, quegli infami della Omega hanno censurato tutte le parti di sesso dell'anime o di nudit√†, altra cosa che mi da parecchio fastidio.
Rimane comunque una visione gradevole, e per i fan che hanno adorato l'anime...beh, brodo di giuggiole everywhere!

[h1] Prestazioni con una GTX 1080 a 2560x1440	[/h1]

Con tutti i dettagli al massimo (set ULTRA) il gioco ha un framerate altalenante, scendendo anche a 30 fps...MA! 
Altro enorme e gigantesco MA: se in certi giochi la differenza tra 30 e 60 si sente eccome, qui no, anzi! Non preoccupatevi dei cali, l'esperienza non viene minimamente rovinata, anche perch√® l'azione di gioco non vi far√† sembrare nemmeno di scendere sotto i 50 o 40 fps! Andate tranquilli, dal punto di vista delle prestazioni il gioco √® promosso!

Berserk...Berserk...Ragazzi, io ve l'ho detto: siete fan dell'opera e sapete andare oltre il fatto che sia un musou? Compratelo, altrimenti statene alla larga... Ma cavolo, recuperate il manga. Il manga √® qualcosa di incredibile, monumentale, incredibilmente coinvolgente...Un capolavoro senza mezzi termini. Leggetelo, non ve ne pentirete!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027818377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1033, 'last_played': 1595305311}
review: If you like Berserk, and you like Dynasty warriors this game is easily worth 60. The story is there. The hordes of slaughter is there, and it just makes sense for Guts to be hacking and slashing through foes like butter. If you think the games easy while youre playing it switch to berserk difficulty. It isnt impossible hard but i do end up running out of my items by the end of some levels. 8/10 if youre a fan

author: {'steamid': '76561198043778627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1562, 'last_played': 1488916447}
review: It's too easy to be fun. It needed to either be twice as hard or twice as short. The highest difficulty is only a challenge for a while, but eventually you just get too strong. I feel like it's padded with extra missions to justify the $50-$60 price. If you want to get into Berserk, the scantalations are online, and this is bad starting point anyways. If you are a big enough fan to say "I don't care, I want to play as Guts", you aren't going to pay attention to this anyways. I would pick a neutral option if I could.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053234432', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1974, 'last_played': 1523391088}
review:
I have personally not played any Mosou/Warrior games other than the first One Piece: Pirate Warriors game, so I have little to no experience with this genre of games. But even so, as the setting is one of my favorite Manga series, I am absolutely loving the brutal bloodsheed that is [b]Berserk and the Band of the Hawk[/b].

The only things I am personally struggling with is massive fps loss at high graphic settings.
Also the fact that they (again) skipped the whole Elves of the Misty Valley arc :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198315598374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1488649207}

A typical fan service product: probably the best Berserk video game ever published, but nothing more than a classic Omega Force musou. KOEI didnt nothing diffrent this time , same engine , more polished but for most of us this is nothing diffrent than dynasty warrior game released each year over and over and over and over again!

Can someone tell me why im fighing possessed tigers and crocodiles in last chapters of the game  ?
5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197992281204', 'num_games_owned': 664, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1495552421}
