author: {'steamid': '76561198060921563', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 2758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1642493792}
review:
this game is absolutely brutal! i love it!
the one problem i have though is the framerate on my gtx 1080.
its absolutely bad and i cant see why.
this seems to be a common complaint though with the graphics card and this game.

other then the framerate you have to know that there is NO CO-OP no split screen nor online

the gameplay is the well known dynasty warriors style gameplay with a few tweaks that i personally love!
the game is not challenging whatsoever, but it is pretty awesome nonetheless. if you want some footage of it here you 
go! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vGYtuF0-jTA

a solid 8/10 for me, 10/10 if it had online co-op and stable framerate

author: {'steamid': '76561198060256260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1580230728}
review:
While I enjoy the story of Berserk and want to get my hands on everything related to it, I cannot recommend this game for PC unless you have a controller. The combat is a fun hack and slash, everything you could hope for from a 100 Man Slayer, and it has the Berserk story that you might want, but it's being marketed on the PC platform without a proper port (ie button tutorials that show up in game don't tell you the keyboard buttons, only the controller buttons). The graphics aren't amazing but they're not bad, they're good enough for all the blood that'll cover them up anyways. The price is definately to high for the terrible port, and should be a bit lower, perhaps even 30$.
In conclusion, if you enjoy hack and slash games and using a controller, this game might be for aside from it's price.
If you're a keyboard warrior, I'd suggest you stay clear of this until they add a patch or support the pc version better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979329101', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1487929576}
review:
If you like Berserk, and you like Musou's the game is totally worth it. If you don't like Musou's, and or do not even know what Berserk is then id wait for a sale, for sure.

Edit/Update: I played through the story campaign, and some of the endless eclipse (another mode) on PS4. I actually bought the Japanese version of the game, and played it before the NA version. Played the NA version as well on PS4. Forgot I even played the steam version until seeing that I posted a review not probably realizing it will show my time played. I had started & fully completed the story campaign on Hard difficulty before posting this review. I may buy the game on Steam again actually as I no longer own a PS4, and I miss playing as Zodd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043930222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 6279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2067, 'last_played': 1651271553}
review:
How do I describe what you do in the game? You play that guy with a huge greatsword and you get that nifty little Bar (lets call it the Berserk bar) that fills when you kill enemies. When it's full, you can activate it, gaining invincibility, stronger and faster attacks and the enemies are getting FUCKING DESTROYED. The more you activate the Berserk Mode, the stronger and faster your attacks get.

Basically, you are a junkie, but instead of drugs, you need BLUD. And it's glorious.

Don't expect anything big out of this game. It retells the story of berserk rather nicely, but only fans of the Manga or the Movies would care. If you want to be fucking invincible, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050449764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 4352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3784, 'last_played': 1654460455}
review:
[h1] Blood and Guts [/h1]
I'm not completely done with the Game, 
but i have the urge to write a review Right now and i already know the Story.

The Game itself if pretty much a Warrior Game as you know it, 
it feels great and it actually feels very "Berserk" if that's something one would say.
The swings of Guts swords just feel really good,
you kinda got this "Ugh, fuck yeah" feeling when you slash your way through your opponents.
Even though it is pretty easy to do so, i played on Hard and never struggled to survive,
even though on Berserker it's nearly impossible to play through from the Start.
The Endless Mode is pretty much just farming, 
but it's nice if you like the Gameplay and if you want better loot.
The accessories themselves are nothing special, but i really liked them.
Pushing your Attack power with an accessory that gives you +100 Attack and more just feels great!
Things like extra dodge invincibility and more reach are just very handy to have,
so i liked experimenting with and pushing my accessories to the limit.

The Story is not perfectly told and i would not recommend playing this Game as your first Berserk experience.
But the essential Plot points are there and i you read every mission briefing,
and the talks between the characters, i guess you would understand the Story pretty well.
It's also nice that they put in Scenes from the 3 Movies, 
i just read the Manga so it was cool to see some Animated Guts action.
The Game tells the Story to a Huge part (about half the Story Missions) just with Scenes from the Movies.
If you like that or not is your thing, but i enjoyed it very much.

After all, I am Happy that the Game came to PC, too much good Games for my taste, 
releasing for Consoles only at the moment and I am very Happy I Purchased it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970389264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1655219705}
review:
This is your typical 7/10 game. It is OK, but not amazing. It is a good time waster, but it lacks that special something that takes it beyond being a rather simplistic button masher with PS3 graphics. The game does nothing horribly wrong, but it doesn't do anything exceptionally well either.

Being a BERSERK game it's also rather tame and toned down. To a disappointing level, actually. BERSERK isn't for kids, so why tone down/skip all the best gore and cover up the ladies? I don't see why this PG13 release has an 18 rating.

In the end the game ended up being like I expected it to be (low-ish expectations). Falling short of what it could have been, but a fairly good, mindless button masher all the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017638132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1705240667}
review: Per me √® fantastico. Era da un paio d'anni che non giocavo 6 ore di fila ad un gioco... l'ho fatto oggi con berserk. Essendo un fan di Kentaro miura del bel bellissimo fumetto l'ho preso ad occhi chiusi e mi sono divertito da pazzi. Fantastici i video tra una missione e l'altra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020039225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1261, 'last_played': 1500663129}
review:
Just looking for another Musou game? Not a lot of variety in characters and weapons plus lack of CAW means you probably want to pass this one up
Finally want a goddamn Berserk game? This covers the majority of the plot, delivers all the blood & Guts you'd expect and it runs smooth to boot. Highly recommended, just make sure you have a pad at hand.
Want to sit back and watch that prancing fey git Griffith get ganged up on and abused like it's New Year's in Cologne? GOTY.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971027292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1489078192}
review:
Tbh this game is a bit repetitive in terms of gameplay, press button to SlashHackSlash but it's effing Berserk we're talking about here!! And pretty much let's you play all the famous characters.

If you're into the Berserk franchise and love Dynasty Warriors with its hackNslash kinda gameplay this is the game for you.

And Griffith did nothing wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988344849', 'num_games_owned': 1340, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1582063693}
review:
Warriors series + Berserk series = A BLOODY GOOD TIME

If you're a fan of either series then I feel that most people will find some enjoyment out of this title. It's a fast-paced hack 'n' slash adventure set in a dark fantasy universe. The weapons and abilities are big and powerful and feel very meaty when you're executing them. The voice acting is top-notch but requires you to not mind reading subtitles as all of the voice work is recorded in Japanese - this can be a minor issue during the heat of battle if you want to keep up with all of the story and dialogue between the various Berserk characters. This game also features anime cutscenes which are enjoyable to watch and a pleasant short break from the all-out action gameplay.

My only complaint so far is that I have a 1080 GTX graphics card and my frame-rate can often dip down to the low 40's when I should be able to maintain a stable 60 FPS otherwise. But this doesn't totally ruin the experience for me regardless, I just hope for a performance patch sometime soon.

Overall I rate 'BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk': 9/10
Highly recommended to fans of either the Warriors or Berserk series. If you're new to both but like what you see in gameplay and screenshots, I suggest possibly waiting for a 25%-off or higher sale price, as the standard price is quite high if you don't know what you're getting yourself into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139562533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1621619661}
review:
Personnellement je n'arrive pas √† trouver de d√©faut au jeux, c'√©tait tellement beau, j'ai m√™me vers√© une petite larme, apr√®s le jeux est r√©p√©titif, mais un "Musou" r√©p√©titif ... s√©rieux, √ßa serait vraiment pour chipoter et parcequ'on a rien trouver d'autre comme d√©fauts, comme le fait que certains passage soit censur√©, ok mais c'est un jeux japonais, on devrait s'estimer heureux d'avoir une version sp√©ciale pour nous, parce qu'√† premi√®re vue il ce sont pas fait chier pour les traductions, il y a √©norm√©ment de fans de Berserk en Allemagne, France et Espagne mais le jeux n'est traduit que en anglais (pour l'instant) mais la campagne publicitaire est bien faites en toutes les langues partout mais une seule traduction, et un jeu √† 60‚Ç¨, √† ce prix ils auraient gagn√© bcp plus d'argent avec une trad espagnol fran√ßaise et Allemande au minimum en plus de l'anglais. 
Quant au mode mode Endless eclipse, un r√©gale, rien √† dire de plus. Les graphismes et la B.O sont magnifique.

Bref comme dirai le Chef, c'est du Berserk, c'est "Orgasma Cosmico G√©nialement Enaurme'' et un tr√®s grand merci √† Koei, m√™me si le jeu n'est traduit qu'en anglais, disons nous que c'est toujours mieux qu'un simple import Japonais ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198057053212', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 952, 'last_played': 1488496533}
review:
O jogo √© tipo dynasty warriors 8 com mais grama e mais sangue 

O jogo √© legal, mas √© um musou beeem simples , conforme vc vai upando vai liberando alguns combos , mas nada absurdo
As anima√ß√µes e os modelos de personagens tao sensacionais, e os mapas t√£o mto bons tbm, bem fieis a serie 
agora a IA √© patetica, o jogo √© muito + facil do que DW , a Schierke mata qualquer coisa com 4 hits, e nada sobrevive a barra de especial , vc s√≥ apanha se parar de bater, e morrer √© impossivel, a nao ser q vc perca o objetivo 
spoiler: colocaram tentaculos pra censurar a casca pelada...me pareceu mais bizarro ainda 
Tem uns bugs de tela preta e o jogo crasha depois da primeira fase ( mas so caarregar os save e ir pra proxima ), e em algumas placas de video vc tem que desabilitar a folhagem pra ganhar fps 
A tradu√ßao da legenda ta meio ''Engrish'' , alguns erros e senten√ßas faltando, mas da pra entender o conceito ( provavelmente nao vao arrumar isso ) pq a gente ja sabe a historia de c√≥r 
N√£o √© o melhor musou de todos, mas √© o mais estiloso ( ou seria Dragon Quest Heroes? ) 
Ah, a trilha sonora √© mto boa 
ps: griffith nao fez nada de errado 
ps2: leia o manga
ps3: compre o jogo em promo√ßao 
ps4: tem roupa exclusiva q nao veio ainda pro pc 
ps5: da pra tirar o gore se vc for sensivel hohoho

eu daria no maximo uns 7/10 por ser fanboy de berserk

author: {'steamid': '76561197993896665', 'num_games_owned': 1023, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1562323983}
review: Currently they need to fix the oddly long loading times and rare crashes that happen. Game play is what you would expect from a "warriors" game. It follows the manga story, which is good but the game's plot is not as expansive and detail as you would get from reading the manga or watching the movies/show. Item system is a bit confusing and takes a bit to get used to it and manage it effectively. Definitely needs more enemy variation and a bit more combat actions. 6/10 (currently with bugs)

author: {'steamid': '76561197997097511', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1622197554}
review:
I am a big fan of the series.  This game is solid and the cutscene animation is awesome.  That's the good.
Now the bad.
This port has only Japanese voices.  A recommended compatibility setting for Windows 7 (doesn't do me any good, game still crashes frequently).  Missing Subtitles.  Many Spelling and gramatical errors.  Not a whole lot of gameplay variety.  If you are new to the story you will miss out on key things.  
I will not recommend this to anyone who is not a fan of the series.
To fans "Hai oh Forces"

author: {'steamid': '76561198053911859', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1677564282}
review: Berserk Warriors on PC runs great. Does not support mouse though. Also while the game is mostly hack n slash button mashing the developers know that the series as a whole is not just a reflection on that by also providing dialogue parts that match the length of the levels as well as showing off the characters in their respected spotlight. Though I havent beaten the game yet I can with confidence say they've done the golden age arc so much justice in just the couple of hours I've played helping me build a bond with these characters all over again. Worth the price if you're a hardcore fan. Wait till it goes on sale if you're not crazy about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002452055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 7348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4809, 'last_played': 1548380495}
review:
I'll start with my specs and settings for Berserk, cos it actually looks good and run smooth even on my mid HW:
CPU: ivy i5 3470
GPU: GF 960 4GB
RAM: 16 GB
drive: SSD HyperX Fury 250 GB

Settings:
1920 x 1080 60Hz, Full Screen
Environment: LOW (this setting actually affects FPS and it's not so much visible)
Depth of Field: OFF (i just hate this effect in any game)
Light Shafts: OFF (game actually looks better with this setting off)
Radial Blur: OFF
Everything else: ON + MAX

Berserk is one of my favorite anime / manga, but i think that this game is enjoyable even if you don't know much about Berserk series at all, because you can enjoy the epic story even more. But Berserk manga and anime is just awesome, so you should definitely read & watch it :)

Gameplay is classic "musou" style (if you have no idea what it is, it's about killing hordes of enemies, capturing bases and completing several tasks during battles), if you know Dynasty Warriors series, One Piece Pirate Warriors, etc, it's pretty much about the same, so do not expect some kind of epic RPG experience, this is action hack&slash musou game with soft RPG elements. Single missions are filled and connected with story movies and imo it just works great.

PROS:
Story contains:
- Golden age Arc
- Black Swordsman Arc
- Conviction Arc
- The Hawk of the Millennium Empire Arc
...so it's dark, epic, full of blood, death, love and philosophy :D
Gameplay - smooth, action and brutal bloodbath musou game with soft RPG elements such as level up system, upgradeable equipment (3 slots for acessories), secondary weapons, armors and mounts unlockables
Music - great
Voice acting - only JPN, but top notch

CONS:
Mounted combat - it's not actually bad, but it's just kinda weird (imo mounts moves too fast and feels kinda "soft"), i'd like it more "heavy" :)
Lip sync - kinda inaccurate sometimes

MISC:
Controls - i'm using my gamepad (Thrustmaster GPX Lightback) and it works just great, you can remap buttons without any problem. But i have no idea how / if it's playable on keyboard, because many ppl says that there is no mouse support.
Boss Fights - some boss fights are incredibly annoying. Not impossible or extremely hard, but just annoying because of skill spam mechanics .)

Overall: great and bloody musou game with Berserk universe settings. Best Berserk game ever :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198034484302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1487804622}

Needs keyboard and mouse support asap if it's going to be available for PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970965790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1548484104}
review:
EDIT.
Despues de unas cuantas horas, y medio juego pasado, he de reconsiderar mi analisis inicial. COMPRALO YA! que merece sobradamente la pena.
despues del tercer acto, justo despues del eclipse, el juego da un vuelco de calidad, los enemigos empiezan a meter estopa, y hay que empezar a pararse en los objetos que equipamos.
Poco a poco tendremos nuestro harem de personajes bien repleto, y llorareis por conseguir mas oro para subirlo de nivel, y probarlo en el modo eclipse!
DEJO AQUI ANALISIS INICIAL:
Bueno, por fin ha caido en mis manos este juego.
He de empezar diciendo que soy un gran fan de este manga/anime tanto por su tematica, como por sus personajes que me atrajeron desde que lei las primeras paginas a mis dulces 14 a√±itos, y como buen fan el Hype generado por este juego era muy alto... Realmente ha cumplido con las espectativas, y aun asi tiene sus peros...
La ia enemiga es de ni√±o autista, (demasiado sencillo, se quedan mirandome...) la banda sonora en general es muy buena, pero hay un par de temas, en los que no se si me estan llamando al timbre o me mandaron algo al movil, una cantidas de campanas y chirridos innecesarios de fondo, difuminados que empeoran bastante la atmosfera de juego.
Graficamente muy logrado, jugabilidad muy buena, de lo poco que llevo, creo que es bastamente rejugable, hay muchos personajes que sacar, y se pueden repetir todas las misiones... (y el modo eclipse.... brutal)
¬øes solo para fans?
Pues no, si te gusta este tipo de juegos, y disfrutas destrozando a lo loco bichejos.... animate pero yo esperaria a que bajara de precio

author: {'steamid': '76561198041511774', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1487797891}
review:
It is good Musou game, but horrible Berserk game.
No atmosphere, no challenge, no interest. If you just need to beat some dummies then maybe it will be ok for you. Prepare your X button.
But if you're fan (I'm HUGE fan of Berserk, it is my favorite work), buy it on sales maybe, not full price. That game like Berserk 2017 anime - made by people who does not give a F on Berserk.

review: Le jeu est cool et assez fid√®le au manga. Seul hic: la langue fran√ßaise inexistante pour les menus et les sous-titres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112838066', 'num_games_owned': 1428, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1658713273}
review:
one of the best warrior's spin offs to date, in multiple ways.
gameplay is satisfying and brutal, as well as having its own twists to the warrior's formula unlike any other spin off
while it suffers from some dificulty issues early on (of being too easy) it does grows more chalenging as the game progresses.
Sotry presentation as well is great, far better than most other warriors anime based spin offs; while a good ammount of it is due to the golden age Arc movies; even after those are done the high quality continues.
graphically wise it also looks amazing by warrior's standards and beyond.

and no this game DOES NOT USE ASSETS FROM THE RECENT ANIME, as MULTIPLE people seem to believe it does; in fact its 3d models and assets in general are far higher quality than those of the recent anime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065278149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1681084070}
review: Muy buenos graficos, jugabilidad tipo Warriors, universo Berserk, 10/10 para este genero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067530600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1517275407}
review: As a huge fan of Berserk, this is beyond fantastic. Not sure how the appeal will hold up for those new to the series, but fans will love this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025428478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1509671176}
review:
Runs smooth on my PC and Laptop. Solid 60 FPS (See profile for specs)

It's a bit repetitive, but I knew that was coming, it is a Warriors game after all. I haven't played one in a long time, so I was willing to put up with it for my favorite Manga/Anime series. Kinda sad there is no online mode, or even co-op, but I never took advantage of those in Warrior games of the past either.

I'm happy they got the voice actors from the Golden Age Arc movies, however.... it doesn't quite feel right and after some thinking I discovered why: The Music. The music isn't like in the old series or from the movies either. In fact, its very generic in this. I think the music from Berserk adds a lot to it, and it just isn't there with this game. Even still, its fun so far and I recommend it, perhaps on sale. Can anyone mod old Berserk music into it? Forces perhaps? =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198052260078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1197, 'last_played': 1521304051}
review:
It's not a bad game, but is made for fans only 

Sure it feels great to be Guts and slash hordes of enemies but the combat is way too simplistic, just a casual smash button, with no sense of timing or strategy whatsoever. The main issue wit the game it's that get repetitive fast.

I recommend it only hardcore Berserk fans. With so many good games out in the market, like Witcher 3 and Shadow of Mordor this game comes out as a lazy port (no support for mouse and camera control is awkhard through keyboard), so the gameplay may turn you off until you get Berserker Armor (where the funs really begins)

Perhaps the devs could done it so much better with some Devil May Cry touchs, but the game ends up being a simple three button smash and longs OVA cutscenes. 

7/10

Pros:

-Guts moves looks raw and brutal
- graphics are just fine
- Good FPS stability, considering the hordes of enemies in the screen.
- the whole Berserk universe depicted in a "anime like" way with the cinematics.

Cons:

- repetitive combat
- game way too simple
- not many movements or combos
- bad port (no mouse support)
- clunky camera control

review: Sad enough to say I couldn't even enjoy the game, soon as I booted it up it wanted me to run it in Windows 7 compatibility mode, so I did that. I started the game and it seemed sluggish but I figured the gameplay wouldn't be to bad. I was wrong noatter what I did as soon as the initial mission started the frame rates dropped significantly. Until they optimize it for windows 10 I do not recommend to anyone as it's unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060683546', 'num_games_owned': 1481, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1510697931}
review:
T√©ngase en cuenta que este es mi primer Warriors y como tal, no podr√© comparar con los anteriores.

BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk, es un juego de acci√≥n y hack and slash basado en el aclamado manga de Kentaro Miura; Berserk.
La mezcla de ambas sagas es muy beneficiosa para ambos extremos, pues la jugabilidad de Warriors con la manera de luchar de los personajes de Berserk, es una uni√≥n casi que natural.

Como fan de Berserk, compre el juego sin pensarlo, y ha resultado ser una maravilla. Es todo lo que esperaba y m√°s.
Las misiones pueden ser repetitivas, pero son bastante divertidas, y el replay value le da un plus.
Los personajes son variados y cuando sabes los combos que tienen y las sub armas que pueden usar, se te hacen m√°s variados.
El modo historia es un buen resumen del manga, y la utilizaci√≥n de las pel√≠culas como cinem√°ticas se agradece mucho.
Los modos de juego extra est√°n bien, siendo el m√°s destacable el modo Eclipse, donde el tiempo se te pasar√° muy r√°pido, y te divertir√°s mucho.

Los gr√°ficos est√°n bien, nada del otro mundo, pero el estilo art√≠stico de Berserk queda muy bien.
La banda sonora es espectacular.
Los controles son perfectos, por lo menos con un gamepad.

Hay algunos problemas de rendimiento, pero por lo general, bien.

author: {'steamid': '76561198349210699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1678991738}
review:
It's Berserk meets dynasty warriors. Simple as that. If you like either of those things I highly recommend this game. If you aren't interested in either you'll probably still find this enjoyable for the most part. Merging berserk with the musou style is kind of a match made in heaven. 

Berserk/Musou fans: 10/10
Not fans: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198046128052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1521638731}
review: If you like Warrior's games and you like Berserk pick this up

author: {'steamid': '76561198034859200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1527298752}
review:
Dynasty Warriors Berserk Edition!

This should be the actual title of this game since Berserk and the Band of the Hawk is kinda misleading and people unfamiliar with the Berserk lore will think that the main protagonist Guts, is called Berserk same as with Link not being Zelda and Samus not being Metroid.

Nevertheless as mentioned in the title, Koei Tecmo pretty much used their Dynasty Warrior template and emulated it to create this game. The game itself is pretty decent thou, the characters animations look great and fluid and the over 2 hours anime cutscenes offer a great deal of backstory. The soundtrack is also quite good surprisingly.

This game is in japanese only with english subtitles of course and personally I don't mind it since I am used to watched subbed anime all the time but I know some people will get angry because it doesn't offer an english dub. Overal great fun so far since there aren't many Berserk games aside from the old Dreamcast game Berserk Guts Rage and the japanese only PS2 title Berserk Milenium Falcon aside from that I am glad to see this game on the PC and therefor would recommend it to any fan of the Dynasty Warrior games or of course Berserk fans. Final score 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198019214620', 'num_games_owned': 2237, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1532418836}

author: {'steamid': '76561198165619197', 'num_games_owned': 863, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 2142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1593, 'last_played': 1538660142}
review:
I don't understand the outrage of many regarding the absence of a mouse. It has never been present in the Dynasty Warriors series. And a joystick can be purchased for the price of this game. So it's not a problem at all.

Regarding the game itself, it's damn cool, the Dynasty Warriors series is unrecognizable. The graphics are pleasant, even ordinary mobs now have different faces, and there is some destructibility on the levels - in general, progress.

I've only tried the story mode so far, which is accompanied by full-length anime inserts. It's done great and fresh.

The music is also magnificent. They tried to maintain the same level of quality as the soundtracks from the full-length anime. Of course, it's hard to compete against the full-length anime soundtracks with their entire orchestra. But it's still good, and it fits well with killing waves of small fry/bosses.

Overall, the game is for Berserk fans, of which I am one. But for someone, this game may become an introduction to a new manga/anime. Definitely a 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005323053', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1611902122}
review:
Some of the most fun I've had with a 'Warriors' title besides playing Dynasty Warriors 4 on the PS2 as a lil' boy. I say that because the only others i've touched were DW3, GW, and DW7.

Story: 
Is awesome; it's fuckin' Berserk!
It skips over quite a few subjectively minor details like Casca's period, Casca's rape, boobs, and even blotches out scenes like Corkus and Pippin dying. Not particularily integral scenes to the story, but I can see why people might get upset at the censorship (albeit they had to, to avoid AO rating on a niche game that probably wasn't going to do financially well anyway).


Gameplay:
The gameplay is actually really great. It's addicting to run into a crowd of 100 people with my rage-o-meter charged and just slice people to bits. The sound design and the visuals of doing so are just so right that it scratches an itch everytime. My only complaint is that you practically just spam a list of 5 combos and some offshoots of them for every single fight in the game (as guts at least; Zodd when I played him for a few minutes had some slightly different button combos). It gets tedious and tires your fingers a little, but that brings me to the next point.
Costumes are a thing in this game, and they aren't just visual; they change your character's gameplay, albeit not too much. As you progress through the story as Guts, you get all of his armor, his gimps, and yes, even his badass weapons. The Dragonslayer is quite a bit different to use than the greatsword, and rightly so. It was such a refreshment to move on to the Conviction Arc with a bunch of new things to use. You also get Guts' handcannon and his crossbow; perfect for crowd control, and you eventually get to unlock the Berserker Armor, along with Berserker Rage, which is devastating compared to anything else in the game.

Length-wise, i'm 6 hours in and at the start of the Black Swordsman Arc (or rather, right after the Golden Age Arc), and right before the Conviction Arc. That's pretty damn good, and as far as I am aware of, it goes all the way to the end of the Falcon of the Millenium Arc (yes, including the Berserker Armor). So if you want to play the game only to play strictly the story, it will last you roughly 12-15 hours. Might be too little for $60, but it also includes a 100 Layer Endless Eclipse Mode that you can play through as 8 different characters, all with different goals and special unlocks for beating it.

Modes:
There's two of 'em, and they are Free Play (which speaks for itself), and Endless Eclipse, a 100-Layer thick survival mode, where you go from level to level endlessly cutting down baddies and doing small sidequests, each layer harder than the last (even if slightly). I played through Zodd on my first 10 layers, and I must say it was rather fun if you want to mindlessly hack'n'slash in the Eclipse world.

Actual Problems:
The few problems worth noting are the lack of KB/M support (which I had absolutely no problem with, for I own a XBO controller and a Steam Controller; both working great on this), which I can see as being a deal breaker for some, and the lack of English Dub, which I can understand for the last half of the game, but I wouldn't mind if the first half had an optional "Ayy you can listen to the most in-depth part of the story in English, but later on it swaps over to Japanese, you OK with this, or just want to stick with subtitles?". It gets rather annoying looking down while fighting to see what the hell anyone is even saying.

Overall, it's a solid 8/10 from me for sure.

The TL;DR for ya':
"A very satisfying game with large battles, yet ever so slightly repetitive hack-n-slash combat, with the two problems most common in Japanese games released in the West."

author: {'steamid': '76561198051323859', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2447, 'last_played': 1489954687}
review:
So lest get Started:

The Story is the closest thing after the manga but unfortunately with not enough gore and nudity.
It follows the main story pretty well and most of the major bosses are well done.

The Combat is the typical Dynasty warrior style, but gets more fun with the different weapons.
Play on Berserk difficulty to experience the true "Berserk" action.
Still it get easier because of the gear which is OP if you get the right stats.

Visually it is very pleasing with the raw destruction, also you get to see the 3 Berserk movies which is a big plus.

I haven't experienced any technical issues up until now so it is safe to say the port is good.

Overall there are too little playable characters and the censure is killing it but you get the story up until the ship so that alone is a must buy for any Berserker fan!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987363968', 'num_games_owned': 1411, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 865, 'last_played': 1493446953}
review:
Did you enjoy the PS2 game, but felt like it needed a point?  Well, here it is: it's the PS2 game, only it isn't irritating to play.  It's got everything you want: all the voice actors, the bad recent anime cutscenes, and also, thieves.

There are a lot of thieves.

There are so many thieves.

-=-

This game has a few problems.  Frankly, when you fight bosses, it does not feel good.  It is not very fun.  The bosses don't work well with this sort of engine, with this sort of genre.  The dodging is sub-par, and, in general, the entire game feels very slipshod.

But when it works, ho, baby, does it work.

review:
Having got into Berserk recently over Christmas, this game is so much fun. Each character feels really satisfying to play when they're splitting faceless soldiers in half, especially Guts. Only gripe is there's less playable characters than I hoped for  (Read: Skull Knight) but it's honestly a fun time and well worth it for me, personally.

In short: If you like Warriors games and Berserk, buy it. If you at least like Berserk, give it a shot from a friend's copy or something.

review:
I know this story. I like this game as it goes so far.

However, there are two major flaws:
 - This game is dumb port from console, don't even try to play it without gamepad. No mouse control whatsoever, keyboard adaptation is just too bad. This game control wasn't mean for PC. Even every tip will show you buttons only for controller.
 - Game like to crash after some missions, lucky enough every crash I've faced was after mission and progress was saved.

So why not? Because this game is ain't for PC. Sad, but true.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044239866', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1603250459}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198070134646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4, 'last_played': 1487729037}
review:
expected Berserk game, got warriors: Berserk.

explanation: This game looks like the Berserk anime and is honestly a solid game. And that is really it's achilles heel. It is a well made Warriors game, not a Berserk game by any stretch of definition. 

what do I mean? 

Dark Souls is what I mean. I stumbled upon the Berserk movies first, then the anime, then the manga, and then decided I couldn't possibly read the manga, just not my thing. Dark Souls was the answer, a game, heavily inspired by Berserk with all the details right, except the name and story. Those details are what I'm referring to when I say this game just doesn't have the soul of Berserk. The fighting that is so close and visceral, one inch from death at any moment. The first level of this game, even on Berserk difficulty was laughably easy. A kid mashing buttons could have finished it. 

Bottom line if you got this far without raging: 

Game is great if you just want a Warriors game skinned like Berserk. If you are really looking for an experience that mimics the feel of Berserk try Dark Souls if you haven't already.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970600011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1488064329}
review:
Do I recommend it? Of course!
You can play GUTS for real this time! No more cosplaying as Guts in other games, just buy this one instead!


On serious note:

If you like the Dynasty Warriors series you will like this game as well. + Bonus if you are a Berserk fan. 
The game plays the same like Dynasty Warriors series.
Some people have controller issues but it works fine with xbox one controller.
On startup you get a prompt to start in win7 mode but you can just press no and launch the game. 
I have win10 and no issues so far. 

Playing on 1440P with everything max gets me around 50fps (GTX 1070). At the moment the only way to get 60fps is set environment to low. More people has this issue.

Having fun so far and It feels so good whacking these maggots with my large hunk of Iron.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129501715', 'num_games_owned': 1155, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1160, 'last_played': 1514560094}
review:
[h1]¬øTe gusta Berserk y los juegos tipo "musou"? Entonces no te lo pienses y C√ìMPRALO YA.[/h1]

Me pill√© este juego el d√≠a de salida e hice el an√°lisis al d√≠a siguiente, as√≠ que ahora que tengo pr√°cticamente acabado el modo historia y probado el resto de modos le har√© unas peque√±as modificaciones a lo que escrib√≠ en su d√≠a.

Nunca me llamaron la atenci√≥n los juegos de este estilo, pienso que a larga la jugabilidad puede llegar a ser algo repetitiva, aunque el control del personaje y la c√°mara es buena, aunque mejorable (destaco que es algo tosca cuando luchas en caballo). Pero siendo Berserk mi manga/anime favorito era una compra obligatoria y no me arrepiento de haberla hecho. Es la mejor adaptaci√≥n a videojuego que han hecho (tambi√©n hay un par de entregas m√°s, aunque con bastantes a√±os ya: Dreamcast y PS2)

Se puede controlar a varios [b][u]personajes[/u][/b] (Guts, Griffith, Casca, Judeau, Zodd, Wyald, Serpico y Schierke) cada uno con sus combos y armas. Tambi√©n se pueden mejorar las habilidades y el equipo. La [b][u]dificultad[/u][/b] del modo historia aumenta progresivamente conforme avances en las misiones. Aunque antes de eso te deja elegir entre 4 niveles, yo solamente lo jugu√© en modo normal y las misiones son asequibles hasta en el m√°ximo grado. 

La [b][u]historia[/u][/b] del juego se va narrando a trav√©s de di√°logos entre personajes y escenas sacadas de las pel√≠culas, as√≠ que si no est√°s muy puesto en este universo y no se te da bien el ingl√©s NO te recomiendo su compra. Estar√≠a genial que en un futuro se implementaran otros idiomas, ya que solo cuenta con este idioma en los subt√≠tulos. A parte del modo historia, tambi√©n tiene [b][u]dos modos m√°s[/u][/b]: Free y Eclipse. El primero te permite jugar las misiones del modo historia con otros personajes y el segundo tienes que sobrevivir a oleadas infinitas de enemigos.

Un punto a destacar son los combates con los Ap√≥stoles, personalmente me han gustado y desprenden un toque de epicidad. Me quedo con las batallas contra Zodd, mi Ap√≥stol favorito sin ninguna duda.

[b][u]Gr√°ficamente[/u][/b] el juego est√° m√°s que aceptable, suficiente para un juego de estas caracter√≠sticas. No esperes gr√°ficos realistas ni de √∫ltima generaci√≥n. En cuanto al rendimiento, de momento con una GTX 660 se puede mover a una tasa de 60fps en 1080p con filtros en bajo, aunque con peque√±as bajadas. 

Objetivamente hablando, el juego no es sobresaliente, pero s√≠ es notable. Hay m√°s juegos de este g√©nero mejores que este, pero lo que hace que sea especial es su universo. Si eres seguidor del manga/anime al menos merece que le des la oportunidad. Y si no lo eres pues no s√© qu√© haces que no te est√°s poniendo a leer ya el manga!

PD: Estar√≠a genial que le a√±adieran cromos, tener a Guts de fondo en Steam o alg√∫n emoticono debe de estar brutal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006648510', 'num_games_owned': 1326, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 2801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1777, 'last_played': 1504833704}
review:
Berserk seems like the most obvious choice for a Musou game and I'm surprised it took this long for it to happen, but god damn am I glad it did.

The port is flawless, the controls are super tight, and the combat is satisfying and weighty (it's also worth mentioning that contrary to speculation prior to the game's western release, there [i]is[/i] dismemberment).

This is well worth picking up if you're into Berserk, but one thing I will say is that you should definitely read the manga first - a video game is never going to be able to cover the full scope and depth of Berserk's story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089358900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1487720680}
review:
Bueno va la primera rese√±a.

favor de tener en cuenta que agrego comentarios que nutren a la rese√±a al final de la misma ¬¨¬¨ lo del manga est√° ah√≠ :3

Berserk para los que no est√°n enterados est√° basado en un anime hom√≥nimo, el cu√°l ya vi, el juego en s√≠ obedece y logra a trav√©s de cinematicas apegarse como nada en este mundo a la serie de la que surge, con grandes mapas, y muchos enemigos en pantalla nos encontramos a una mec√°nica de juego bastante sencilla, la cosa que a mi parecer no cumple es la complejidad, en menos de media hora ya ten√≠a muy bien hecha la idea de como era el combate, vamos quitando lo m√°s grave de enfrente, tu personaje no bloquea ataques, nunca, bajo ning√∫n concepto, esto al inicio no va a ser un problema, pens√©, error, a los 40 mins de juego ya estaba harto de solo presionar X y Y a diestra y siniestra, y a pesar de que los gr√°ficos no son los mejores del mundo no me import√≥ en lo m√≠nimo porque el Eye candy no es muy lo m√≠o, sin embargo esperaba un desaf√≠o importante a la hora de los conflictos que es sobre lo que gira el juego en s√≠, combates. pero supongo que la compa√±ia hizo un esfuerzo por que su curva de aprendizaje fuese sencilla, lo lograron.

-Audio: actualmente es japon√©s con los artistas originales de la serie (cosa que agradezco personalmente) con subtitulos en ingl√©s que no es un rpoblema para m√≠

-La m√∫sica es emocionante y bien entonada con los catorrazos que repartes, el FX de los golpes, espadas chocando y sangre entre otros (la cu√°l abunda) es satisfactorio y ambienta muy bien

-Video: como ya dije anteriormente las texturas no son muy detalladas y es un poco caricaturesco, sin embargo esto no lo tomo muy pesado porque tiene buen margen de color, se acartona pero sigue sin importar mucho ya que se ve suprimido por una movilidad muy √°gil del personaje, cosa que por lo menos es sabia dado que la m√°quina trabaja menos en √©ste sentido.

-Historia: es una versi√≥n extendida de Berserk, para los die hard fans les va a encantar, (Pippin habla m√°s de una l√≠nea)

-Jugabilidad: es demasiado sencillo, las decisiones complicadas se tomaban en el men√∫ de inventario y s√≥lo pod√≠a decidir entre tomar o dejar algunos anillos que te dan ciertos power ups pero nada que tenga mucho peso al momento de los golpes.

si est√°s m√°s por la historia que por el juego adelante, creo que cumple y llena de felicidad ver un juego que se apega de ese grado a la historia original (basandonos en el anime) pero si quieres un nuevo modo de combate y estrresarte por vencer a ese soldado que siempre puede bloquear tus ataques o pegarte mientras ejecutabas un sablazo espectacular pasa de largo, no dej√© de pensar en juegos como Dante o Spartan total war.

Agregado /comentario an√≥nimo 1ro en lista :
existe un Manga que se extiende m√°s de lo que indica el juego, que es lo que da la escencia a Berserk. no agrego el nombre del participe pero se agradece la cooperaci√≥n!

Agregado / comentario de Xelion:
"De todas formas entiendo que el sist de combate entonces es fiel a los Dynasty Warriors por lo que no lo veo como algo negativo, para mi es algo positivo poder controlar a Guts en un juego as√≠" 

Estoy de acuerdo, de hecho el impulso que me llev√≥ a comprar el juego en primera instancia fue partir cr√°neso tal y como guts, pero no pude sobrellevar el hecho de no sentir que mi personaje puede morir al no llevarlo cabalmente como peleador al punto de la historia d√≥nde surge √©sta habilidad que solo guts puede hacer ¬øsabes? es como algo que me hubiera latido, tener ese desaf√≠o, pero a fin de cuentas a cada uno nos gustan cosas distintas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071439298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1488408496}
review:
I think this will be my first review of any game on Steam, or at least one of the very few I do.

How to start... Since this game is released at the same time as the console counterparts, I don't think of this as a regular port, so the game mechanics seems to be working without any problems for me, just make sure you have a computer who can run it with decent specs.

Right, that out of the way... First a few things.
I am a Koei Temco fan since their first 3 Kingdoms games, Uncharted Waters series, and lastly their Dynasty series. And also I'm a HUGE Berserk fan. I read the manga even before it was made into an anime, and the fact that they use the original voice actors in the game is a nice nostalgic touch to me. And Koei DOES a good job in implementing their Dynasty engine within the Berserk story, also it seems the game follows the books and not the anime, for those who doesn't know the difference, the anime has certain elements cut off and made shorter, so seeing Puck at the loading screen filled me with a small grin to be honest.

That aside.... I wish I could praise the game a whole lot more, however I may have had too much expectations for the game, but don't get me wrong, it's a good game by itself. However as stated earlier, this game follows the Dynasty hack and slash gameplay and level up system, which can be kinda repetative if you played a lot of their games sadly. But this shouldn't discourage any fans of the Dynasty series to not try it out, because it IS indeed worth it... if you like the Dynasty gameplay and am a Berserk fan, or even to those new tot he series.

So why my overhyped expectations you may ask? Well some may not know this, but there was a previous Berserk game released on the PS2 years ago only in the Japanese market. I got an import copy of the game and I have to kinda say.... The game play in the ancient PS2 game... is infact better, and that was the system I had hope of being renewed.

In this game I've just defeated Zodd to make sure they are different before makign this review, and yes it is vastly different. You can YouTube the gameplay for the PS2 to see the Zodd fight there.

While this game you just need to hack away at the enemy while keeping an eye on your health and you'll be golden. While the PS2 game was.... how to say.... more 'dynamic'? During a fight in the PS2 version you could trigger certain combos not usually available for massive damage if you fullfilled certain requirements. Like with Zodd you'd both attack which would end up in a deadlock parry which I've not seen in the recent Dynasty games when I think of it. That aside, in the PS2 version, once in a deadlock, you could press a button to make Guts climb up on Zodd to fire his hand canon into Zodd's mouth mor massive damage. And this wasn't only on boss fights, but regular fights as well, and I just kinda miss that and half expected that to return as I haven't seen any other games like that come out of Japan.

Also the leveling system in the PS2 was better. Here you just level up as in the Dynasty series, and while that isn't bad.... I just expected more. In the PS2 you got stat points you'd invest as in other RPG games that not only would increase various stats, but also Gut's swing speed which I haven't seen in this game, and also various power ups would change Gut's stance, walk speed, and attack speed. all which I thought was better in the old game, and don't get me started on the Berserker armor, but I'm not that far in the current game, so if things change, I might have to edit my current review.

Bottom line... Great Dynasty style Berserk game, but if like me, you have played the older game, you might get a bit dissapointed. And I just wished that Koei actually took a few of their guys to play the old game before they started making this.

review: Personally I really like the mechanics of the game. review:
it's good shit.  if you're looking for berserk + the warriors series, this fits the bill.  a stable framerate, classic dynasty warriors experience with a faithful and satisfying berserk setting.  only three hours deep, about half way through the golden age, but the replayability is already strong.  fight zodd the immortal with lil' mercenary guts and WHIP HIS MONKEY ASS.  

all in all, definitely worth the $60 if you're a fan of berserk and the dynasty warriors series, or the fist of the north star games by tecmo koei.  put your grasses on and smash the shit out of hoards of knights and demons, struggler.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981776655', 'num_games_owned': 516, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1007, 'last_played': 1491686057}
review:
[i]GRIFFIIIIITH ![/i]
[h1]This is a truly AMAZING Berserk game and the best Musou so far, it's also faithful to the anime/manga.[/h1]

Do you enjoy Musou games, like Dynasty Warriors? Then you most likely want to get this.
I've been a huge Berserk fan for over 15 years and I had been waiting for a new game for a long time. Last one was from PS2 era. It made me so happy to know that there is a new game coming FINALLY and for Steam omg <(^_^)>!

If someone wonders what Berserk is, well it's the most EPIC, emotional and dark stories ever told. An old manga made by Kentaro Miura, which still isn't finished. It tells the tragic journey of Guts, who is on a path of a bloody vengeance towards a character called Griffith. There is a very good reason for his hatred and it is shown to the player. I saw the original anime when I was younger and it was so fucking cool and made me read the manga, which is a masterpiece.  This is the thing that inspired my favorite games like Dark Souls for example and many other games/mangas with huge swords.

The game runs flawlessly for me so the port is hella good. Pretty much only problem I had at start was that I couldn't get my Xbox1 controller to work, but it can be fixed. I played with keyboard and mouse, which I am not used to with these games, buuuut it works also quite well. There is only Japanese voice acting, which is better than English imo. Also for some reason launching it recommends you to play in WIndows 7 compatibility, which can be switched when you start playing.

Story follows the anime/manga in a fantastic way and starts with the Golden Age Arc with younger Guts, showing later how he becomes the Black Swordsman. His character development is incredible. Parts of the story always give the feels... If you aren't familiar with the series at all, I think you can start with this. Because the game also uses a lot of parts from the quite new movie trilogy to progress the story, which is such a cool  thing to do so we can see certain scenes better when it mix like that. 

No FPS drops, there is awesome music (it's no Susumu Hirasawa quality though), multiple characters to play, equipments to get after completing missions and to upgrade, items to buy, lots of enemies flying around from hits, different combos, more characters unlocks the further you play and fighting can be a bit repetitive as you know from your typical Musou games. Still, this has a different feeling, 'cause it is badass, bloody and Berserk. 
It feels so cool to swing your sword and beat the shit outta of zillion enemies, especially with the Dragonslayer. I recommend this especially to fans. Also it seems that some people have slight problems with the game though, fps drops etc. So if you aren't sure that can you play it well, I guess you can wait for a price drop.

I love playing this so much <3 and feels great to experience the journey again... Time for some manly tears in a certain moment.

P.S. I managed to fix my Xbox1 controller problem. All I had to do is connect the controller to PC before starting the game and then it works.
P.S.S. The game could use some good old music from Susumu Hirasawa (put this to play at the end of Golden Age Arc 3) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew3--XVFioU

"So put your grasses on, nothing will be wrong..."

author: {'steamid': '76561198035391503', 'num_games_owned': 859, 'num_reviews': 467, 'playtime_forever': 2928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1520, 'last_played': 1587581348}
review:
musou and Berserk combined.
two things i really like.
its awesome.

Graphics : 9/10
Gameplay : 9/10 (if you like the musou genre)
Story: 10/10 (srsly)
Port: 7/10 (no mouse support, and fps issues on Ultra, no issues on high, 50-60 fps)
Content: 8/10 

I'm really happy that more and more KT/musou style games are comming to PC.
Just a reminder, i know that musou games arent for everyone. But for people who like this genre, this should be a direct buy. like now, in an instant. c'mon? just do it ! so i gladly support these ports. May more come in the future !
(i'm looking at you musou stars, and i know senada maru already got confirmed so HYPE).

So for people who are a die hard fan of Berserk, or really like the musou genre, just do it.
If you want to try a musou game, i would def. try it. or other musou titles already on steam.

Thx KT, and sorry for the bad english.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116100475', 'num_games_owned': 4782, 'num_reviews': 597, 'playtime_forever': 1299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1299, 'last_played': 1488304406}
review:
[h1] Someone told me that BERSERK is coming to Steam and i was like: "Huh... the... what?" [/h1]

Yes I didn't know anything about this series yet, still I'm a huge fan out of nowhere.
I've watched the Anime from 1997-1998 (Those 25 episodes) in two days. And I'm not nearly and anime Fan at all. But holy This Series is AMAZING! Clang!
The Game is a Hack'n Slash type of Game like Dynasty Warriors. So if you're not a huge Fan of Dynasty Warriors at all, let me get this out of the way, that Game is nothing for you, when it comes to Gameplay.

Storywise its top-knoch. Story is getting told via In the Anime Berserk from 1997‚Äì1998, but Cutscenes are out of the Movie.

You're getting Equipments after every Mission and chests dropping Equipment as well.
You can Upgrade your Stuff or Enhance it / Sell it and buy better stuff, like Accessoire's.

The Game runs stable at 60 FPS, not Frame-Drops at all.

My Specs:
i7 4770k @ 3,50ghz
GTX 1070 EVGA SC
16gb DDR3 RAM


Key Bindings are actually pretty decent, not like other Games...
It feels so damn good to Slash into Horde's of Enemys with Guts, goddamnit.

If you're a Fan of Berserk and you like Dynasty Warrior, GIVE IT A SHOT AND BUY IT!!!
You won't regret it. :)

[h1] And now let me continue to play this wonderful Hack'n Slash BERSERK GAME!!!! [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197993598001', 'num_games_owned': 985, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2339, 'last_played': 1491843767}
review:
Hello Everyone, 

This is Zagnaphein and hopefully you got some time to Read this Review!

After spending around 24 hours in the game i will say the Pro's the Con's and what you should expect!

When i received the game i was curious, i have thought Berserk could make a decent Game but would the Warriors Franchise be the one to embrace it?

Apparently it is! 
There is lots of fight and action in this game! 

It follow's Faithfully the Guts and The band of the Hawk moments and proceeds smoothly during the high's and lows of Berserk Franchise!

The Game support 1080 HD + 60 FPS (i would suggest having a decent pc if u want to embrace the whole feeling! Dont forget a warrior's game always has many many many enemies to slay)

Music and feeling brings you the Good Ol' Days of Berserk! (Not the CGI Cringefest we got) 

Nudity? Check
Blood and Gore ? Check!
Guts Slaying 1000 Men in 1 place ? Check

12/10 Would Berserk Again!

I am not much of a Steam Reviewer but i am a Youtuber/Streamer! Words transpire differently so i really hope i can convince you to give this game a Try! 

Also if you are Interested i am making a full Play through Series of the Game in my channel so if you want to give it a Go Just Click this Link! Everyday a new episode will be uploaded!
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjWVW_3ll2fGYrewVTrMjFM9ILhVGt0GW
